Molly heads to the window. "It's Billy," she growls, "great, knowing him, he's going to want to blackmail me about this later."

Amanda shakes her head, "now what?"

Molly chews her lip, "well, I would guess he'll come after me later. So, we should start planning now."
134211111112222.title: Little problem.

choices: You respond with anger  (Making Molly Mad)
1342111112.content:
Molly smiles, but she shakes her head.
"I'm sorry Keane, but I think you had better stay with me."
She picks you up and strokes you, her paws giving you an incredible massage. Suddenly, her words register.
"Why, I've got to go home! I've got a life to live!" You are indignant. Molly looks at you sadly.
"I'm afraid you can't. Transports from your world to ours cause shrinking. If you went back to your world, you'd be microscopic. Shrinking is irreversible. I'm sorry Keane. Also, many wolves like to eat humans, and there are other things to. You need to stay as my pet; you will only be safe with me." You look up at her in shock. You mind has a hard time comprehending this development. You’re stuck this size forever, you can't go home and you're only safe as a teenager's pet.
1342111112.title: The shocking truth

choices: Molly calms down and feels sorry for you.
Molly gets madder and lays down the law.
13421111121.content:
"No way!" you shout.
You push away Molly's paw and throw bits of food at her, making her gasp.
"I can't be your stupid pet! I just can't!"
Molly's eyes lose their gentle gaze. "But you have to! It's the only way that you'll be safe!"
"Don't you get it? I have friends and family! I have a future ahead of me! I have a life that is only just beginning, just like you! I can't stay here!"
Molly glares at you with annoyance and anger. "There's nothing I can do! I'm just giving you the hard facts. You'll be killed if you don't stay with me!"
"Maybe I'd rather that than staying with you!"
Molly's anger deepens and she begins to growl. The low rumbling from her throat and her bared teeth give you a pang of fear, but you shake it off. You stomp your foot and walk away from her.
Molly sighs with frustration. "You silly human! You don't even know what's good for you! I thought everyone was wrong about humans being stupid, but I guess they were right!"
Molly's insult, coupled with your shocking situation, suddenly overwhelm you, and tears stream down your cheeks. "I hate you! I hate this world and everyone in it! I hate everything!"
Sobbing, you run to the end of the bed and start climbing down the overhanging sheets.
13421111121.title: You can't handle the truth

134211111211.content:
When you get to the edge of Molly’s bed and look over the side you realize how small you actually are in this world. You start to lose your nerve when you figure that if you fell from that height you’d probably die a slow and painful death... something you aren’t ready for just yet.
Once again you’re overcome with a feeling of helplessness and you sit down and cry on the edge of the Molly’s bed.
Molly looks over at you and feel’s an immense sence of guilt about the way this has unfolded.
“Oh, Keane. I’m so sorry... I... I didn’t mean to upset you,” she says while inching over towards you.
You feel her start to stroke your back again. “I can even imagine how hard this must be for you Keane.”
You turn around and look up into her now soft and caring eyes. “Molly, I...” you start to say. But she responds “Its ok Keane... Listen I’m sorry but I can’t let you go.” She says while picking you up and cradling you.
“I understand Molly. I’m just gonna need some time to get adjusted,” you say to her while burring your face in her fur. You feel Molly petting you.
This continues for the next few minutes. Then Molly looks down at you and says “Well little guy what do you want to do...”
134211111211.title: A Caring Master

choices: Your still scared, but you've managed to control your anger
You've managed to calm down completely
134211111212.content: Before you can even begin to climb down the sheets you feel Molly grab you from behind and lift you up. You look down, and imediately wish you hadn't. Molly had lifted you above her head, and she was about to drop into her open mouth! "What are y-" You don't get a chance to finish your sentence, because Molly dropped you. You hear her jaws snap shut as you enter her mouth, and she imediately pushes you into her throat with her toungue. You close your eyes, expecting to die in stomach acids, but instead you feel impact, on something soft and wet. You open your eyes. The 'chamber' your in appears to be a stomach, but with no exit except the way you came in. "Wha- where- Molly what did you do?" You hear her growl, but it sounds friendly. (well as friendly as a growl can sound any way) "I was born with a second stomach, and I came up with a creative use for it just now. I want you to calm down, all right? I'm going to sleep, so I'll 'see' you in the morning." The next morning-
134211111212.title: A Quiet Place to Calm Down

1342111112121.content:
You wake up to the same dark place inside Molly. You sigh and start to have a bit of a mental breakdown trying to comperhencomprehend what happened yesterday. You then think you'll die inside this teen wolf that you thought you could trust. The thought brings you to tears. You start to cry. The sound of your crying echoes in this second stomach of Molly's. Then you say softly while whimpering.

"I'm sorry..."

Molly hearing this asks you.

"Sorry for what?"

Her voice scares you. You didn't expect her to be up yet. You start to think that you could just try and lie to her, but then think of her leaving you in her second stomach to die. You decide to tell the truth.

"I'm sorry for over reacting. I just couldn't comprehend what you told me. I acted out of anger and hatred. So I'm sorry... Do you forgive me?"

Molly didn't say anything. You expected her to say something along the lines of I don't believe you, or you just want out!, or something like that but instead it was silence. Then you start to try and talk to her once again.

"Look Molly if you don't what to forgive me then I understa-"

Your cut short by being sucked back into Molly's throat. You are in complete darkness until you see daylight at the end of the tunnel. You suddenly start to think that you died in Molly and your soul is going to Heaven. Then all you see is white. You feel warm air blowing on you. You suddenly realize your not dead and that Molly is breathing on you. You get up slowly and turn around to see...
1342111112121.title: Your still scared, but you've managed to co...

choices: Puts you in between her breasts
13421111121211.content:
Your still sore from the ride out of Molly. You rub the back of your neck and look at Molly who is as guilty as could be.

"I'm sorry for eating you Keane."

"It will take a while but eventually I will forget about this... Hopefully."

She looked at you and smiled slightly. She truly looked sorry about swallowing you. She then picks you up and you cringe is fear of her swallowing you again. She looks at you and says.

"Don't worry I'm not going to do that again."

"O-Ok" you say stuttering

Molly looks at you and is gentle, Trying to gain your trust again. She then...
13421111121211.title: A guilty Molly

13421111122.content:
You sit on her hand in shock, comprehending at last your shattered life. All at once, tears start to roll down your face. You have trouble breathing; your breath comes in sobs. You double over with the grief. Molly sees your crying. She cups you in both palms and strokes you softly.
"It's okay, you'll be fine. Life with me won't be so bad. Come on, don't cry." She continues to pet you and whisper to you. Her warm breath washes over your body and you are strangely comforted by it. It smells of herbs and not to strongly of meat. Eventually the tears ebb and finally stop. You shudder and look up. Molly is looking down at you, pity on her face. She nudges you gently with her nose and you hug her snout. You stand up in her palms.
"Could you put me down now? I'll be fine." She nods and puts you on her knee. You take a breath and sit down. You take in her massive figure. You hadn't noticed before, but her t-shirt has a picture of a bear, a wolf and a giant cat, a tiger, on it. They're all sitting at a table feasting on some kind of herbivore.
"What's that?" you ask, pointing at her shirt. She looks down.
"Oh, This? It's a call for continued peace among the Wolves, Bears and Cats. We all live on separate continents, but we still get in trouble sometimes. They're what I was telling you about, neither race has any significant objection to eating humans. Wolves do." You settle down as she smiles down at you, your grief faded for the moment. Then...
13421111122.title: Grief and Questions

134211111221.content:
You look up at Molly with a slightly sad face, but it soon changed to a slightly happy face when you thought of music.

"Hey Molly, do you know what rap is?" She tilted her head in confusion.

"No, I haven't Keane, what is it?" You smile and start to explain the rap genre of music. That soon led to me explaining other genres of music from Earth. Suddenly you felt a vibration in your pocket, you reach in and gasp as you felt your cell phone. You quickly pull it out and smile a little.

"Hey what's that Keane?" Molly asked, You smiled more.

"It's my cellphone! I forgot all about this" You respond happily

"Oh I have a cellphone." Molly pulls out a very large rectangular object, her giant phone looked a lot like the iPhone, which was a little odd in your opinion. You brushed that aside and started to look through your many songs on your phone and laughed a little when you found one song.

"This song was used to invade a country back where I'm from, when ever I hear it I laugh and say 'America's guide to invading a foreign country, play really loud English music that mainly consists of screaming' I love this song haha" You press the play button and put your phone on full blast in hopes of Molly hearing it. Bodies by Drowning Pool started playing, you smiled as Molly showed signs of being able to hear the song and seemed to be very interested. Soon the song was over and Molly smiled at you.

"Well it was interesting, I've never heard of music like that before" You smile and started to play other songs by Avenge Sevenfold, Eminem, Dr.Dre, Xzibit, DMX, N.W.A, Drake, Skillet, ACDC, Guns and Roses, Nickel Back, and many other bands and singers. Soon Molly started to ask questions about some words, never hearing them before now. One word, you were hoping she wouldn't hear and ask about.

"Keane, what does Bitch mean?" You froze and looked away.

"Uh.... I don't think you want to know..." You say a little scared.

"What do you mean? Of course I want to know, come on just tell me" Molly said. You looked up at her with a scared face.

"F-Fine.... It.... It means...." You struggled to say the meaning of the word due to fear and wanted to just run and hide but you knew you had no where to go, so you took a deep breath and just said it.

"It mean.... Female dog.... Please don't hurt me!!" You yell and cower in fear on Molly's bed. You sat there for a minute, nothing happening, nothing but silence. You slowly look up at Molly and....
134211111221.title: Music Time?

134211111222.content:
Suddenly, the door opens. You and Molly look over. The little boy wolf, Billy sticks his head in. he looks at you and his eyes widen.
"Whoa, is that a human?!" he asks Molly.
"Yes, this is Keane my new pet and HOW MANY TIMES DO I HAVE TO TELL YOU NOT TO COME INTO MY ROOM WITHOUT KNOCKING?!" The last came out of her mouth as a yell. You are knocked off her knee onto the bed between her legs. Billy flinches.
"Okay, okay, it's just that mom said to call you for dinner, it's ready. Molly is glaring daggers at him, so he quickly leaves the room and shuts the door. Molly looks back down at you and notices where you are.
"I'm sorry Keane, did that hurt you? Billy is just so annoying." She looks a little distressed.
"I'm fine, really. I thought that Billy would be more curious about me." Molly looks at you.
"Come on, we have to go to dinner. I'll tell you on the way." She puts a paw down beside you. You scramble onto it. She curls it around you and lifts you up gently. She gets off the bed and walks out of her room.
134211111222.title: Billy doesn't knock

1342111112221.content:
Molly walks through her house, with you sitting in your paw looking up at her.
"So why wasn't Billy more interested in me?" you ask her. Molly looks down at you
"One if the unwritten rules about humans is that you mind your own business. Billy won't do much to you unless I tell him I can. The owner of a human can do what he or she wants. If you are 'wild' than you are fair game, but for now everyone will leave you to me." You feel a bit relived at this, Molly is nice but other wolves might not be. Molly enters the dining room. It looks like a typical dining room; her family is sitting at the table. She sits across from her father and puts you next to her plate. Her parents are sitting across and to her left. They both look at you and you are nervous under the gaze of these giant carnivores. They stare at you, than look at Molly. She nods. They nod back and fetch dinner. It is two kinds of meat, dear and ox. Both are still on the bone, and the deer meat is raw. Blood drips onto the thick tablecloth from it. You shudder as you look at it. Molly glances down at you and sees you shudder. She strokes your back gently gently, you look up at her. She is smiling at you. She reaches for the...
1342111112221.title: Start of dinner

choices: ...caught up in her hunger and forgets you're there
13421111122211.content:
Molly reaches for the cooked meat, the ox. She uses her claws to tear a huge piece of meat off and bring is over to the plate. It is a big portion even at normal size; wolves must eat more than humans you think. She puts the meat on the plate. Juice pools out. The other family members take some meat to, of similar proportions. Billy and their Mom take raw, while their dad takes equal portions of each. They all dig in. You watch in slightly terrified fascination as they tear into their meat like, well, like starving wolves. They tear huge pieces from the meat, getting juice or blood all over their snouts. Even Molly is attacking it. She takes a break to breath, than looks down at you. She leans closer.
"You hungry?" she asks. Her breath rolls all over you. It is war and smells very strongly of meat. Your stomach rumbles. You have not eaten for hours, and are starving. You nod, a little scared of the way they eat. She suddenly picks you up, taking you by surprise. She slides you onto her plate. You slip through the grease onto the meat. You are covered with grease, your clothes are soaked. The meat is painfully hot. You scramble away from it until you hit the slope of the plate. Molly is...
13421111122211.title: Dinner with hungry wolves

134211111222111.content: As Molly continues to eat, you notice that her pupils are hyper dialated. You remember hearing somewhere that predatory creatures tend to do that as they feast. Suddenly, a large chunk of meat falls off of Molly's portion. Since your hungry, you rip off a piece, and begin to eat it. Molly's hand reaches for the remaining part and you realize that if you don't move she'll grab you as well! Dropping the piece of meat your holding, you jump backwards, narrowly avoiding becoming part of Molly's dinner.
134211111222111.title: Nice Reflexes

1342111112221112.content: Molly continues voraciously attack her meal, you yell for her to stop, but it seems she's enthralled by it. As you sit and watch in terror and amazement, she drops a small piece near you. You stumble to pick it up believing maybe it's charity, only to realize she was grabbing it at the same time. Now you're on a one way trip to her mouth. She brings you closer and closer still totally oblivious to your absence on the plate.
1342111112221112.title: She remains oblivious

13421111122211121.content:
You scream, man do you scream. "MOLLY, PLEASE MOLLY I'M RIGHT HERE!" Unfortunately it all moves too fast, and soon you're in her mouth watching pieces of meat bearing teared off. You are jostled back and forth rolling in between canine teeth and dodging imminent death, when suddenly you smell blood. You immediately try to stand and look around, when you realize your legs are no longer responding. You look down, to find them missing. The screaming resumes louder than before, until the pain becomes too much and you pass out.


THE END

Soon after, Molly's little brother became aware of your absence on the table and made a comment. "Wow, sis I didn't think you'd eat him up that fast." Stunned, Molly searched the table for you. Eventually coming to realize that she did in fact eat you. "Oh my gosh I'm gonna go throw up."Molly said fearful of you. Molly's mother on the other hand was quick to stop her,"Don't you dare waste the meal that I made like that, just remember him as the delicacy that you got to enjoy tonight and be glad you got him." she said smiling.

Soon after Molly abandoned her thoughts of human equality and decided to eat them when she could.
13421111122211121.title: Scream!

134211111222112.content:
You look up at Molly. The grease splattered fur on her snout has turned yellowish, clinging fur is clinging to her skin. She looks down at you and smiles. It is not comforting, her teeth have meat caught in them and you are suddenly very aware of your grease-soaked clothes. It is the stuff of night mares. You flinch. She looks concerned and leans down. You scoot back from her nose, which is wet with grease.
"Don't worry, I won't eat you. This is how human pets eat. Here, have some meat." She uses two claws to tear a chunk from the meat and set it down next to you. She carefully pushes you and your food up the slope of the plate, away from the main chunk. She looks at you reassuringly, than starts tearing into her food again. It is about half gone, with teeth marks everywhere. She rips meat off and chews, her teeth mashing it to bits as she pursues her food with frightening single-mindedness. Seeing her eat from the table was nothing like seeing it up close. You shudder and look away. You look at the meat. It reminds you all too vividly of Molly's frenzy and your grease-covered condition. If you hadn't been so hungry, you might not have eaten it. You tear chunks off and chew it. It is a bit tough, but at least it is cooked. You shiver as you remember the raw, blood-dripping venison. Your glad molly didn't get that. You don't eat very much before your full (or run out of appetite). You look around and sigh.
"Better get used to this." You mutter to yourself. You look over at Molly. She has finished eating and is looking at you, her head cocked and a strange look in her eye. She has wolves hearing, so she must have heard you. You interpret her expression as a wolfish half-smile. You look at her family. Billy finishes eating. He looks up at you for a moment, but he moves his gaze to the meat after a moment. He must have decided you would not be as tasty as the meat, you think with no little relief. Her mother and father finish, dinner...
134211111222112.title: Dinner on Molly's plate

1342111112221121.content:
Dinner appears to be over. Molly asks to be excused, and her parents let her. She stands up and picks up her plate with you on it and the plates with meat. She walks into the kitchen. It is a bit different from what you are used to. The fridge is a metal door in the wall leading into a cold room. Molly opens the door and you shiver from the cold. She does not appear to mind, with her thick fur. Fog comes out of her nose as she sniffs. She puts down the plates and wraps the leftovers in plastic wrap. There are several shelves, all made of stainless steel, like the door. They all have food on them. Most of it is meat, most of which is raw, but you spot some bread, vegetables and other things. There is a large amount of dairy. Wolves have a high protein diet you think. In the center of the room are large sides of meat, hanging from the ceiling. They swing slowly in the air. You are really getting cold in here, you start shivering. Molly finishes wrapping the leftovers and puts them on a shelf. She looks over at you and notices that you are shivering.
“Are you cold?” She asks
‘Freezing.” Is all you can say to her. Puffs of fog come out of your mouth as you say this. When Molly breathes small clouds appear in the air, floating upwards. Molly speaks again:
“Let's…
1342111112221121.title: In Molly's Fridge

13421111122211211.content: "... put you someplace warm" she blushes and begins to place you into. . .
13421111122211211.title: ...put you someplace warm"

13421111122211212.content:
"Let's get out of here." Molly says, cloud of fog emerging from her mouth. You nod vigorously, part of your effort to keep warm. She reaches out with her paw and curls her fingers around you. She lifts you off the shelf and opens her palm, allowing you to sit down. You also notice that it gives you a great view of her breasts, which you take advantage of. She walks out of the fridge and shuts the door. You start to warm up in the heated kitchen air. The kitchen is a bit different from what you are used to, there are very few spices or tools. The stove is enormous, with four large heaters and a grill. The kitchen sink is full of blood and grease covered plates from dinner. The bones have all been cracked in half and the marrow sucked out. You decide to talk about something else.
"You keep your fridge colder than I do" you call up to her.
"Yeah, we wolves have fur, so we are more resistant to cold than humans." She sits down at a continently placed stool in front of one of the counters. She cradles you in both hands and speaks:
"Keane, I noticed you flinching at the venison, so I got the ox. You’re going to have to get used to raw meat, though. Cooked meat is a rarity; we don't eat that much of it." She looks down at you in concern. She really wants the best for you, you realize. The whole family won't change their eating habits for a new pet. You think the last with a little bitterness, but you look up at her and smile. You shout up:
"Thanks for that, Molly. I guess I will." Molly's face lights up and she beams down at you. You get a little glow from this. She wants the best for you, and you feel obligated to make her happy. You smile back.
"Thanks for understanding, Keane." She gets off the stool and heads...
13421111122211212.title: Talking to Molly in the kitchen

134211111222112122.content:
Molly heads into the living room. This must be "family time" you realize with some apprehension. Molly carries you in. Her mom is sitting in a rocking chair, reading a book. Her father is sitting in an easy chair with his feet up on a footrest. He is reading a newspaper. You can't make out what it shows. Billy is sitting on the floor, playing with some toy cars. Molly sits down on the couch and puts you on her knee.Sitting on the jeans with the soft fur under them feels a little like a bed. You feel very nervous about this event, you're going to be the focus of attention for three giant carnivores (and Molly, but Molly's nice). Molly starts petting you even as she speaks:
"Everyone, this is Keane, my new pet." Three sets of eyes that have been studiously ignoring you snap up. Molly's mom and dad close their reading; Billy scrambles over to get a better look.

You look in apprehension at the giant wolf boy getting closer to you. He sniffs a big sniff, taking in your scent, and speaks:
"He smells a lot like dinner." You look at him in horror. Your clothes are still covered in grease from the dinner, and he is a carnivore. He is eying you in a distinctly hungry way. You scoot back along Molly’s leg until you fall off between her legs. At least he can't see you anymore. Molly reaches in and picks you up, her claws curling around you. She looks at Billy and starts to growl. It starts out as a low growl deep in her throat, and you can nearly taste the menace radiating from it. Billy looks defiantly at his sister and you for a moment, and Molly's growl gets steadily louder and more menacing, her claws curling around you until they touch at the top, forming a sharp and dangerous cage. You feel strangely protected by it, even as you shudder from the growl. You had never heard anyone utter anything like it. It swells in volume and menace as you look on. Eventually even Billy is daunted and backs down, his ears flat on his head. He turns away and mutters clearly:
"I was just saying..." At this point Billy's mother intervenes:
"Billy, it's time for bed." Billy gets up sullenly and glances back at Molly. She has stopped growling, but her hackles are still raised and her eyes are slits. She hasn't relaxed her claws around you at all. Billy scurries off.

Molly lets out a long, slow breath, opens her claws and relaxes. She puts you back on her legs, but you notice that you are a lot closer to her body this time. Her father looks at you for a moment, than looks at Molly:
"I take it you don't intend to eat him." It is a statement, her recent behavior answering any questions that may have been raised. Molly nods at him. He continues: "I don’t have to talk to you about responsibility with pets, do I? Or following the proper forms, since you showed me that at dinner." Molly nods again. Her father raises the newspaper with one last comment: "He really does smell like that, you know. You should avoid further... incidents with Billy." Molly replies:
"Okay dad." She actually looks submissive; she has her head bowed and her eyes lowered a startling contrast to how she looked before. As you look up at her, however, she winks at you. Her mother looks at her:
"You can go now dear." Molly picks you up and stands up hastily. You are both equally relieved to be out of this situation. Molly heads out the door and up the stairs to her room.
134211111222112122.title: Incedent With Billy in the Living Room

1342111112221121221.content:
Molly carries you out of the living room, heading for some stairs. She is flexing her claws, obviously remembering Billy's comment. It is not a reassuring sight, so you call up to her:
"Molly, could you stop doing that?" and points to her claws. She seems dazed for a moment, but shakes her head and looks down. She sees you pointing:
"Oh, sorry Keane, I didn't even realize I was doing that." She stops flexing her claws and her paw steadies some. She carries you up some stairs, which makes for a bumpy ride, even if she is trying to hold you steady. She comes to her room and opens the door, firmly locking it behind her. She goes over to her bead and puts you on the pillow and lies on her stomach on top of the blanket. This gives her an eye level view of you. There is an awkward silence for a moment, and then molly sighs:
"Look, I'm sorry about Billy. He is fascinated with food, always hungry. If I had known he was going to do that, I would have waited until he went to bed." You look back at her; she's resting her chin on her paws and looking straight at you, waiting for a reaction.
"It's okay Molly, you couldn’t have known. It was a bit scary, though, especially when you picked me up and started growling." Molly's eyes widen and she blows out through her nose, sending cold, wet air right at you.
"Oh Keane, I'm so sorry. It must have been ten times worse for you at your size, in my paw. I'm really sorry." She's pleading and sounds very sorry; you squirm a little from the raw guilt in her voice. You speak immediately:
"No really Molly, it wasn't that bad, and you didn't know. It's not your fault." Molly perks up at this, but still sounds very dejected:
"Thanks Keane, but I still could have." You interrupt her "Look Molly, don't blame yourself when you didn't do anything wrong! It's actually comforting to know you'll do things like that for me, especially in front of your parents." Molly looks at you, startled, and then she starts smiling.

Molly looks at you and starts to breathe a little quickly:
"Remember the look on Billy's face? It's time that brat learned he can't get away with everything." And then she starts to laugh, a full bodied laughter. She opens her mouth and her tongue rolls out the side of her mouth as she continues laughing. You start to laugh to, remembering how sullen Billy looked. Then a particularly big burst from her mouth hits you and you fall on your butt on the pillow, tumbling down to the bed. You look at each other for a moment, than laugh even harder. Your breath starts coming in gasps, but you can't stop laughing. The hilarity of the day hits you all at once, now that you’re past the heart pounding terror of the actual events. Eventually, you both stop laughing and gasp for breath. Molly has a huge grin on her face, though she's careful to keep her teeth hidden. She sits up and picks you up. She brings you to her snout and cuddles you into her fur near her eye. It feels really nice, warm and safe. You cuddle her back, basking in the affection of your friend/owner. She stops and holds you out in front of her face.
"Thanks Keane, I really needed that." She smiles fondly at you. You look back:
"Yeah, me to. So what do we do now?" Molly stands up from the bed and looks down at you. She takes a great whiff through her nose, obviously smelling you, and then she looks back at you, a playful light in her eye added to her grin.
"Now we act on dad's instructions." She heads for her bathroom.
1342111112221121221.title: Reassurances and Laughter

choices: ...go out on the town with you
13421111122211212211.content:
Molly walks into her bathroom and flips two switches. The lights turn on, brilliant white and the fan turns on. The fan sounds like a distant hurricane to you howling faintly. The bathroom has tile with strange geometric designs, like most bathrooms and a white countertop. The bath is a stand alone, with legs that end in paws. There are no rugs on the floor; they couldn’t take the punishment from a wolf's claws. The bathroom is fairly large, even by normal sized standards. Molly walks over to the counter and sets you down, the claws at her feet clicking on the tile. You look up at her. The playful grin has, if possible, broadened on her face. You get a little suspicious.
"What now?" you call up to her. Molly chuckles:
"You are covered in grease, Keane; it's getting you into trouble. We're going to fix that. You’re getting a bath." Molly plugs the sink and starts running water into it. It gradually fills up.

Molly picks you up again:
"Time to get undressed, Keane." Before you can object, she curls a claw under your shirt, on your back. It feels smooth and presses into your back. She must run all the time, keeping in shape and enjoying the wind blowing past. You fall into the rhythm as well, shifting your body to the roll of her shoulders. This is wonderful, you realize. There can be nothing better than this, sitting on her shoulder and gazing out at the beauty rushing past. Suddenly, Molly calls out:
"Hold on!" you look out to the front. Rapidly approaching is a gorge, entirely too wide for your liking, and Molly is rushing straight for it! She intends to jump it! She lets loose everything at this point, even as you jump to your feet and scream: “Molly, Wait!" Molly does not listen to you. She rushes to the gap, bunches her muscles and LEAPS! You lose your balance and fall backwards this time. You come to the end of the string between her shoulder blades and look down the gorge at the river that seems hundreds of miles below you, terrifying beyond all measure. You yell as Molly...
134211111222112122112211112.title: Running and Leaping

choices: ...you reach the edge of a cliff
1342111112221121221122111121.content:
Molly hits the other side with a clunk. You shake on your line, absurdly relived to see the land seventy feet below you. Your breath is coming in gasps; it was the most terrifying thing you had ever been through! You are between Molly's shoulder blades as she twists her head, her back muscles respond to the movement:
"Keane?" she wonders as she sees the empty shoulder. She feels the string and the weight still attached to it. She reaches back with her paw and covers you. She pulls you back up to her shoulders. She is breathing heavily, but she is grinning like a madman. You slowly get very angry as she turns her head towards you:
"So, what did you think?" You feel your rage hit the boiling point. You open your mouth and start to shout at the top of your lungs:
"YOU IDIOT! YOU COULD HAVE KILLED US BOTH! WHAT WERE YOU THINKING! WERE YOU EVEN THINKING? HOW COULD YOU HAVE POSSIBLY HAD..." You rant for a while as Molly flinches at the sound of your voice. You are shouting as loud as you possibly can, and you are situated very near her incredibly sharp wolf ears. Her expression turns guilty, than mortified as you pace her shoulder, wave your arms and continue to shout:

Eventually:
"Keane..." she says in a small voice. You ignore her and continue to rant. She tries again, a little louder:
"Keane, look..." you just keep yelling at her. Eventually she turns her head as much as possible, nearly right at you, and bellows:
"KEANE!" Her mouth is fully open, her nose curled into a snarl, giving you a direct view of her very sharp teeth and the back of her throat. You are knocked backwards, partially by the force of the shout and partially by the look on her face. Your lungs can possibly hope to beat her in a shouting contest. You wave your arms in the air, and then you slump down onto her shoulder:
"What?" you demand, still very mad at her, but you know that she'll just shout you down if you continue. She looks at you and relaxes her face:
"Look Keane, I'm sorry. I didn't think you'd take it so badly. It was just a nice opportunity, you know. No, wait, let me finish," she adds with a glare as you open your mouth to respond, "I’m really sorry, but I was caught up in the moment and it really wasn't that long a jump! I mean, it didn't look it..." She trails off at the less thank convinced look on your face.
"It didn't look that short to me, and I was looking down over the jump! Tell me, have you ever jumped something that long before?" you demand at her with a glare. She slowly shakes her head. You groan, roll your eyes heavenward and bury your face in your hands.


Molly hesitantly touches you, and you lean into her paw. Encouraged, Molly starts petting you gently. You let her, glad of the reassurance after that ordeal. Molly picks you up and holds you in front of her, the string slack. She pets you softly:
"I'm really sorry Keane; it must have been so scary!" You nod at her and look at her for a moment. Than you sigh and look at her neck. She puts you there and you hug her, burying yourself in her warm fur. Then you back off and look up at her again:
"Please, just don't do it again!" she nods and starts walking again. She is silent for a moment, but then she gets a sly look in her eye and starts grinning again:
"It was fun though, wasn't it?" There is a falsely innocent quality to her voice. You narrow your eyes at her and she smiles playfully. Then you roll your eyes again and reply:
"Yes Molly, in its own heart stopping, brain freezing, terrifying way it was fun. Don't do it again!" You feel the need to repeat that. She walks for a few moments until...
1342111112221121221122111121.title: Terrifying fun

13421111122211212211221111211.content:
Molly walks out of the trees and stops. A few feet (to her) feet ahead the ground suddenly give way. She just stands there as you try to comprehend the view, mouth open in shock. The cliff is a sheer face standing 1000 feet over the plain below it. To you, this is around 5 miles! You can barely grasp the enormity of it. It just looks unreal. The plain spreads out away from the mountains, fading into the distance. There is a city at the base of the mountains, several roads that look like tiny lines on a map heading into it. The tallest buildings don't come quarter as high as the cliff does, none higher that 25 stories, you realize. There are cars too, miniscule dots along the roads of the city and plain. The suburbs spread out from the city some, but not very far compared to the awesome emptiness of the grassland in front of you. You continue to stare for a while, and then you look at Molly. She is looking at you through the corner of her eye, waiting to see your reaction. You just stare at her in astonishment before managing to squeak out:
"What is that?" She grins at you:
"Nice view, huh?"

Molly’s opposite paw comes to her shoulder. You jump in and she extends you out. It doesn't change the view much, but it helps her point. "This is the Hrawl plain, at the base of the Grond Mountains." She moves her arm in a sweeping gesture, indicating the whole plain. "It extends for about 200 miles from this range, before it meets the ocean. The city below is Rickly, and it is also our destination." You try to cope with the numbers. To her the plains might be 200 miles, but you are much smaller and distances are much bigger. You think about the mind blowing numbers, but it gives you a pounding headache and you stop. Molly goes on "Over there is the road leading from our town." She moves her paw to the left and points with one claw. You see a small road emerging from the base of the range, a tiny gray line. It comes out a mile or two the left and, obviously, a thousand feet down. Slowly you turn around; you cannot cope with anymore of these inconceivable distances. Molly grins down at you:
"I come this way for the view, its great don't you think?" She looks down at you questioningly. You think about it. It may be a nice view, but it is highly intimidating to you. You shrug and look up at her:
"I guess so." She raises the fur above her eye in question, so you go on "It is just so... big." That was the understatement of the century. "Big" did not cover it. Molly looks at you, a bit puzzled, than understanding dawn in her eyes:
"I guess it would be, for you. Anyway, let's get going." you nod and she puts you back on her shoulder and walks back into the treelike, taking you away from that confusing view. She breaks back into a jog, then into a run. The air is still cold, so you burrow back into her fur, thinking about what you just saw. Thoughts of it boil and churn in your mind. Eventually you shrug it off. It would be there whether you like it or not, so you should just accept it. You go back to looking at the forest and mountains, while rolling with the motion of Molly's shoulder. There are worse things to do, you think. Finally, she gets to the bottom...
13421111122211212211221111211.title: The View

134211111222112122112211112111.content:
Molly emerges from the forest at the base of the mountains close to the suburbs. They are only about a quarter miles away. She is standing in a small field. Her paw comes up and you jump on, than she brings you in front of her:
"Time to take that string off, Keane." She uses her other paw to untie the string, suprisingly. You thought that she would just cut them off with her claws. The unties it around her nexk to, than sticks it in her pocket. Then she looks back at you:
"Got the collar on?" she obviosly isn't pretending anymore about what it really is. You nod a bit sullenly. "Good. Time to go." She walks to the suburbs. You finger the collar. It really isn't uncomftorable, and it helped keep your nexk warm in the mountains, but it is still humiliating. Molly reaches the sidwalk and goes into town. The suburbs are a bit different from what your used to. First, they are enourmous! Well, at least to you. Also, the houses are not very close packed. Each house has a lot of land between it and it's neibors. They also bear no similarity to each other, like on earth. Each house seems to be constructed individually, with no thought to any of the others. It is different, but it looks somewhat appealing. Uniforrmity is boring, this makes each house individual. You comment on the size of the plots to Molly, who nods: "We aren't as crowded as you are on earth, not so overpopulated. Also, we have different views on land than you do." She stops with this weird comment, and you et it go. You pass people now,, little kids drawing on the sidewalk, adults with errands and many other people. They usually ignore Molly, but the people who look at her glance at you, huddled in her paw. It is very intimidating to be under the eye of so many giants. They all note your collar before going on with their buisness. You finally reach the city. Where is Molly headed?
134211111222112122112211112111.title: The 'burbs of Rickly

1342111112221121221122111121112.content:
Molly goes into Rickly. The city is very similar to the ones on earth. It has tall buildings, crowds, honking horns and the like. It does not, however, have smog. You are very grateful for this; you don't think you could have handled it at your size. You look up at Molly:
"Where are we headed?" you ask her. She looks down at you and smiles. It is very unsettling, you can't recall where but you have seen it before:
"To the mall, it's time to shop!" You grow a little apprehensive. You recognize the look, you've seen it on those crazy girls with the "Shop till you drop" policy. This could get ugly, you think. She finally reaches a large parking lot. In front of you is the mall. It is gigantic. Five stories tall, extending ten city blocks on all sides. Your eyes have trouble comprehending the reality of it. To you it looks ten stories tall and a mile long. Molly approaches the entrance, where wolves of all ages were streaming in. Molly packs in with them. You have a little trouble here. On all sides are giant carnivores, many of whom look at you with interest. You shiver as you look up at all of them. You are surrounded by them, monoliths rising up on all sides. The moment passes as Molly gets inside and away from the crowd. She looks down at you in concern: "You okay?" You nod at her and smile weakly:
"Yeah, it's just that you’re all so big!" She gives you a half smile and pets you, then walks on.

As she heads for one of the escalator, there is suddenly a howl. It's not very loud, but it is obviously to catch Molly's attention. You look over. A group of teenage wolves, boys from their appearance, are staring quite openly at Molly's workout outfit. They make a few comments that you can't hear, but Molly's sharp hearing easily comprehends. She gives them a look of pure disgust and walks onto the escalator. The wolves make several more comments, probably about her form fitting shorts, and Molly shakes her head. "Jerks." She mutters. You look up at her:
"Who were they?" She looks down at you, startled. She must have briefly forgotten about you when looking at the boys:
"Oh, their just some morons from school. They actually think we like that." She obviously means the other girls from school, you realize. She keeps speaking "Anyway, here we are." You look over. Molly is entering a small shop on the third story. IT is rather secluded from the main corridors, and was small and tightly packed. The merchandise drew your attention, though. There were tons of dollhouses, dolls, clothes and just about everything else. There were a few other things to, like board games and trains. Everything was expertly constructed by someone who new a lot about making things that size.

Molly walks onto the counter and puts you down. It is rather dimly lit, so you have to squint for a moment before you see the wolf, which is hidden in the silvery light. He is small, smaller than Molly. He has spectacles no his long snout, and his fur looks badly cared for. His claws, however, draw your attention. They are expertly sharpened, honed to razor points. They are well cared for, and you realize with a flash of insight that this must be the maker of all the merchandise. His hands and claws look dexterous, and there is a workbench behind the counter. You get an even better view of his claws as his paw comes down a little to close to you on the counter. From this distance you can see that they are gleaming and sharp. He studies you for a moment, than speaks: "Hello. It has been a long time since I have had customers in my store, and even longer since I had a human here. What's your name?" His voice is rough and quiet, his voice hesitant. He must not get out much, you muse. You also notice something of a country accent.
"I'm Keane." you reply. He nods, satisfied. He looks up at Molly:
"So, what did you have in mind, young lass? Mind you, I hope your tastes are a bit more... gentle, than others. I don't sell those kinds of things." His voice sounds both questioning and faintly accusing. Molly bristles, her fur standing out, and her face curls into a snarl.
"I assure you sir; I am not here for that. I wouldn’t even think of..." He waves his paw at her:
"Fine, fine. I'm sorry if I sounded judgmental, it’s just that when I advertised that I made human things, some people came here with the mistaken Idea that I made torture devices. So, now that that's out of the way, what are you here for? My names Spencer, by the way" His tone has gotten friendlier, and his face has come out of the shadows. He turns on an overhead light, which brightens the small shop considerably. Molly relaxes and responds:
"Keene needs clothes, he only had one set. I made him these." She gestures towards you. Spencer scrutinizes you closely. You back up nervously as he brings his face within inches of your body. He looks back up at Molly:
"This is interesting work. Very rudimentary stitching, but innovative design. Well done." Molly looks both pleased and embarrassed at the same time. Spencer goes on:
"If you would be so kind as to bring him here, please." He stands up and lifts up the bar on the counter.

Molly picks you up and carries you to the worktable behind it. Spencer removes all the junk, than pulls it out. Molly sets you down. It is perfectly smooth and smells strongly of cleaning fluid. Spencer turns off the overhead lights and turns on a series of lights. They all point to you and you are momentarily blinded. When you can see again, Spencer and Molly are no more then enormous shadows. Spencer leans in closer, a notebook in hand. The index claw on his right paw has a tip on it, like a pencil. IT must be how they write, you think. He starts scratching in the notebook, muttering to himself:
"Male, obviously. E stock perhaps. Female owner. Gray fur. Yes yes, matching." He keeps up this incomprehensible muttering as he studies you, his claw scratching furiously. He has you turn several times, than gets a string and measure you quickly. Finally, he turns off the lights and turns to Molly:
"Back in a moment." He goes into the back and gets a box to put on a counter. He also goes through the store, collecting things. Molly picks you up and sets you back on the counter and goes in front again. Spencer finishes and sits back down. He spreads some stuff out. There are clothes for all ages, occasions and peculiarities. Running clothes, tuxedo's casual, just about everything, even shoes. They are separated into two piles, you notice. Spencer speaks:
"The ones on the left are made for humans, the ones on the right for dolls. I'm not sure how the doll clothing will fit, but the human clothing should work." You look at it all, starting with the shoes. You manage to find several pairs that fir, and set them aside. Socks are easy to. Molly has a large assortment of clothes by then:
"Try these on." You look up at her.
"Right here?" You manage to whisper. Spencer chuckles. He reaches under the counter and pulls out a box. It has a door and several wires in it. He sets it on the counter:
"You can change in here." Molly quickly sorts out the stuff she wants you to try on. You go in with the first set. It is plain t-shirt and shorts, with underwear to you immense relief. It fits perfectly. You go out and look at them. Molly nods at you, and then presents the next set. You groan, than go back in. You hear Spencer chuckle behind you. These don't fit, and are discarded. You try on a lot of clothes, some of which don't fit, some of which you have arguments with Molly about. An especially memorable reject was a bathing suit, which you flatly refused to get in. Molly objected, but you held your ground stubbornly. Spencer looked on, amused. Finally, you had everything you wanted. It looked like a veritable mountain of clothing to you, but Molly looks a bit disappointed at the amount. Spencer carefully stores it in a bag, a small bag. Molly pays him, signing a piece of paper it had. You thank Spencer, who smiles:
"Don't mention it. If you need something else, do come back." You both Nod at him, than head out from the store with you on Molly's pad. Molly emerges into the hallway and heads for...
1342111112221121221122111121112.title: Shopping for your clothes

13421111122211212211221111211121.content:
Molly heads for the food court. She goes down two escalators until she reaches the ground floor. The food court is circular, with food shops on all sides. Molly heads for the line. She picks up a tray and sets you down on it. It has raised portions, like tiles all over it. You look up at Molly, who is studying the various signs, which you can't read. She looks down at you:
"Want anything in particular?" she asks. You respond:
"Why don't we go through the line and see?" Molly nods and puts you down on the metal slider. The uneven sliding motion quickly lands you on your butt. Molly giggles as she keeps pushing. You slide around on the tray as she keeps going. There are several shops. The first one serves raw meat, which you quickly decline. Even the faint odor makes you nauseas. Molly keeps going. There is a fried food place, with wings and drumsticks from some type of bird. You point to it and Molly reaches over and puts it next to you. You find it very hard to ignore her breasts, which are pretty much directly above you. You get hot looking. Molly notices to, she giggles and smiles down at you. You keep going. The people behind you have a small girl, who keeps glancing at you in interest, making you nervous. One time she reaches over the tray and you scoot back as her arm passes overhead. Eventually you reach the end of the line with some cheese, soda, fried bird and another meat you can't identify. Molly takes the tray through the crowded hall. The place is packed; you look in awe at the enormous wolves eagerly chowing down. It makes you glad you have Molly with you; this place definitely isn't for unowned humans.

Molly sits down behind one of the pillars, giving you some privacy. You look up at her:
"What bird is this?" you ask her. Molly looks down and replies:
"Chicken." The birds here must be bigger than those on earth, you think. Molly begins to eat ravenously; she had been running and hadn't eaten for hours. She barely notices you, and you are very hungry. You build up your courage and ask:
"Uh, Molly?" Molly pauses and eyes you for a moment. She puts a little cheese, meat and a chicken bone beside you. All of it had been eaten by her already. You try to get around your distaste and eat the meat and cheese. You are still ravenous, you hadn't eaten for a long time and she didn't give you all that much. You walk over to the chicken bone, which is taller than you IT is wet and slimy, Molly had already put it in her mouth. She had also cracked it open to get at the marrow. You see a clinging piece of meat and grab it. It is slipery with saliva, you shudder as you touch it. But you are very hungry. You pull it off and eat it. It is well cooked, but you can taste Molly's saliva on it. You are really hungry and keep going. You find pieces of meat molly had missed, getting greasy and soaked in spit in the process. You climb into the bone and get some marrow out. Suddenly, the bone tips up and you slide out. Molly had picked it up and sent you plummeting to the table. She picks up the bone and sticks her tongue in, getting the last morsels. Molly has finished by now. The meal has made you thirsty, however:
"Molly, can I get something to drink?" You ask this a bit nervously. She looks down and smiles:
"Of course Keane. Here" She opens the lid to the soft drink and suddenly picks you up. She drops you into the fluid. You panic a little as you fall and start to flail about. You struggle to the surface. You hear a giggle above you. You see Molly looking down at you from above:
"Come on, drink up!" She is grinning. You glare up at her, but drink some. The soda is very good, but you can't identify what it is. Molly picks up your soaked body and carefully sets you down on the tray, than gulps the rest of the drink. You shiver, the air is cool and your wet clothes have started to hug your body. Molly picks you up than dumps the tray in the garbage. She looks down at you:
13421111122211212211221111211121.title: Food Court

134211111222112122112211112111211.content:
"I've got to go to the bathroom." she says and walks on. You wonder how this will work, will she take you with her in? You feel a bit of dread and anticipation. You have never been in a girl’s bathroom before, but this one will be gigantic. She reaches a side hallway and walks to two doors. One has a female wolf, the other a male. You have a bit of trouble seeing which one is which. Molly enters the left-hand door. It is a single toilet bathroom, which is strange for a mall this size. Molly locks the door and walks over to the sink. She puts you in it, close to the drain on its curved walls.. She puts the bag up on the rim and looks down at you:
"No peaking!" she orders sternly. She has a serious expression, so you agree. As she turns, you say:
"Uh, Molly? I need some new clothes, these are soaked." Molly turns again and looks down again, than grins. She digs through the bag and gives you some underwear, long pants and shirt. The shirt and pants are dull white. You remember Spencer mentioning Molly’s gray fur, this must be why. The colors suited your collar perfectly. You look up. Molly hasn't moved, she is looking down with a smile on her face:
"Go on." she urges. You hesitate for a moment, than shrug. Why should you care, she bathed you yesterday. Nevertheless, you quickly get out of the soaked clothes, dry your skin with them and quickly put the others on without looking up. When you finish, you look up and see Molly's grin. She smiles at you, than turns away from the sink.

You hear Molly walk over to the toilet. You hear her pull down her pants and try to imagine what she looks like, but your fantasy is stopped when you hear the streaming sound of Molly peeing. You still remember the threat from the morning. You tug at your collar absently, which is useless. It does not budge. You sigh and consider yourself. You’re tiny in this world, living at the whim of your owner. Molly may be nice, but she could have a serious mood swing. You hear the splashing in the distance and shudder, not thinking about it. You feel the cold surface of the sink under your feet and realize you are not wearing shoes. You haven't actually done so all day, you hadn't been wearing them when you had been transported, what seems like a lifetime ago. You tried on several pairs of shoes, but can't remember if Molly actually bought them. You laugh to yourself softly. What did you need shoes for? You had been standing on Molly's shoulder or on a table or in a sink all day. None of it hurt your feet. Still, you resolve yourself to toughen your feet. While you are thinking about it, you decide that you need to go yourself. You quickly go over and pee into the drain, thankful that you don’t have to go #2. You hear Molly flush the toilet, than stand up. You scramble up the sink, a difficult task for you. When you reach the top, Molly is walking over. She looks at you:
"I said no peaking!" she tells you, her voice mock-stern.
"I didn't!" you protest.
"Really? I thought you would, boys always seem to want to look. Thanks Keane." She smiles down at you and pets you with one claw. She reaches over and turns on the sink. You watch the seeming tons of water pound into the place where you just were, trying not to think about what would happen if you were there now. Molly washes her hands, than dries off and turns off the sink. You hadn't gotten very wet, just a light splattering when Molly flapped her paws. Molly grabs the bag, than you and heads out the door. When she gets out she...
134211111222112122112211112111211.title: You didn't peak

1342111112221121221122111121112112.content:
Molly finds her Mom and Billy at the food court. They are sitting at the table, eating raw meat. You see many massive bags filled with purchases, building sized to you with giant log's you can't decipher. Molly looks at her mom:
"Hi mom!" she says brightly as she sits down. She carefully puts the purchase on her lap and sets you on the table. Her paw remains where it is as you get off. Billy looks up briefly at you and Molly, who raises his eyebrows at him. He looks away and goes back to scarfing his food as fast as he can. Her mom spare's a glance for you, than looks up at Molly:
"Did you have a nice run?" she asks her. Molly nods enthusiastically:
"Yeah, we had lots of fun!" You notice that Molly's mom was pointedly referring to Molly in singular, while Molly was using a broad plural. You smile to yourself, Molly certainly knows how to deal with her mom, you think. Molly and her Mom chat about their purchases while Billy finishes.

When he is done, Billy still looks hungry. He looks up at his mom:
"Mom, can we...?" Billy's mom interrupts:
"No dear, that's enough. Come on, it's time to go." Molly stands up first. Her mom takes one look at her outfit and rolls her eyes heavenward:
"Molly, I know it's comfortable but couldn’t you wear something less... skimpy?" Her tone suggests that she is trying to use a mild work for an outrageous item. Molly shakes her head:
"No mom, these are great for running. Besides who would notice in here?" She's right, you think to yourself. All of the girl wolves hear are wearing revealing outfits and flirting with boys. At least Molly dresses this way practically, you think a bit petulantly. Her mom lifts her arms, exasperated:
"Fine, I’ll just let my daughter run around half-naked all the time for the sake of running." You note the sarcastic emphasis on the word. Molly nods:
"Thanks mom!" You chuckle to yourself, thinking about the sarcastic way Molly responded. Touché, you think. However, Wolves have very good hearing and Molly's mom's head swivels down towards you with a mix of annoyance and... Something else, on her face. She raises a wolfish eyebrow at you. You back down nervously. Definitely not a good idea to try to stare down her, you think. Molly's Mom stands up.
"Come on you two, time to go. And help me carry this stuff!" Molly sighs and picks up two enormous bags in one paw, than grabs your clothes and holds out that paw to you. You jump on and Molly lifts you to stomach level.
"Where'd you park?" Molly asks her.
"Two blocks over at the west entrance." Molly nods and starts walking out.

When she gets out of her Mom's sight however, she immediately puts the bags on the ground and brings you up to her neck:
"Keane, if you don't mind..." You nod, even though she can't see it, and jump on. You quickly brace yourself on her fur as she leans over and picks them up. She grunts a little as she keeps walking, a bag in each hand. You cling to her neck for dear life as she walks. The bags have made her usually smooth gate bumpy and uneven, and you nearly fall as she stumbles once. She straightens herself quickly, however and keeps going. She is panting a little by the time she gets to the car, green short at the end and expanding into a bigger space at the trunk. She puts the bags down quickly and opens the trunk. She puts them in and closes the trunk. She straightens out and stretches her back, which nearly makes you fall the OTHER way. Molly sees this out of the corner of her eye and offers you her paw. you gratefully leap on. She then raises you to her face:
"You okay?" Her breath smells like fried chicken.
"Yeah, those bags must have been heavy!" She nods in agreement:
"Very. I wonder what they got. Anyway..." Molly sits down in the car in the....
1342111112221121221122111121112112.title: Heavy mall Bags

13421111122211212211221111211121122.content:
Molly gets into the passengers side in the front. She puts the bag at her feet and you on her leg. You sit down and look up at her. You notice once again her tight, white top, and more importantly the way her breasts stretch against it. Molly notices you looking and grins:
"Maybe later, but Mom will be here soon." She bounces her knee, which sends you tumbling to the seat outside her legs. You look up but can't see anything except Molly's shorts and legs, a high wall. The seat is leather, and very hot since it's been it has been sitting in the sun. You yelp:
"Yow!" and jump onto Molly's leg. Molly leans over:
"Go on, keep climbing." You glance sourly at her, but she just smiles. She is amused by your antics. You climb her leg, using the fur as handholds. Almost immediately Molly yelps and shakes her leg. You tumble back to the blisteringly hot seat. Molly picks you up and dumps you back on her leg:
"Sorry, you were pulling my fur. It felt like it was coming loose!" Just than, Billy and their Mom arrive. Billy takes the driver side back seat and their mom sits in the front. She smiles at Molly:
"Thanks for carrying those, honey. Now put on your seat belts you two." Molly complies quietly, but Billy groans as he puts his on. The movement jostles you, but you stay on her knee. Than the car starts.

It sounds off an incredible roar before subsiding into distant thunder. You are shaken at this, and when the car starts moving you fall off again, but Molly catches you and puts you back on her knee, keeping you there with her paw. She pets you absently as the ride continues. You relax some, than notice Billy is watching you. The look he is giving you is sullen and hungry. You really hope you are never alone with him. Slowly, you inch closer to molly along her leg, until you reach her shorts. You climb onto the thin material around her slightly wider thighs. You can't see Billy and you hope he can't see you. Molly looks down at you questioningly, and you nod towards the back. Molly rolls her eyes. The ride seems to be taking a while, so you decide to whisper. You think it will carry to molly's ears but no one else's:
"How long is the ride?" you ask her, a little above your breath. Molly's ears twitch and she looks down from the window. She raises a claw in the half symbol. "Half an hour?" you breathe. Turning to you, she notices your expression and grins:
"Big, isn't it?" she asks you with an amused chuckle. You dumbly nod your head. She continues:
"We got that from an uncle, who informed us that we wouldn’t get any more gifts for the next ten years. I don't come in here often; usually Billy has control of it. He is a hopeless addict. He's not here now, though, so I thought we could watch something." She looks at you expectantly. After a moment, you manage to stammer out:
"S-sure Molly, whatever you want." She grins at you:
"That's what I was thinking." She reaches with her paw and turns on the T.V. For a couple of milliseconds, you admire the perfect reception, picture and texture of whatever it is she's watching. Than the sound hits you. It feels like a physical blow, banging you on the head. Your brain starts feeling like it will split open, you think your eardrums must have ruptured. You cover your ears, to little effect. You realize vaguely that you are on your knees from the sound. You also realize that you are screaming, but can't hear your own voice. Looking up[ painfully, you see that Molly is totally enraptured by whatever's on. You start screaming her name, but she doesn't hear you. She is flicking channels, but it doesn't make a difference to you. You want it OFF. Finally, you start punching her, out of sheer frustration; you don't think it will have an effect. It does. You punch her couple of times, then your first sinks into her [ad in a certain spot and Molly howls with pain. She drops the remote and clutches her suddenly limp hand, whimpering slightly. This, of course, was not good for you. You drop through the air, the noise pounding in your head, until you hit the carpet. There you lie, dazed and almost unconscious from the noise.

After what seems like an eternity, the T.V turns off and the noise ceases. The world looks a bit fuzzy, and you have a tremendous headache. Before you can gather your wits, something, Molly obviously, grabs you and roughly jerks you into the air, which almost renders you unconscious again. You are brought before Molly's snarling face, clutched none-to-gently in her claws. She looks furious:
"Why'd you do that, Huh? Why? That really hurt, I oughta..." She is shaking you furiously like a rag doll in her claws, which is causing you indescribable pain. You get really angry as you start to recover:
"That really hurt, did it? Good!" You interrupt her furiously. Molly stares at you in shock as you continue ranting "That dammed T.V hurt me much worse. If you hadn't been so stupefied by that thing it wouldn’t have happened! That hurt me MUCH more than it hurt you. You ‘oughta’? I 'oughta' you!" You finish ranting to be confronted by Molly's snarl, which intimidates you even when you’re furious. She opens her mouth, stops, then looks at you in pure disgust. She lowers her claws and drops you roughly to the ground, though not far enough to actually hurt you. She rises to her feet without a word and stomps over to the other side of the room, where she sits down and cradles her hand. You try to think through the pounding headache. You are still mad at her, so you sit down and turn your back on her, arms crossed sullenly. You both sit there in silence for a long, tension filled 10 minutes until...
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Exchanged hurts

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
You decide to make the first move. As your head gradually clears, you actually start to think about what happened. She hurt you with the T.V by accident, you hurt her with your fists on purpose. She has been nice to you, until now, and you don't want to make her feel bad. Your anger, however, wars with your feelings for Molly. She had dropped you, picked you up, hurt you even more. Would a nice person do that? Your feelings are troubled for a while, but come back with the fact that you had hurt her first. After 10 long, uncomfortable minutes filled with anger and self-recriminations, you believe it's your job to apologize. As your anger dies down, it is also replaced by cold logic. You should never have 100 foot tall carnivores angry with you, no matter how nice. You get up stiffly, still smarting and turn around. Molly is flexing her right paw, studiously avoiding looking at you. As you walk over, you feel her eyes on you, but refrain from looking up. It takes you a few minutes to get to her and you finally look up again. You are confronted with a view of her very tall legs, which reach the knee before going out of sight. You stand between them and try to work up some courage. It takes a moment, but finally you are able to call:
"Molly?" You call very softly, but she was listening for you. She quickly leans over in her chair, looking straight down at you. You are looking straight up; her head is positioned right over your body. You can't read her expression; you just hope she's become a little more forgiving. Right, you better get this over with:
"Molly, I'm really sorry that I hurt you. It was just that the sound was hurting so much, and you couldn’t hear me. I know, I probably should have found another way but i just couldn’t think. I..." You trail off, finished with your awkward and highly embarrassing speech. She blinks at you, and you just stand there, awaiting a reply. Finally, she manages to get something out:
"Keane, I'm sorry I overreacted. I should have known that much sound would have hurt your ears. I just wish you hadn't punched me!" A little of her old anger creeps into her voice, causing you to flinch. She immediately looks mortified when she sees you cower:
"I'm sorry, I did it again. I should control my temper." She sounds just as embarrassed as you, and she trails off as well. You both wait, tension thick between you as you struggle to understand and accept. You can't meet each other's eyes. Then Molly manages to work through her embarrassment. She puts her paw down beside you. You note it is not the one you hurt. You hesitate for a moment, than climb on, grateful for the release. She quickly straightens out and lifts you up to her face:
"Apology accepted, Keane." She tells you, her voice thick with emotion.
"Apology accepted, Molly." Your voice is just as thick. She gives you a small, tentative smile and you giver her one back. Than she looks at you strangely:
"Do you mind if I pet you?" She asks. You realize the question is an important one. You only have to consider it for an instant before giving your answer:
"Not at all." She looks a bit happier and reaches in with a claw. You lie down on your stomach, hoping she will massage your back. She complies, using the back of her claw to stroke up and down your back. You sigh softly and she keeps doing it. It feels REALLY good after that fall you took. She seems happy of your acceptance. She gently lowers her paw until they’re resting in her lap. She continues to pet you for quite a while and you continue to relax. Eventually her petting tapers off and she just cuddles you. It isn't so bad, actually. Eventually, though, she lifts you back to her face, gently:
"Do you mind if we watch T.V? I'll turn it way down." she assures you hastily. You look up at her and nod peacefully. She'll at least be more aware of you, this time. She cradles you gently to her chest, which you enjoy immensely and stands up. She walks over to the nearest cushion, which is farthest from the T.V, and sits back down. She has a sudden idea and lifts you past her shoulder. She sets you down so you are reclining against the cushion as well, back on the cushion and legs on her shoulder. You put your hands behind your head, she notices the movement and copies you. This forms a hollow for you, between her neck, shoulder and arm. She turns on the T.V and you tense up for a moment. She immediately turns down the volume and the noise reaches you like a slightly muted conversation that is conducted by giants. You relax and mindlessly watch as Molly settles on an afternoon show, some strange thing or another that involves a lot of talking and inexplicable cultural references. It occurs to you, suddenly, what an odd picture this would make if anybody came in right now. The gentle sounds of conversation envelop you and you nod off blissfully. You wake up....
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Reconciliation

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
You gradually fade into consciousness, comfortable, but still sleepy. You notice that you are in Molly's paws and with a groan you sit up. Molly's legs surround you, she must be cradling you in her lap. Looking up, you see Molly is leaning over you, a smile on her face:
"You were sleeping so peacefully. It was a shame to wake you up, but it is time for dinner." She sounds faintly regretful. You are still in the T.V room; she probably just sat up and picked you up to. You lounge back in her paw, which is being held in the other, and smile back up at her. You enjoy the moment, but it immediately passes when Billy sticks his head in the room:
"Mom says you've got to come to the table now." He sounds smug; he gets to order his sister around in a secondhand way. Molly loses the smile quickly and shoots Billy a glare:
"Yes I know you brat. I'm coming." Billy grins nastily at her and leaves. Molly glances down at you and you have no trouble guessing what she's thinking:
"I'll be fine, he can't do anything right there." You wish you felt as certain as you sounded. Billy is just to full of spite for comfort. Molly nods grimly, than stands up. You stand up as well, grabbing one of her claws. It's blunt, except at the end where you don't try to touch it. Molly walks into the dining room and takes her seat. There are two courses again, much to your relief. Molly sets her paw down on the plate and you jump off. Dinner proceeds as it had the night before. You are very careful not to get anywhere near Molly, she seemed to transform with the meat at hand. She did remember to give you some, though. You munch on it, staring fixedly at te tablecloth and trying to ignore the sounds of the wolves eating. You are covered in grease again by the time their done. This time they all finish at once and Molly's mom clears the table. Billy leaves as soon as he can, leaving the other three at the table. The father looks at you carefully, and then looks up at Molly:
"I see that you're getting settled, that’s good. Anyway, school's tomorrow so you have to go to bed." He was sounding very odd, because you can't tell whether he is referring to Molly or to you both. Her mom speaks up:
"Yes dear, time for bed. Be sure to wash your pet and keep it collared!" You wince at the emphasis in her voice, on both "pet" and "it". You shiver, grateful you chose to come to Molly instead of her mom. You don't like her attitude either. Molly glowers at her, but doesn't say anything. She just nods at her and looks at her father:
"Goodnight dad." She doesn't even look at her mom. She picks you up and swiftly departs the room.

Once she gets to her bedroom, she immediately locks the door and heads into the bathroom. After she turns on the light she starts filling the sink and meets your eye for the first time:
"I'm really sorry about her, she is one of the people who think of humans as an 'it'" you can hear the anger in her voice "unfortunately, most people see it that way. Try to ignore it." You nod up at her:
"You're dad seems nicer, though." Molly nods considering:
"He isn't quite as firm believer as me, but yeah, you're right. He hates family conflict, however, so we can't think of him as support. Well, anyway, ready for your bath?" It isn't really a question; the tub is full and all. Molly reaches over and picks you up, than uses her other hand to remove your collar, untying the knot in the back with her claw. The fur falls away, still cordlike, to her pad. She puts it on the counter. You stare at it in distaste. Molly's mom had made it brutally obvious what it was, a sign of ownership. Still, it could be worse. You could belong to her. Or Billy, you think with a shiver. Molly is silent for a moment, than shakes it off. She reaches for you hesitantly, looking at you with an obvious question in her eyes. You sweep your hands in an after-you gesture and she happily removes your clothes, tossing them in the basket. She quickly sets about washing the grease from your body, with the same blissful massage as before. Once she's done, she drains the tub and lets you lie on the towel. She changes into her oversized t-shirt and panties outfit she uses for sleeping. You can barely keep your eyes open, filled with food and blissful from the wash. You hardly stir as she carries you over to the bed. She sets you on the pillow, than reaches over to your drawers. She puts the collar on the seventh shelf, which is high above your head. You wonder why, than you realize it is to keep you from getting at it. When she's done, you glare at her from the pillow. She notices, and shrugs in a what-can-you-do fashion. She smiles timidly and strokes your naked body gently. You let her, but you feel the resentment fade into a secure place, ready to come forth at any moment. Probably not at Molly, though. She's too nice for that. She turns off the lights, curls up under the blankets and falls asleep with you under her chin, paw resting over you. You fall asleep as well.
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: A "Superior" Mother

choices: You're riding with her nice dad
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
"Keane." Someone is shaking you. You moan sleepily and turn over. Then you notice something’s odd. Your bed isn't nearly this soft and you usually don't sleep nude. Your eyes snap open and lock on the giant paw shaking you. You feel a scream coming, than you shake out of your grogginess and remember everything. You sit up wearily and look for Molly. She has already sat up and is leaning over to shake you. She looks a bit concerned:
"Forgot again, huh?" You nod at her:
"Yeah, I guess it will take me a bit of time to get used to this." She looks sympathetic:
"I'm sure you will. At least you remembered before you fell down the pillow again." She gives you a wan smile. You recall the incident from the day before and venture a smile of your own. She seems satisfied, so you stand up. You wobble a little in the soft footing, but manage to stay on your feet. Molly yawns and stretches, which is a bit disconcerting to your still-befuddled mind. Than she puts out a paw for you. You scramble on and she lifts you to her face:
"We gotta get moving if we want any breakfast." You wave and she sets you on the nightstand "Get some clothes on; I'm going to take a shower." She walks over to the big dresser and takes out some clothes, than heads into the bathroom. You look at her, shrug and head over to your dresser. You open the drawers and study the clothes available. You hesitate for a moment, not knowing the fads or the temperature. Finally, you choose some undies, a pair of loose pants like jeans and a grayish shirt. You scramble into them, then remember the collar. You look up at the seventh drawer. It's high above your head and closed. You know Molly put it in there to keep you from tampering with it. You consider opening the drawers like steps to get at the collar, than start imagining ripping it to shreds or throwing it out or burning it. You stop and chuckle to yourself. She knows me more than I thought, you think. You know that it's all that will protect you out with all those wolves, but it is humiliating. Especially after the things her mom said earlier. Just than, the bathroom door opens and Molly steps out. She's wearing a blue shirt and some jeans. The shirt is not all that revealing, but not that unflattering either. You wait for her to come over. She does, springy in step, very much the morning wolf. She grins down at you when as se stands there:
"Ready to go?" Her tone is bright, she really has boundless energy. At least, to your point of view. You wave up at her and smile, suppressing feelings of anxiety. You’re a morning person yourself, at least after you've actually woken up. You’re glad of that, because she gets up REALLY early, judging by the sky outside.
"Sure!" you call back up at her, trying to put some energy in it yourself. She reaches to pick you up than stops. She narrows her eyes at you:
"You forgot about the collar, so you’re not ready." She looks faintly amused as you squirm under her gaze, embarrassed. You had hoped you might get away with it, actually. You grin up at her sheepishly. She rolls her eyes and chuckles, than reaches for the drawer. Drat, you think. She gets the collar and puts it around your neck. The fur is soft and comfortable and you don't try to resist. How could you stop her? She picks you up:
"NOW your ready." she half smiles at your expression and pets you gently with a claw on her paw. She gets on her knees and reaches under the bed.
