She pulls out her backpack and puts it on, awkwardly because she's holding you with one hand. She slings it over one shoulder and heads downstairs, with you in her palm, sitting because of her antics.

She gets into the kitchen and sits down at the table. Her mother is bustling around in the kitchen, you see to your dismay. Her mother brings over a plate of eggs and bacon with milk. She glances down at you, collared and sitting and nods approvingly at her daughter. Molly rolls her eyes at her mom's back and sets you on her plate. She pushes over some food for you. You both start munching on it with gusto, but Molly doesn't show that food-craze that seems to come over all wolves confronted with meat. That's definitely fine by you; you really don't want to have to deal with it more than once a day. After she finishes her food, and scoops up the remains of your meal, she gulps down some milk, and offers the rest to you. You drink some of the refreshing drink; it's really cold, but very good after the meal. Molly gulps the rest and sets the glass back down on the table. She clears her plate and cup, leaving you on the table. You wander over to the salt and pepper shakers, which are taller than the ones at home. They tower over you. You stop examining them when you hear footsteps. You look over and see to your complete terror that it is not Molly, but her mom. Molly is washing the dishes and doesn't notice her mom. Her mom comes up to the table and looks down at you. She yawns slowly, giving you a full display of her teeth. You cower against the shakers, pinned by her gaze. Her paw comes up to the table, reaching towards you. You look at it in horrified fascination, trembling with fear. It reaches you, than goes over you and picks up a set of keys a few feet from you. She grins evilly when she sees you drop to the table, weak kneed. She keeps it on as she walks out the room. Molly rushes over as soon as she's out of sight and picks you up, cradling you against her breasts, reassuring you:
"Sorry about that, Keane." She pushes her paws out, so she can see you. You just sit there, gasping. Sorry is not really an adequate cover for her. You nearly pissed you pants! You look up at her:
"Is your mom," you manage to gasp, "always such a sadistic bitch?" you demand. She looks down at you oddly:
"Well, whatever 'bitch' means, which I'm sure isn't complimentary," you feel horrified, your glad Molly doesn't know what it means, it would have offended her terribly. "I'm sure I'll find out eventually." she adds with a sly grin when she sees your expression. "Anyway, to answer your question, no, not really, just to humans." That isn't really comforting, since you're the only human within grasping distance. "Anyway, we have to go. I can't wait to introduce you to some of my friends!" she adds. She puts her backpack on fully and heads for the door. You are worried, however. How are you getting there?
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Wajing up on your first day of school

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Molly walks out the door. Outside, you see two cars in the driveway. Suddenly, one of them starts and pulls away, an impressive sight in and of itself because of its (relative) size. You can see her mom in the car and breathe a sigh of relief. You won't be riding with her, at least. Molly watches her go, and then you hear a car honk, an enormous foghorn that makes you jump. Molly does jump a little, which results in you ending up on your back on her palm. You hear her father call:
"Molly, come on!" He must have come out while you were being confronted on the table by her mom, you would have heard him otherwise. Molly quickly gets into the car beside her dad. She slams the door shut loudly, very loudly to you. You don't cover your ears, though, you seem to be getting used to the effect of such loud sounds. You sit up in her pad, trying to stand through the ride would be impossible. He starts the car and pulls out. He turns down the street and starts driving. You watch him drive. It is slightly mind-boggling. You couldn’t have possibly moved that wheel with your whole body, and he is doing it with ease with one or two hands. After a while, you reach a stoplight. He turns in his seat and looks at you, than at Molly:
"So, you're ready for school today?" Again with the plural you, he is much more acknowledging of your existence and intelligence then his wife. Molly answers:
"Yeah, I think we're ready." You nod. He fixes his gaze on you:
"So, Keane, we haven't been properly introduced. I'm Mark Wolfesbourg." You feel a little awkward about carrying on a conversation with this enormous, fairly forbidding figure. He is gigantic, and you’re not all that familiar with him. However, it is only polite that you reply:
"Hello Mr. Wolfesbourg, I'm Keane Molly's new... um..." You trail off helplessly, not wanting to say the word. He looks down in amusement as he starts to drive at the green light:
"Pet?" he offers. You nod your head with some trepidation. How was he going to act? He chuckles softly: "Don't worry; I know it's hard to hear. Still, it could be worse. You could be 'Molly's lunch'!" He laughs heartily at this while you look up at him in confusion. This is definitely not what you expected. He goes on: "You're probably right to hate the word. I would in your position. However, there's nothing that can be done. 'Pet' is the most,... kind word that we use to describe humans. Don't be offended to much if I refer to you that way, I mean it kindly, not contemptuously like SOME people." You consider this argument. You know that his wife is certainly contemptuous and cruel, and he and Molly are nice and respecting even as they acknowledge your 'lower' status. You decide to speak:
"Mr. Wolfesbourg..." he interrupts you:
"Please, call me Mark. Whoever chose the family name must have been nuts, it's such a cliché. Would you like to be called "Humanesbourg?" You shake your head:
"No Mark, I see your point. Anyway, as I was saying, I kind of get your point. It is still humiliating, though, no matter what you say." He acknowledges this with a nod:
"Yeah, I know. You'll just have to learn how to bear it, there are hoards of fanatical morons who would start calling for beheadings if we started to refer to you as 'person' or anything else that could infer 'equality' between humans and wolves." His tone is contemptuous and sarcastic. This is a new side of him, he wasn't nearly so forceful in the house. Molly finally breaks in:
"Yeah, I really hate people like that!" Her tone is angry, which Mark recognizes immediately:
"Molly, calm down. We can't solve anything by picking fights with them." She looks sourly at him and nods reluctantly. He returns his gaze to you:
"Keane, it's nice to make your acquaintance. Maybe we can talk some more after school." He sounds regretful that you can't talk more now. He parks the car and holds ouy a claw. Molly reaches over with you. You grasp the claw carefully and he shakes your hand, and you, up and down. You are faintly dizzy when he stops. Molly kisses him and gets out of the car. As the door closes, you hear "Have fun today, you two. Stay out of trouble." Molly rolls her eyes at the last and the car pulls away. She looks down at you:
"So, Keane, what'd you think?" You smile up at her:
"He is nice, much nicer than your mom." She nods at this and heads towards the school, petting you with one claw as she goes.
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: "Meeting" Mark

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Molly walks into school. Around her are other wolves, all wearing backpacks and all more or less her age. You glance around nervously. The school seems like any other, lockers on the wall, wooden doorways with windows and white tile. It's not really tile, however, it is something else, slightly squishy and smooth. it must be there to keep from hurting the wolves' feet. The noise is incredible, many people talking all at once. You don't have to cover your ears, but you find it hard to distinguish what is being said. As Molly walks, you attract some attention. Discreet nudges and stares in your direction make you feel nervous. It is not enough to disrupt normal high school life; quite a few of them just look at you and go back to their conversations. A few are curious, but most are not familiar to Molly. She is followed by the inevitable "a human!", and "where did you get him/it". Molly just keeps walking, occasionally answering a few of them, people she knows. She makes a point to say "him" as she tells people she found you in "the wild". You wait nervously as she talks, traffic forcing her, and you, very close to the person she's addressing, whose mammoth torso always towers over you. Thankfully, none of them want to talk to you or, even worse, hold you. Probably they have the privacy rule ingrained into them, even if they are wiling to bend it in talking with Molly. Finally, she reaches her locker, which is a floor-to-ceiling affair.

She opens it and carefully sets you on a shelf before unloading her books into it. She looks at you, eye level to her because of your placement:
"You okay?" She asks. You nod:
"Yeah, I'm fine. It is a bit noisy for my tastes, though." Just then, you spot a couple of wolves peering at you and whispering. You point at them: "I think the gossip mill is running already." Molly nods:
"Yeah, nothing stays private around here for long. You're a novelty around here, the last human who came to school with her master left a few years ago." You feel a little jolt:
"Her?" you ask. Molly looks grim:
"Yeah, she was caught by a real jerk. He treated her awfully, and a rumor went around that she died a little while after her master graduated." She looks angry "I saw the way he treated her, it was disgusting, slave like! I heard that her master was taken to the principals office a few time, though" she adds even angrier "not for her treatment, but because it was distracting." She is getting really enraged. You don't want a scene, so you wave franticly at Molly:
"Molly, I know it's bad but please, they're gone now and we can't do anything about it! Please, calm down." Even as you're saying this, you can't help but wonder what exactly she means by "horrible treatment" and "slave". After all, isn't she YOUR master?

She lets out a breath, slowly and seems a bit calmer. You are grasped by stupidity for a moment and ask the question you just thought. She draws back for a moment, looking hurt. She pushes her face into her locker, forcing you to back up into the wall. She speaks:
"Keane, I'm nothing like that Jerk! Believe me; I treat you much better than him. He made her strip naked and chained as he went, until the principle insisted on some covering. Torture was used and constant humiliation in class! I don't do any of that, do I?" She looks sad and sounds desperate. You walk forward hesitantly and pat her on the muzzle, feeling released from that momentary stupidity. You speak reassuringly:
"Of course not Molly, I'm sorry for saying that." You hug her nose, but flinch when you feel how cold she is. She giggles at that.
"Thanks for understanding Keane. Apology accepted." With that, she gets playful. She moves her snout into you, than moves left. You are caught unaware and you fall down. She puts her jaw on top of you and rubs, applying pressure on your body. It is tight, but fun. You struggle to push her off with your arms, to no affect. You push her as hard as you can, managing to inch her jaw up before your arms give out. You make a demand:
"Molly, get off me!" you say, laughing and trying to breathe at the same time. She laughs to, than squashes you back down for a moment before drawing back so that you can stand up. She smiles at you, than grabs her books for the next class, at which point...
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Small man on campus

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Suddenly, Molly's head jerks up and a look of consternation spreads over her face. You can barely hear a soft, high pitched bell ringing, though you imagine that the wolves with their sensitive ears can hear it fine. Molly quickly stuffs all the stuff into her backpack, which she slings over one shoulder haphazardly. She swipes you up and slams her locker with a resounding SLAM. As she moves quickly to her class, you can hear resounding SLAMS echoing throughout the school as other wolves quickly go to class. You are a bit uncomfortable, Molly is holding you in a fist and you are a bit dazed from the abrupt departure from land (shelf, really). You tap her pad, careful not to punch her hard, you don't want a repeat incident. Molly ignores you, so you decide to just bear it. You curl up in a ball and wait.

Molly opens her paw and you sit up on her pad. You are entering a classroom. You can see lots of desks, and a blackboard in the front. There is a teacher’s desk off to the side. There are beakers, burners and chemicals on every desk and you can see, twisting around, numbers and Wolfish characters on the board. You guess you're in chemistry. Molly heads to the back, followed by the eyes of her curious classmates. Molly takes a seat next to a girl. You see that she's wearing a blue blouse and miniskirt and some thin glasses. She is gray, far less silvery than Molly. She does not have a very attractive figure, but she has beautiful brown eyes and a ready smile for Molly, who sets you down before sitting. She peers down at you, an expression of curiosity and faint wonder in her eyes.

She leans closer to get a better look and you back up involuntarily. She doesn't look very threatening, but all wolves are dangerous to you. She speaks up:
"It's okay, I won't hurt you." She keeps back some, but still examines you intensely. Molly’s paw comes up behind you and she scoots you a bit closer to the girl. Her friend speaks up:
"Hello, I'm Amanda and your a human, Molly's new pet, right?" She speaks very quickly, in a higher pitch than Molly does. You nod, unable to figure out why she needs to ask. You also speak up:
"Hi, I'm Keane!" You can't really think of anything else to say.

Amanda smiles at you before looking at Molly. She starts a barrage of questions and comments:
"He's cool, where’d you get him? Are you keeping him? Why didn't you call me?" She looks like she wants to say more, but a voice interrupts:
"Settle down class." You look up and see a youngish wolf, probably in his twenties, addressing the class. Molly and Amanda quiet down with the rest. The teacher, Mr. Sima as it turns out, commences the lesson. You find it hard to follow; your view is blocked by the lab equipment.

Molly and Amanda have gotten out notes and are scratching furiously. You carefully avoid their papers and walk in front of the equipment. You see the people in front of you, who are also taking notes. Mr. Sima is writing on the board and talking to the class at the same time. You listen without comprehending the writing. You get a vague picture of the lesson, which is on thermo chemistry. You grasp some of it and resolve to ask Molly about the rest, it is actually fascinating. He is a good teacher. Eventually, he finishes the lesson and has the students to do the experiment. You walk back to Molly, who is putting away her stuff and putting on safety goggles, designed for a wolf. They both complete the first steps while you stay out of the way and very far away from the burner. Finally, they let the concoction sit and heat for a while and return their attention to you. Molly patiently answers all of Amanda's questions. Suddenly, A shadow falls over the two girls. You all look up and see Mr. Sima who is looking at you with curiosity. You look back blandly, feeling emboldened by Amanda. He looks at Molly:
"See me after class, please." He keeps going after checking their experiment.

Amanda looks after him for a moment before bursting out into giggles. You and Molly look at her and she replies;
"He's HOT!" she whispers very softly. Molly rolls her eyes and starts to pet you. Amanda follows the movement:
"Can I...well...pet him?" You look up at her. She looks faintly wondrous. Molly looks at her for a moment, than down at you. She speaks:
"Keane, do you mind?" You consider the question. Molly doesn't seem hostile or condescending, and she is a friend of Molly's. You shake your head. Amanda sees this and reaches over eagerly. You look at her dubiously, but don't back away. She starts to stroke you, a bit rougher than Molly does, but not uncomfortable. She looks happy after a moment and pulls away. She looks faintly embarrassed:
"Thanks Keane, I just couldn’t resist." She grins at you and you wave back. You can tell she would like to ask more, but has to go back to the experiment.

You watch them finish, a red frothy liquid resulting. Amanda seems to grasp the material a bit quicker than Molly, but both are confident in their answers. They finish up, hand in their papers and look at the clock. The lesson must be about to end, because Amanda says:
"Sit with you at lunch?" Molly agrees:
"Sure!" Amanda gets up when the bell rings and bounces up after giving you a pat and a smile. You smile; her good humor is a bit infectious. Molly gets her stuff and heads over to Mr. Sima's desk. He is...
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Amanda

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Molly walks over to Mr. Sima, who is grading papers. He looks up and sees you, riding in her paw. He clears his throat disapprovingly:
"Miss Wolfesbourg," he begins, ignoring Molly who rolls her eyes, "as you probably know, the school's policy towards humans is rather open. However," he continues, looking menacingly at you, "I expect you to keep it under control. I also except you to meet the, ahem, behavioral guidelines on yourself as an owner. Am I perfectly clear?" He looks strict and disapproving. You think the expression will get stuck on his face. You take his insults in stride; he doesn't seem hostile or even very interested in you as a thing, just as a source of disruption. Molly, on the other hand, looks angry. She looks at him in disgust and forces out:
"Yes, I think I do." She turns her back on him and walks out of the classroom.

In the hallway, which is fairly empty, she looks just about ready to explode. Her eyes seem to be focused on something not really there, her teeth are bared and she is breathing heavily. You call up to her:
"Molly!" She looks down, startled. She still looks very angry:
"Keane, that jerk..." She looks like she wants to hit something, which is not a good sign for someone, mainly you, in her paw. You try to reconcile her:
"Molly, let's just get out of here." she casts a last glance back into the classroom and walks down the hall, still angry. You urge her into a small side corridor and have her sit down. She cradles you in her lap.

You climb up her arm to her shoulder and head over to her head. She looks at you during all this with curiosity. You know that she needs a hug, so you walk over to her neck and give her one. She stiffens for a moment, than brings up a paw and hugs you back. She accomplishes this by pressing you still further into her silvery fur, into her neck. She does this for a minute or so, than draws you in front of her face so she can see you.

"What was that for?" she asks, puzzled.
"I thought you could use a hug, so you would think happy thoughts instead of angry ones." She looks at you strangely:
"Weren't you angry to?" she questions, disbelief showing all over her face.
"Of course I was, but I really can't afford to get angry with someone that large. Besides, so many wolves seem to share that view. I can't get angry at all of it, and neither should you. You've got to ignore it." You urge her. She seems to accept what you're saying, dubiously.
"Yeah, I guess you're right. Still, when people who are supposed to be smart and understanding say things like that..." she starts to get angry all over again.

You interrupt:
"Molly, really, don't think about it. It is insulting an humiliating, but it's a fact of my life here. You should get used to it to. As long as YOU and other people close to you like Amanda and Mark are nice to me, I can take it. You should be able to as well. After all, they're insulting me, and you're not a tiny, insignificant thing to them." You finish you're speech, surprised about the honesty of what you're saying. You hadn’t thought about it that way before, but you see that it's true. Molly listens to you with wide eyes and when you finish she hugs you again, smashing you into her fur, though it's on her chest:
"I'll always be nice to you Keane. You’re not insignificant to me. You're right, you're the one being insulted by this and you manage to stay calmer than I do. I should learn to control my temper." She holds you back out again and gives you a wan smile, which you return. She gets up and holds you carefully as she heads for her next destination. You call up to her:
"Molly...
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Temper, Temper

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
"Molly I, uh, have to go." you say this quickly. You really do, you haven't gone for quite a while. Molly darts a glance at you as she turns into another hallway.
"I do to, come on." You don't really have much of a choice in the matter, riding on her palm, but you nod. She heads for a door and reaches for a handle. You see the picture of a girl wolf on the door.
"Molly," you say, pointing. She glances down:
"What... oh." she thinks for a moment and considers you. You wait nervously, this will probably get embarrassing. "Well, you obviously can't go by yourself over there,' she says, nodding at the other door, with a boy wolf on it, "so you'll just have to come with me in here."

You start to object, but she covers you with her other paw and carries you in. It is rather closed in, and you are thankful you aren't claustrophobic. You hear female voices echoing, distorted and muffled by her paws. She opens her paw a few seconds later. You're in a stall, with green walls and a toilet. The toilet is very large to you, a long drop into a small pond. Molly brins her paws very close to her face, nearly squashing her black nose into you:
"Keane," she whispers VERY softly, "you will have to, um, go first." She looks really embaressed. She kneels in front of the toilet and puts you on the seat.

Looking down, you can see the 20 foot drop into the pond-like toilet. You feel very, VERY nervous. You really have to go, but you involuntarily start thinking of exuses no to. Molly looks slightly sick:
"Go on, I won't look." she sits down and turns, studiosly loking at the door. You quickly decide to get it over with. You pull down your pants and sit down with your butt sticking ouy. You go quickly, stomach heaving as you hear the faint splashes far below you. You start to stand up, than remember toilet paper. You look at Molly, who hasn't moved an inch this whole time, though she did wince at the splashes.

"Molly..." she starts to look at you, but you cut her off, "no no, I need some toilet paper." you say hastily. She nods and reaches over to the dispensor and rips of a piece, which she thrusts blindly at you. You take it and note it's toughness. It's really heavy and dense, hard to tear. You quickly wipe, trying not to think about the difference. You pull up your pants and call out to Molly:
"I'm done." you inform her. She reaches a paw behind her and picks you up. She stands up and brins you in front of her face:
"Keane, I'm going to have to trust you now. No peaking!" she says sternly. She puts you on the toilet tank and you turn around obediently.

You have very little difficulty resisting the urge to peek. All you have to do is imagine being on the toilet seat while she sits down, crushing you. The loud waterfall and splashing sides help you greatly in this endevour. You gag when she reaches for the TP, her butt must've left the seat and released that awful smell. It is intense and foul. You hold your nose as you hear her stand up and pull up her pants. She swipes you hastily off the tank before she flushes. Thankfully, she uses her left hand, which doesn't stink. She leaves the stall and goes to a sinnk.

She hastily washes her hands, and you do the same, with her help. Thankful that that emberassing ordeal is over, you watch as she exits the bathroom. She heads through the crowded halls, still drawing curios stares. She ignores the people who hail her and procceeds directly to her locker. She puts you on a shelf without meeting your eye as she switches books. She looks at you and opens her mouith, than closes it abruptly. She loks flustered, so you break in:
"Why don't we just not talk about it?" you suggest. She nods, relieved. She shoulders he books again and heads for her next class.
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Not talking about it

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Molly walks for a little while, with you in her paw as usual. You watch the crowd go by, some looking at you, some not. It is very crowded, and Molly has to weave her way through the crowds. You consider riding on her shoulder, but a sudden stop knocks you off your feet. She didn't bring a safety line; you'd get knocked off within moments. Molly enters a packed side corridor, shoulder to shoulder traffic. The crowd seems determined to try to go two ways in this narrow (to them) corridor, so Molly enters the line. She gets jostled immediately, sending her stumbling. You nearly fall of her paw, but manage to grab a claw. Molly rights herself and sees you dangling, so she curls in that claw and you get back on her pad. She starts to get pressed by the crowd and she has less space for her paw. She doesn't even look at you, by an instinct born of crowds she smushes you into her stomach. It's hard to breathe, and your face is pressed into her shirt. You elbow her in the pad, hard. She immediately lets up on the pressure, but your still pressed into her stomach. At least you can breathe. She gets out of the crowd and enters a door, letting you back out as she goes.

It's a normal classroom, with desks and all the rest. It's rather small though, only about ten desks. She goes to one close to the blackboard and sets you down, then gets out her stuff. She notices your mussed-up look:
"Sorry about that." You wave her off, you know it was necessary:
"It's fine. Anyway, what class is this?" she smiles:
"It's one of my favorites, Three Races." She notices your curious look, "It's a class about lifestyles, food, diplomacy and pretty much everything else about the three races. It's not history; we study current events and other things about the Great Cats and Bears, then compare them to our own. It's an optional course, but I had to take something and this sounded interesting." You agree:
"It really does, I can't wait to see what it's like!" she smiles at you. Just then, several students enter the class and notice you sitting on Molly's desk. They crowd around her desk, and you look nervously at their enormous torsos clustered around the suddenly small desk. All of them start talking at once, asking questions and offering opinions. Molly holds up a palm and they die down:
"This is Keane, and yes, the rumors are true. The ones that say I won't eat him." A few of them chuckle at this. They all stare at you, fascinated. You look up nervously at their far-away faces, all bright with curiosity:
"Uh Hello!" you call up. You watch them blink in surprise, exchanging glances. Suddenly, a boy drops down to his knees, bringing you to just below eye level. You back up a step nervously. He reaches a paw, than extends a claw:
"Hi little guy, I'm Jon. You shake the proffered claw carefully. He smiles and stands back up. All of the others start clambering and Molly lets them shake your hand to. They all seem to be nice. The bell rings after the last of them finishes, and they all hurry to take their seats, though they do cast several glances over their shoulders.

A large wolf walks in, a male somewhere in his early thirties. He spots you and comes over. He looks down at you and smiles. He turns to Molly:
"Well Molly, this is an unexpected turn of events. I hadn't thought a human would show up here for a while." He turns to you:
"Hello, I'm Mr. Kan. He extends a claw and you take it:
"Hello, I'm Keane." He nods at you, still smiling:
"This should be interesting. I just thought of a whole new project for the class." He announces the last to the whole class. Most of them groan and he laughs, "It's not like that, don't worry. You need to find out about humans among the Three and be ready to discuss it. You would do well to start your research with Keane here." He turns and goes to his desk, where he sits down and starts grading papers. You hear several people stand up and start dragging their desks over, quickly followed by the rest. Molly takes out a sheet of paper and a claw pen. She is obviously going to take notes. The class forms a circle and you stare out at the class, who are all looking at you expectantly. Jon winks at you, than starts speaking:
"So, how'd you two meet?" he asks without preamble. You glance up at Molly, who is smiling and waves a paw at you. You clear your throat nervously and start talking. You tell them, haltingly, how you met molly, but you omit earth. They gasp appreciatively when you describe nearly being eaten. You decide not to mention Molly's breasts and various levels of nakedness as you describe what it was like, with some help from Molly. They are all fascinated. When you describe various incidents with condescending wolves, most of them shake their heads angrily. You finish up and look around nervously, wondering how your speech would be received.

They all look at you for a moment, and finally Jon breaks the silence:
"Well, that's certainly a view I haven't heard before. I must say, it’s an interesting perspective." All of the others break in with agreement, and a general conversation commences. Apparently, the students all have different things to contribute. Jon seems to know a lot about human treatment in Wolf society, beyond general knowledge. You learn there's actually a law called "Indecent Human Exposure" which basically controls human torture and nakedness, in public at least. You also learn about humans in Bear and Great Cat continents. There are different codes for the different areas. The Pumas and Grizzlies have evolved a tradition of eating humans, while the more reserved Browns and Leopards seem to have rules similar to Wolf society, with a lot in between. You get quite a few looks of sympathy as the class dissembles over different areas. Wolf society seems to be as kind as it gets, quite a few places have human eating as a delicacy, or human hunting as a sport. You unconsciously cower a bit closer to Molly as time goes on, and she strokes you gently. Thankfully, none of the class seems inclined towards condensation and you actually get a lot of sympathy. Finally, the bell rings and the class gets up to leave and Molly packs up.

After they're all gone, you feel Molly's gaze on you. You look up at her and she looks entirely sympathetic. You shakily try to make light of it:
"Well, it's a good thing I landed with you, don't you think?" Molly isn't fooled:
"Oh Keane..." She gently picks you up and cuddles you into her chest and you start to cry. You're stunned by the magnitude of it all, the amount of human lives lost to these giant carnivores. You are comforted by Molly and she makes sympathetic noises at you. You bury yourself in her shirt. Finally, you're spent and she pulls you away. She looks down at you:
"I thought you could use a hug." You smile wanly at her. and she returns it. She gently brushes a tear from your face with a claw. She balances it on her claw, which she raises to her face. She tastes it with her tongue:
"Salty." she notes. You don't say anything. She looks at her shirt, where an impressive spot of wetness is blotted.
"It really is awful. It's one of the reasons I get angry at wolves who say things like "it" to you. That sort of thinking led to current treatment of humans." She stays silent for a moment and you look at each other. She brightens a little:
"I think you need some comfort food!" she tells you.
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Magnitude

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Molly picks you up and heads out of the room. The hallways are noisy, as always, and she heads into even bigger crowds as she goes into the cafeteria. Like any cafeteria on earth, there are tables and noisy students with lunches on trays. Molly goes into one of the lunch lines, making her way slowly up to the food. She draws curious stares from the other students, but they are all focused on the food. Molly herself is looking hungrily in the direction of some meaty smells. You decide to try and break off the cycle this time. Your really not in the mood to see Molly attack her food. You wave at her. She doesn't notice, which is a bad sign. You go over to one of her claws and push on it. That gets her attention. She looks at you with food-crazed eyes, which abruptly clear up. She looks at you questioningly, and you pre-empt her:
"Molly, I was losing you there." She looks startled and uncomprehending. She turns her gaze back towards the food, but she doesn't seem likely to go food crazy, at least. She picks up a tray and dumps you on it. She pushes her tray down the line, picking up some chicken and bread. It looks weak and unsatisfying compared to Mall food, but she doesn't complain. She also gets a thing of ice-cream. She pays for it, than heads out of the cafeteria.

She goes outside and sits under a tree in front of the school, with you and the tray in her lap. She looks at you questioningly:
""Losing me?" she asks you. You nod with a little apprehension:
"Well, um... you kind of, well, go nuts with your food. All wolves seem to." you assure her hastily as she looks at you weirdly, "It's just that it's kind of, scary. You look so different. I hoped you wouldn't this time, that's all." You explain all this in a rush, not sure how she'll react. She looks odd for a moment, than bursts out laughing. It's really loud, and the tray shakes, knocking you over. She stops:
"Sorry Keane. It's just so funny; I've never actually heard anyone tell me that's weird. Everyone else does it, even the other Races." You're not exactly sure what's funny about that, but you nod:
"Yeah, well, I just feel like a piece of meat when you're like that, that's all." She snorts:
"Keane, I would never eat you, not even like that. But if it scares you, than I'm glad you brought me back to reality." You nod relieve. She sets into the sandwich, though with less gusto then usual. She offers you a piece, and you sit there, munching contentedly.

You finish up and stand up, wiping away the crumbs. Molly has already finished and is looking at you expectantly, with a mischievous grin on her face. You get suspicious:
"What?" you demand. She grins even wider:
"I just thought you might like some dessert, that's all." You nod carefully, knowing full well she's concocted some sort of scheme. She smiles and takes off the lid of the ice cream. She looks around, mock confused:
"Dear me, I seem to have forgotten my spoon." You smile, realizing what she wants. You push up your sleeves:
"Well dear lady, a man like myself never lets a lady like yourself get into such a situation. May I" you ask her with a bow and a flourish, mock gallant. Molly giggles:
"Why noble sir, how kind of you to offer. Thank you, I accept." She whisks you into the air and drops you on her ice cream. You stumble slightly, your feet immersed. Thankfully, it’s not too cold. It is chocolate, dark brown and extending to the sides of the bowl. You feel the bowl lift and see Molly peering at you. You grin and wave at her. She grins back, and then she shakes the bowl a little. You stumble to your knees, immediately covering your legs in the brown substance. You mock-glare up at her and she giggles again, before managing:
"Why noble sir, It is impolite to keep a lady waiting." She reminds you. You roll your eyes at her, than set at the ice cream. You dig a trench in a half circle with your arms, which are immediately covered in ice cream up to the elbows. When you're done, You reach under and struggle to lift it. you manage to flip the ice cream over, a fairly large piece. A blur of red flashes at it and Molly's tongue recedes back into its mouth, taking the delicious morsel with it. Molly makes smacking sounds:
"Ummm, sweet and delicious. You really must try some.” You wave at her, than scoop up a mouthful for yourself. It really does taste good, and you set about making more "spoonfuls" for Molly.

After quite a few more, at which point the ice cream is starting to melt, Molly starts lapping around you with her tongue. You contentedly watch her demolish what took you quite some time to work at. At last, you're resting on the bowl, surrounded by chocolate. Your feeling bloated, having consumed quite a lot (to you) of the stuff. You feel contented as you stare up at Molly, who is looking down at you. Suddenly, the playful grin returns:
"There is still so much left. You are quite filthy noble sir; please allow me to clean you off. Your mind has slowed down and you nod contentedly, not actually thinking about it, just about her deep, blue eyes... You're shaken out of you're reverie as her tongue darts at you. You flinch involuntarily, but she still manages to lick you're whole body from head to toe. You come up sputtering and watch her tongue recede into her mouth. She tastes it for a moment, than grins at you:
"That was a very delicious morsel. I think I will have another. Turn over please." You do so, and feel her rough tongue slowly make its way up you're legs, avoiding you're shirt and continuing to your arms and neck. You get thoroughly wet, however. You stand up, dripping saliva. You glance up at her smiling face:
"I'm not sure this is much of an improvement." you inform her. She giggles:
"Well, that's your opinion. But you're right; we need to dry you off." She gently lifts you and carefully, but firmly, rubs you down. You feel rather sore, but bear it. When you're done, you are completely dry. You're actually rather clean, but your collar seems to have gotten soaked. You point this out to Molly, who chuckles:
"Are you sure this is not just a ploy to get me to take it off?" She asks you perceptively. You are feeling too good to argue, and strangely silly:
"Alas, you have caught onto my ploy. It is really uncomfortable right now, though." She nods knowingly:
"I know, fur can retain water for so long! Here, I’ll dry it off." She carefully undoes the fur and takes it off. You're glad to be rid of it, at least for a moment. You rub you're neck. It is not really a problem, as long as it's not wet. Molly proceeds to shake, beat and dry it out. Suddenly, a shadow falls over you two. It's...
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Gallant with Ice Cream

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
You squint up against the sunlight. You make out the form of another girl wolf, who starts talking:
”Oh my, a human without a collar! Whatever shall we do, the world’s coming to an end!” You hear the giggles behind the high-pitched voice and you know it’s Amanda. She sits down beside Molly and looks at you, eyes bright with interest. Molly greets her:
”Hey Amanda.” She continues to dry out your collar.
“Hi Molly, Hi Keane. You should be careful though; any number of people might start screaming if they saw you without a collar.” You and Molly roll your eyes at her. Molly finishes and extends the dry collar. You let her put it on. Amanda may be silly sometimes, but she is right. Molly lifts you off the tray to chest level. Both girls look at you, and you return their gaze. Molly breaks the silence:
”Keane, I’ve got to throw this away. Do you mind staying with Amanda?” You consider it, than agree:
”Sure Molly, if…” you leave “if you trust her” hanging. Molly nods and gently hands you to Amanda, who looks delighted:
”Thanks Molly, I mean thanks Keane. I’ll take good care of him, I mean you” she assures both you and Molly, stammering. Molly grins at her:
”Amanda, it’s just for a moment.” Amanda looks slightly disappointed, but nods. Molly gets up and walks off towards the school. You stare at Amanda for a moment, who is watching your every move. You feel self-conscious, this is the first time you’ve been alone with another wolf. Amanda looks just as self-conscious as you do. You decide to break the silence:
”So, Amanda, Molly must really trust you.” You offer. She smiles:
”Yeah, she knows I’ve always been fascinated with humans. So, where’d you come from?” You decide to trust her, and tell her about earth, and about finding the crystal. She listens avidly as you give her a short version of your tale, again omitting the intimate parts. She tells you about being friends with Molly from kindergarten, and she assures you she’s not like those “arrogant jerks” that you’ve already met. You relax, she may not be Molly but she is her friend and you feel safe with her.

When Molly comes back, she finds you in conversation about the school. The three of you talk about what it's like for each of you. The girls are especially interested in your perspective on it. You chat there for a while, not actually discussing anything of importance, but reveling in talking as equals with these two giant girls. You enjoy talking about school wide gossip; it's a lot like your school on Earth. You get handed back and forth several times, and stroked absently by both girls. Finally the bell rings, and Amanda, who has you, reluctantly gives you back to Molly, giving you one last pat. Amanda looks at you both:
"This was fun; I'll have to come over some time, to see what you're like at home." She adds with a grin. You and Molly glance at each other and Amanda giggles:
"Bye!" she stands up and walks off with you and molly looking after her. Molly speaks:
"Exactly what did you tell her while I was gone?" she asks you slowly. You just shake your head and watch Amanda head into school, nearly skipping with excitement:
"Nothing like that." You tell her honestly. She looks at you skeptically, but you keep going: "Cross my heart." you tell her. She ponders for a moment:
"Maybe she meant something else. Than again, she has always been perceptive. Maybe we gave ourselves away." You shrug, and so does she. She stands up and heads into school.
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Perceptive Amanda

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
To your immense relief, nothing of great importance happens after that. Molly takes you to Wolfish, which is very boring for you because you cannot read Wolfish, so you sit there and idly watch Molly write an essay on something. You remind yourself again to ask Molly to teach you. The teacher, Mrs. Krine, is indifferent to you, not rally interested and neither condescending or nice. After that Molly, carrying you goes to Computers. This is interesting, but again hard for you to decipher. The keyboard has indentations on each key, to catch Molly's claws when she types. You don't even understand the assignment, so you just watch her type. Her claws blur over the keys while you watch, producing enormous characters on the screen. After a watching for a while, you come to believe that she's programming script for something. When the teacher looks at it, however, she just shakes her head and moves on. Molly casts a rueful glance in your direction, which you return:
"Not so good?" Molly just rolls her eyes and keeps typing. Apparently she really stinks, because she gets a really bad grade (you think). After that, she heads home. She goes to her locker, packs up her things and carries you to the bus. She gets on and heads for a seat in the back. Sitting down, she puts you on her backpack, which puts you at a good talking level. She turns to you:
"So, how was your fist day of school?" she asks you. You consider it, and then respond:
"Interesting, to say the least. It's not that different from my school on earth. Though," you add when she gives you a look, "mine DEFINETLY isn't so big." She smiles at that. Just then, the bus lurches forward and you stumble. You get to the edge of the backpack and start to fall... only to be caught by Molly. You stand up, the wind knocked out of you. She gently puts you back on the backpack. You look up at her:
"Thanks. Nice Reflexes" You tell her sincerely. She grins:
"Now Keane, don't you know you're supposed to sit down on the bus?" you share a laugh with that one, although you do sit down. She thinks of something and loses the smile:
"It must've been awful, hearing about the treatment of humans." She offers. You nod:
"Yeah. I really got lucky, when I came to you. It could've been bad if i'd landed in Puma territory." you tell her with a shudder. She gives you a look:
"You're right Keane. I know it sounds cruel, but try not to think about it. You're with me, so don't 'what if' yourself. Doing that will just make you a nervous wreck I’ll keep those idiots away from you!" she tells you solemnly. You smile at her:
"Thanks Molly." You decide to change the subject:
"Uh, molly?" you offer hesitantly.
"Yes Keane?" she asks you.
"Could you, uh, teach me to read? Well, teach me to read Wolfish, I already can read and it's just that I want to be able to read Wolfish." you say this in a rush, feeling kind of embarrassed that you have to ask for something kindergarteners learn. She considers this:
"Well Keane, I don't know. It's could be so difficult. I mean, it's kind of a time-consuming chore and I have things to do..." your heart plummets, why is she acting like this? She looks at you for a moment, than bursts out laughing. You look at her, perplexed. She manages to get a breath:
"You should've seen the look on your face! Priceless!" she chuckles some more. You start to get mad. This is so humiliating! Molly sees this and sobers up: "Honestly Keane, I was just teasing you. Of course I will! You don't even have to ask!" She strokes you gently, and you yield to her claw. It just feels so good! You let her massage you. She does this for quite some time before she lets up. She smiles at you:
"This won't be so difficult, you're intelligent. I'm sure you'll learn in no time at all." she assures you. Just then, the bus stops. Molly looks out the window. She picks you up gently, but quickly, and slides her backpack on. She exits the bus, although she does draw a few curious stares. She starts to walk down the sidewalk. You look around. You're not sure, but you think you're still quite a ways from her house. You ask her and she nods:
"Yeah, this is why we took dads car in the morning. We've got quite a walk, we're on the other side of town." You nod and she keeps walking. You share an amiable silence until you get to her house, about a half-hour later. She goes in, slams the door and yells:
"I'm HOME!" she bellows. You cover your ears and wait for your ears to stop ringing. You look reproachfully at her:
"Was that really necessary?" you demand. She grins a toothy grin:
"No, but it WAS fun!" she tells you. Who answers her loud call?
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Bus from your first day

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Mark walks into the room. Molly brightens when she sees him:
"Daddy!" she cries delightedly. She rushes over to him and slams into him, hugging him and plopping a kiss on his cheek. Unfortunately for you, she forgot that you are in her paw. You end up thoroughly squashed against Mark. All you can see is his read and yellow shirt. You find it hard to breathe, and your body is under immense pressure from Molly's hug. You elbow her paw. She doesn't notice, but Mark seems to notice the movement:
"Uh, Molly? Where's Keane?" Molly looks at her paw, which is squashed against her dad's back. She immediately jerks her paw away and steps back, looking at you. You are in a spread eagle position on her pad, looking thoroughly squashed. You gaze up at her. She looks guilty and slightly worried. She nudges you with a claw:
"Keane?" she asks. You groan and make your stiff muscles work, sitting up. You glance up at Molly, who looks visibly relieved:
"Could we not do that again?" you suggest mildly.
"Sorry Keane, won't happen again." she tells you.

Just then, Mark chuckles. Molly looks at him:
"What's so funny?" she demands.
"I've got a human shaped imprint in my shirt." he informs her. She shakes her head:
"Dad, you’ve got the strangest sense of humor." she informs him. You pipe up:
"I think it must be genetic." you tell them. She swivels her head to you:
"What's that mean?" she demands fiercely. You tell her:
"Wasn't it just recently that you forgot the spoon to your ice cream?" you ask her innocently, "and I do seem to recall several incidents with your tongue in strange places." you say suggestively. She immediately shrieks:
"Keane!" Mark pipes up:
"Didn't somebody dress up as a fairy and run screaming through a zoo one time?" he asked mildly. She turned towards him:
"Dad!" she shrieked again, her face fur standing out in a wolfish blush. You turn towards mark, pretending to be fascinated:
"Really? Do go on!" you urge him. Molly by this time is almost reduced to tears in embarrassment, looking angry, embarrassed and humiliated all at once. You and Mark look at each other, than burst out laughing. Molly looks like she's about to spit fire.

Your laughter dies down, and you look up at her accusing face:
"Sorry Molly, but I owed you that one." you inform her. She shifts her glare to Mark:
"And what's your excuse?" she asks him, eyes glittering. He looks back innocently:
"There was this incident at the mall involving some undies, a forged signature and a very obnoxious daughter laughing behind me the whole way." With that, he starts laughing again, and you join in. She growls and punches him, and she looks at you with a dangerous light in her eyes. You stop laughing and start to get worried. She grins evilly and abruptly tilts her paw, sending you plummeting into space. You fall for a few moments before you hit her other paw, which was positioned below you. You recover from the abrupt terror and the impact and glare up at her:
"Bully!" you mock shout up at her, waving one fist, "using unfair advantages to silence the voice of ridicule!" She just grins at you, no longer looking mischievous. Smiling and laughing with good humor, the three of you make your way into the living room.

Molly and Mark sit down and put their feet up on the living room table. You recline on Molly's thigh and look up at the two. Molly turns to Mark:
"So dad, why'd you get home so early?" she asks him. He looks at her:
"I got done at the office early." he informs her. He looks at you:
"So Keane, how was school with Molly? I hope this maniac didn't get you into to much trouble." he adds with a sly grin. Molly squawks indignantly, and you chuckle. You consider your answer, than look at Mark:
"Seriously though, Molly wasn't that bad. A little playful maybe, but certainly not crazy. A lot of the others though, weren't as considerate." He nods grimly, and Molly's face darkens. Molly bursts out:
"I didn't know so many of the people there, especially the teachers, were such jerks!" Mark looks at his daughter blandly, and you know that there's a lecture coming:
"It's hard to call these people jerks, Molly." he has his best "wise father" look on. "Quite a few of the greatest philosophers, artists, wolfists, charity workers and philanthropists have been bigoted against humans. This is not to say," he says, glancing at you, "that such prejudice is condonable, or that the resulting actions have ever been less than horrifying. It is just that most wolves, and the other races two, can't seem to handle thinking about creatures so small as intellectual equals or even as sentient beings. It just seems to make them madder when confronted by it."

He finishes his lecture and looks at both of you steadily. You nod reluctantly, what he's saying makes sense. Molly also seems to accept it, but she doesn't look very happy about it. He suddenly looks less serious:
"And that's my word of wisdom for today, folks." You and Molly just stare at him. He sighs: "Okay, that wasn't a very good joke. Still, there are a lot of people like this, so you have to be careful. Just keep your head down in normal society, and you can talk freely with understanding people, like me."
"Or Amanda." you offer. He looks surprised:
"Amanda? Oh, you must've met her at school. Now that I think about it though, you're right. She never did strike me as the type to disregard human intelligence. She's just too smart." Molly glares at him, and he hastily adds, "and nice also." Molly sighs, but you know you've gotten through to her. Mark looks at the clock: "Cathleen and Billy will be home soon, so please avoid more family conflict." He looks at you and you shudder, remembering their attitudes towards you. Molly gets up and heads towards the stairs with you.
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: You owe her

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Molly walks out of the living room and picks up her backpack. She heads up the stairs and into her room. She flings her backpack onto her bed, where it bounces up and down accompanied by metallic BOING's. She goes over and sits down herself. She puts you down on the bed and you watch as she fluffs up her pillows. You feel the rush of air as she swings her legs up, leaving her sitting on the bed with her back on the headboard. You walk over to her. She is rummaging through her backpack, and draws out a book. You stop below her. She looks at you and smiles:
"Come on up!" she invites you. She reclines a little. You look with some trepidation at the difficult climb ahead, than get to work. You climb up her leg, using her jeans for handholds. She watches you, smiling. You wait for a moment, catching your breath, than look up at her:
"Any chance of getting some help?" you ask, already knowing the answer. She just shakes her head slowly, looking thoroughly entertained. You reach her shirt and she leans back a little more. You start to ascend her torso. You struggle your way past her navel, than her stomach. You get to just below her chest and look up. Her breasts are looming in front of you, miniature hills with a valley between them. You see her grinning face through that valley. She looks slightly sympathetic as you wait there to catch your breath:
"You know, you could wait there if you like." she offers. You grimly shake your head. You've come this far, you'll go all the way. You continue you're climb, gradually coming between her breasts. Suddenly, the hills loom closer and you get enveloped in her shirt and squeezed between her breasts. You squirm for a moment before sitting still. You can't get out of this without some help. You're warm prison suddenly draws back and you remain between her breasts with her looking down at you, grinning even wider. You wave good-naturedly at her; it was certainly more pleasant than some of her tricks. You keep moving until you reach her shoulder, where you stop.

She straightens out to an almost-sitting position. She draws her knees up and puts her book on the resulting incline. You look down as she opens it and immediately recognize her geometry book. You look at her:
"I thought we finished geometry." you tell her. She turns towards you, looking annoyed:
"We only got through some of it, okay? So you'll have to help me with this as well, so I will teach you to read. Got it?" she snaps, looking angry. You contain your feelings and look at her steadily. She looks startled, obviously excepting a bigger reaction. She sighs:
"It just makes me so angry, I'm not very good at this stuff and she assigns SO much homework. So you help me and that just makes it worse because..." She stops suddenly, looking mortified. You struggle to control your emotions, with limited success:
"Because I'm so small or because I'm human? is that what you meant to say?" You let a ;pt of anger into your voice, you sound level and very cold, for maximum effect. She visibly flinches and looks very, very guilty:
"Keane, that's not what I meant, I..." you interrupt her:
"You what Molly? You meant to say something else? Like what? No, I don't think so. I think this is an accurate picture of how you really feel." Your words hit her like blows; she almost shrinks as you accuse her. You stop shouting, panting from you're volume and the anger in your system. She starts to sob, and she covers her eyes with her paws. You look at her in disgust:
"And now you're crying to." You shake your head. Within the confines of your brain, two reasonable voices, one stating that you shouldn’t hurt her like this, another saying that when she recovers you're going to get eaten, try to get your attention, but you ignore them. You slide down her arm onto the bed, than walk away from her. So mad now that you're seeing red, you manage to jump to the nightstand. You rip off your collar and drop it to the ground, stamping on it. Molly sobs even louder. You stamp off away from her, still blinded by fury. You manage to cross her desk and are confronted by a bookshelf. You climb a conveniently placed cord to the top. You stamp across this to, fury ebbing but still present. You're confronted by a wall. Suddenly, you hear a great gale and are hit on the side with the force of a hammer. You stumble towards the edge. Looking back, panicked, you see an enormous vent, which is pumping out warm air furiously, pushing you towards the edge of the shelves. Your arms windmill as you reach the edge, you’re confronted by an 11 story drop, which is sure to kill you. You panic and try to get back inwards, but the vent pushes relentlessly. With one last, despairing squawk, you begin to fall...
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Seein' red

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
You fall through the air. Dreamy lassitude has come over you, and time seems to slow down. You review your life, carefully inspecting it. You see childhood memories, school pranks and everything else as you're life "flashes before your eyes". You remember molly, kind to you in a world that doesn't tolerate that. You remember her angry, both at and for you. Above all you remember her playfulness, which doesn't seem that bad now that you reflect. You wince as you remember all the times you hurt her, regretting them all, especially this last one. You wish you could apologize. A logical and pessimistic part of your brain says that you could've survived if you had, but it goes deeper. You've only known her for two days, but you've already formed a deep bond with her. You think of her more dearly than any "girlfriend" on earth. You dimly hear the voice shouting at you again, but you tell it to shut up. You like this state, no anger, just peace. The world starts to go faster, and you think you hear a despairing voice shriek:
"Keane!" you dismiss it, you just hop molly won't feel two guilty. As you close your eyes and wait for the end, not liking the view of watching the bookshelf raced, you are suddenly buffeted by a sudden just. You hear a gigantic THUD, and sluggishly wonder what's going on. Then, you hit a surface and expect death...

But death doesn't come. You bounce several times than come to a rest on Molly's pad. You look to the side and see molly's face, wet with tears yet somehow radiant with relief. She's breathing heavily, breaths coming in high pitched, hysterical laughter. You lay motionless for a while, than look at the bed. It looks like a tornado hit it, with sheets strewn everywhere and the geometry book lying open on the floor. You try to picture what happened. Molly must've seen you fall and launched herself off the bed under you, hitting the wall with her back, all so she could catch and save you. Looking again at the wall, and the slight imprint in it, you mentally wince. That must’ve HURT! You are drained of anger, having had a near-death experience. You struggle to sit up and call:
"Molly." weakly. Just then, the pain hits you. You feel as if every piece of you're body is on fire, all you're bones broken. You emit a pained groan, because you can't get a scream out.. Molly sits up slowly, her gaze immediately going to you:
"Keane!" she says urgently. She sits up quickly and cradles you in her lap. This movement sends whole waves of agony through your system and this time you do manage to get out a scream. You see star and know nothing but pain for an eternity. You nearly black out several times and you completely forget everything but the pain. After an eternity of pain, you notice a persistent nagging, but comforting, sound. You draw your conciosness back up from the debths of pain. After more pain you manage to open your eyes. You see Molly's worried face hovering above you. You groan and try to sit up. The plain flairs for a moment, than starts to ebb. You manage to get into a sitting position, craning you're neck to keep you're eyes on her. She looks vastly relieved:
"Keane, you're alive" she says softly, as she cradles you. You nod to her:
"I hurt to much to be dead." you inform her. She looks worried:
"Is anything broken?" she asks. You experimentally shift all you're muscles. They all hurt like hell, but all seem to work. You shake your head and she looks enormously relieved. You wait in apprehension of the confrontation sure to come. You can see the soaked fur around her eyes, she doesn't seem to cry well. Her eyes are puffy and you can remember the vast hurt you inflicted on her. Already your pains are down to a body wide dull ache and you try to struggle to your feet. She immediately closes her claws, forming a cage above you too low to let you stand. She scolds you:
"You shouldn’t move" You wave her off and stand. She reluctantly opens her paw and you make it to your feet. You look up at her:
"You saved my life." You say simply. She lets out a breath and nods. She can't argue with that. You go on:
"I really shouldn’t have said those things. I was deliberately hurtful to you, and you didn't deserve it." you don't ask her to forgive you. She just stares at you for a while. You look around, noticing for the first time that she moved to her bed while you were out.

Your gaze rests on your discarded collar. You know what to do.
"Molly." you call, and point to the nightstand. She looks at you, startled and uncomprehending. She moves you closer and tenderly puts you on the shelf. You slowly and painfully move yourself to the collar, feeling Molly's eyes on you. You carefully reach down and pick up the collar. You hear Molly's breath catch, but do not turn. You carefully smooth out the silvery fur and gently reach up. You tie it around your own neck and turn around. Molly is looking at you in wonderment, tears standing out in her eyes. She reaches for you, carefully untying your knot and retying the collar more snugly in her wolves' knot. She moves her paws away, but you grab one claw and hold it tight. You hug her paw and she gently hugs you back. She picks you up again and brings you to her face, where you stare at each other awkwardly. Finally, molly sighs and starts petting you:
"I guess I've got some prejudice left. I really shouldn’t, I'm really, really sorry Keane." You respond:
"I'm the one who should be sorry Molly. I hurt you so bad, on purpose. I deserve all the pain I got." As you say this, a fierce glint shows in her eye. She brings you closer, speaking firmly:
"Keane, don't ever say that. It's ridiculous!" You nod in trepidation as she seems to get angry. She smiles softly. She continues to pet you, than goes on:
"Never did I expect such intelligence from you, you're just so cute!" she seems mesmerized, but then draws a breath quickly. She looks at you, guilty and awaiting your reaction. You look up at her:
"You, you think I'm cute?" you ask her. The veil between you rips away as she smiles, a cheerful, bright smile that fills you up to bursting. She nods:
"UMMM HMMM!" she tells you. You both smile at each other for a while, until she reaches for her book:
"Shall we go back to what we were doing?" she asks you. You nod and she draws back up into that position, and you help her complete her geometry, all the while staying close to her neck as she pets you.
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: You're cute

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Molly finishes the problem with relief. She looks at you. You had helped her with this last one, and you nods when you see the answer. She beams with triumph and gratitude and closes the book with an enormous SNAP. The air rushes upwards, a pleasant breeze in the still air. Molly sets it aside and looks at you sideways:
"Up for a language lesson?" she asks you. You nod carefully; the pain has subsided to a dull ache. She looks suspicious, but lets it pass. She reaches into her backpack and takes out a notebook. She opens to a blank page, refills her claw pen and begins.

By the end of your first lesson, you've decided that this wasn't such a good idea. Molly begins by drawing the wolfish alphabet. That's where the trouble starts. It has 43 characters, and has four cases, not all of which are applied to every letter. Furthermore, it is not phonetic. The wolves speak your language, but they don't use your alphabet. The different characters combine to form the sounds used by the 26 letter alphabet. M, for instance, when spelled phonetically, is a combination of 4 characters in 3 of the cases. All of the letters are like that when wolves write. And, to make matters worse, when put in an alphabet the letters have individual names, none of which have anything to do with how their pronounced. At one point, while you are standing on the notebook looking up at Molly, you burst out:
"Who invented this screwed up system of writing?" you demand in frustration. Molly stares at you and chuckles, amused. You redden, "sorry," you mutter, looking away. She laughs and pets you for a moment. She smiles:
"As to your question, I don't know. I'll look it up on the net." She returns to the writing lesson. You find that she is a very strict teacher. At one point you beg her to stop:
"Molly, enough! My brain feels like it's going to explode!" Your head does hurt. Molly pauses for a moment, glances at you, than keeps writing and narrating to you. You throw up your hands in disgust and turn around. You start walking away, but Molly's other paw suddenly blocks your path. You try to walk around it, but she moves with you. It moves towards you and pushes you back. She is very gentle, but infinitely stronger than you are. You are forced back around and scooted, still gently, back towards the writing. You glare up at her. You catch a glimpse of mirth on her face, but it is quickly wiped away into a stern expression:
"Keane, if you want to learn how to write wolfish, you're going to have to work with me. We need to cover this. Now, as I was saying..." she continues, though you catch a glint in her eye, showing amusement. You reluctantly return to the lesson. Molly's paw stays with you for a while, then relaxes and pulls back. Finally, after a period way too long for you, Molly stops. She looks at you:
"Think you've got it?" you would have to be crazy to say no:
"Barely." She grins:
"Good, because there's going to be a quiz next time" she says in a mocl-stern voice. You prepare to vent your outrage at her, but she grins wider:
"Just kidding!" she laughs and you laugh to, relieved. You stop when your body starts to hurt again. She looks sympathetic:
"Does it hurt?" she asks. You nod. She frowns:
"That’s it mister, no more work for you. Light activity and bed rest only. Owner's orders." she adds when you look like you might object. You swallow your words. She does have a point, you do hurt, but she has to say it like that? She notices the look:
"Hey, you put the collar on. That means you have to listen to Me." she points out. You nod, conceding the point. You put it on, to show you trust her. You have to trust her now to. You decide to change the subject:
"Uh, Molly?" she looks down at you:
"Yes?" she asks curiously. You point towards the bathroom. She nods: "Okay." she gets up and heads into the bathroom. She sets you in the sink and passes you some tissue. She then stares down at you. You glare up at her:
"Do you mind?" you ask sarcastically. She turns around. You go quickly, and then get Molly's attention. She picks you up carefully and runs water. She then heads out into her room. She looks at you:
"Wanna listen to some music?" she asks.
"Sure." you reply, intrigued. She gets out a stereo. She opens a case, revealing a C.D. She puts this in and music immediately blares out. You cover your ears and she turns it down. She tells you about the band, and album, and you spend the next hour or so critiquing her collection, which runs from ordinary to truly bizarre music.
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Difficult Writing

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
You listen as the end lyrics of a slow, eerie song that is filled with howls comes to an end. You look up at Molly, who was listening raptly. She looks down at you and grins:
"Interesting, don't you think?" she asks
"Uh, sure. Whatever." you mutter to yourself. Of course, she heard you and pretends to be hurt:
"What's wrong with it?" she asks you." You consider your answer carefully:
"Uh, it was just, uh, weird."" you fumble through awkwardly. She snorts:
"Weird, huh? Well, you're right. They are weird. But GOOD weird, no what I mean?" You nod your head, totally clueless. She rolls her eyes heavenwards and mutters something that distinctly sounds like "boys!" You chuckle. She rolls her eyes again and picks you up. She swings her legs off the bed and stands up. She looks down at you:
"We're going out." She reaches over to the nightstand and opens the eighth drawer of your dresser. She removes some rope, which you recognize as your harness. Strange that you didn’t notice her putting it in. She puts you down on the nightstand so she can tie it around her neck. She then moves for you. You are about to lift your arms when you have a dark thought:
"Molly, is this a leash?" you ask her, watching her face. Her expression is all the confirmation you need, though she quickly stammers out a negative:
"N-no Keane, It's just a harness." You just look at her, arms crossed over your chest, waiting for her to cave. She doesn't go easily: "Keane, can you just put it on." You don't budge. She starts to shift from one paw to the other. You meet her eyes and enter a staring contest, part of you thinking that this might not be a good idea, she usually wins. This time however, after a period of tense silence, she looks away:
"Alright Keane, pretty much everyone sees it that way. Now will you just let me put it on?" she sounds exasperated. You smile and uncross your arms, lifting them so she can tie. She brings her head close to keep the line slack. You look at her seriously:
"Molly, I don't object that much to having this thing on. It's doesn't even compare to the collar. But please, be honest. You think of it that way too." She flinches, which sends you stumbling. You right yourself and wait for an answer. It comes swiftly:
"Fine Keane, I think of it as a leash. You think of it as a leash. Everyone thinks of it as a leash. Can we go now?" She sounds even more frustrated. You nod:
"Okay, I just needed to know." She looks a bit happier, and sets you on her shoulder. She makes her way downstairs and walks out the door, with you standing on her shoulder.

She makes her way down the street, heading into the center of town. You take in the enormous sights and absently run your hand through the soft fur around her neck. Other people are walking around or working in their yards. They call out hellos and wave to another, and chat in quite a few places. Several of them call out to Molly. She waves back, but doesn’t stop. It could be any other town setting, had it not been that it was filled with gigantic wolves. As she gets farther away from her house, she gets fewer greetings. Eventually she makes her way into the shopping areas. Stores line the sidewalk, portraying wares in their windows. You look in as Molly walks. There are a lot of meat shops, and other Wolvish things. A school supplies store shows the Wolvish pen on a sign, and everywhere there is Wolvish on the signs. You glance at these as Molly keeps walking. You can make out individual letters and there case, but can’t tell the words. You sigh. Molly glances at you questioningly. You explain:
”I still can’t read the signs.” You explain. She laughs:
”I wouldn’t think so, you’re not really all that literate yet.” She says this kindly, but it still stings a little. You nod, but it shows on your face. She adds hastily: “No offense.” You relax a little. She seems preoccupied, her face concentrated. You venture:
”Something on your mind?” She looks at you quickly:
”Not really, well, I guess so.” You prompt her:
”And?” She grimaces:
”I was just thinking that it was odd, the way you reacted to the leash. I mean, I didn’t even make it out of my fur, which I could’ve you know.” She waits expectantly. You consider the question, and answer:
”It’s still humiliating Molly. It always will be. However, it wouldn’t be so bad if you were honest about it.” She flinches at that:
”What do you mean?” she asks, sounding dejected. You answer:
”It would be better if you told me the truth. It’s already humiliating enough, without you trying to keep it hidden.” She looks even more guilty:
”Sorry Keane, I’ll try to be honest next time.. I just feel bad, telling you stuff like that.”
“Next time?” you ask, puzzled. She looks at you sadly:
”We’ll deal with that when we come to it.” She informs you. This entire conversation seems to have made her miserable, and you feel a little guilty. You hug her nexk one armed, speaking almost directly into her ear:
”Cheer up; it’s not so bad, now that you’ve told me.” She perks up and presses her cheek into you for a moment as she walks.

You reach your destination, a pharmacy by the pill sign. Molly walks in. You find yourself in a well lit, wide space. The counter is right in front of the door, but you see rows of shelves behind it. A soft bell rings and a wolf comes to the counter. His eyes take in Molly, and then he spots you. His lips curl back slightly from his teeth in an expression of distaste and your heart sinks. This will not be pleasant for you. Molly doesn’t seem to notice and walks over. She addresses the wolf:
”Sir, do you have anything that can relieve pain and promote muscle and bone repair?” she asks him. You realize that this is for you and make a note to thank molly. A painkiller sounds excellent. The shopkeeper looks at her in disgust:
”Is it for that?” he asks her, pointing an accusatory claw at you. You hear Molly’s breath catch and can practically feel her getting angry. Her voice remains calm though:
”Yes, it’s for him.” She stresses the last word. You notice the man looking at you like you’d look at a dirty rat. It makes you angry, although you have an easier time keeping calm. He looks at Molly:
”We don’t carry things for humans.” He spits the last word out, “I advise you to go see a vet.” Molly clenches her fists, boiling mad. She looks him straight in the eye:
”Maybe I will, jerk off. He probably would be more competent than you.” She spins around abruptly; almost making you fall off, and walks out of the store. On the sidewalk, she walks out of sight before stopping and breathing heavily. Her pupils are dilated again, and you think she’s going to explode. You grab a strand of fur and pull hard. Her paw comes up reflexively and almost hits you, but you throw yourself to her shoulder. You look at her neck and see that she hit her neck, she almost swatted you! She starts breathing normally and looks at you:
”You okay?” she asks, removing her paw. You nod and stand up, aching from her hard shoulder. She isn’t in a blind rage, but she’s still mad. She stomps down the street until she comes to another shop, which she enters, nearly slamming the door. She walks up to an elderly wolf woman, who seems to be reading. She looks up at molly:
”Can I help you?” she asks calmly. Molly nods and reaches up quickly. She snatches you off her shoulder and holds you out, leash extending to her neck:
”He needs some pain relief and muscle repair stuff. Do you have any?” She is acting very aggressive. The lady peers down at you, than nods. She goes over to a shelf and picks out a bottle. She hands it to Molly:
”It’s a lotion, to be rubbed into dry skin. I’ll ring you up.” She goes over to the counter, where she pounds a few keys and a piece of paper comes out. She puts this down for molly to sign, which she does. As she is about to leave, the lady adds:
”I see by your expression you ran into that old fart, Sturve. Ignore him, he’s an idiot.” Molly looks a bit calmer and nods gratefully. The lady smiles, than goes back into the store. Molly puts you back on her shoulder and heads out the door.

She looks at you sideways:
”Sorry about the rough treatment, I was just angry.” You wave her off:
”its okay.” She nods and heads over to a fast food joint. She buys some cheeseburgers and sets to devouring them while she’s walking home. You watch her eat for a little while, than tap her. She glances at you, than tries to speak. It comes out a mumble and she sprays you with hamburger bits. You grimace and wipe these off. She swallows, an extended lump on her neck, than tries again:
”Sorry. Want some?” You nod gratefully. She reaches up and offers you the one she’s eating. It’s got teeth marks on it, and it’s dripping wit saliva. It looks thoroughly unappetizing, but you accept it, using your hands to tear off a chunk as big as your torso, with Molly’s help. You sit down on her swaying shoulder and eat it, trying not to notice the teeth marks and saliva. It’s actually pretty good, better than fast-food on earth. When she’s done she looks hungrily at you’re chunk. You’re done, so you offer it to her. She grabs it and chucks it into her mouth. She jogs home with you on her shoulder.
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Chewed fast food

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Molly gets back to her house. You're still on her shoulder, although you did fall once during her jog. You watch as she opens the door and heads insider. She looks around:
"Mom, dad?" She calls as she walks through the downstairs rooms. In the kitchen she finds Billy, eating some raw meat. His snout is covered in blood and he has that crazed look. Molly walks over to him and you enjoy being able to look down at him. He comes out of it when he sees Molly:
"Mom and dad went out." He says his mouth full. Some chewed up meat sprays out at Molly, who grimaces and wipes them off her shirt, leaving red stains. She glares at Billy:
"Watch the merchandise, squirt." He just sniggers. He sees you and his eyes gleam hungrily. He stares at you and you take a step back, nervous. He gets a malicious expression:
"You leashed it! Good, now it knows its place! An even better one would be here." He says, pointing at his blood-smeared plate. He stares at you hungrily and malevolently, wanting to see your reaction. You quickly move closer to Molly and see her get angry. She growls and looks down at Billy, who looks apprehensive.
