1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Billy and Keane worked long into the night doing everything they could to help Molly. Molly asked Billy to open the curtains so she could see the night sky one last time. Billy granted her request and did what she asked.

"My last wish is to see a world where humans are treated like our equals before I...," Molly started saying.

"MOM, DAD! COME QUICK! IT'S MOLLY!" Billy shouted. Within a matter of seconds Mark and Cathleen Wolfesbourg dash into Molly's room.

"Molly, Molly, wake up. She's not breathing. I am not getting a pulse. NO! MOLLY!" Cathleen shouted as she examined her daughter.

"She's gone. There is nothing that can be done to change it. At least she is now at peace," Mark said reassuringly to his wife.

"Even though we might not have gotten along, I still wish we had more time together," Billy said as he started crying.

"I just wish I could wake up from this bad dream," Keane said as he looked out the window. All of a sudden Keane notices a shooting star. "Billy, you need to be careful what you wish for. Are you absolutely sure that is what you want?" Keane asked.

"What are you talking about?" Billy asked.

Keane replied "I just saw a shooting star."

"What is he talking about? How can a star bring our daughter back?" Cathleen asked.

"Have you ever heard about shooting stars? There is a saying about 'shooting stars' granting wishes," Mark informed his wife. A strange light suddenly started to fill Molly's room. "I am starting to think that the saying is true," Mark added as the light began to spread to the rest of the house.

"What is happening?" Billy asked as he became worried.

"You know what your wish was. You remember Molly's dying wish, right. And I wished to wake up. I think some wishes are going to be granted," Keane answered.

Once the light filled the whole house, everyone inside vanished.

Keane woke up back in his bedroom. Besides the fact the green crystal is missing, it was same as it was before. All of a sudden, Keane hears someone call his name. It was...

"Maybe, refresh my memory and tell me about her," Keane replied.

"I found a ______ sleeping on the living room couch. I woke her up and she seems a little lost, but when I asked her if she was one of your friends, she answered 'yes,' then she introduced herself. She looks very healthy and fit for a teenager. She said you helped her with her Math Homework..."

"There is no doubt. It must be her," Keane answered.

"I did little research and found out her family moved into the neighborhood recently. I decided to invite them over for dinner this evening so we could get to know them,"

"You might want to be careful around her mother, she has a bit of an attitude," Keane warned his mother.

"Her family seemed relieved to hear she was okay. They agreed to let her stay here until after dinner. Don't keep her waiting in the living room. Hurry up and get dressed," Keane's mother told him as she left.

Keane got dressed quickly and then headed for the living room. When he got there he saw a ______ and greets her then tells her what happened.

His eyes had some dashing look to them. His smiled had just warmed, if not melted, your heart. His shirt was nicely tucked in. It was a dark blue with a collar on it. His pants were dark blue as well. He had his shoes on and they were nice. They were dress shoes. All together he was dashing looking while you looked like someone that went to a consert.

choices: Think of some way to help Molly beat the jerk
Just hold on and ride it out
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
"So this is the new pet I keep hearing about," says a most unpleasant voice from behind Molly. You turn on your perch, getting to your feet quickly and looking at the speaker. The voice, which sounded deep and menacing is accompanied by a form that matches. The wolf boy with pitch black fur looks much taller than Mark, Molly's dad, and bigger too.

It actually takes your mind a moment to wrap around the fact that all that you are seeing is him, as he doesn't wear a shirt, leaving his bare fur against the air. For a moment you wonder about the fashion sense of the world you ind yourself on, but all thoughts are driven from your mind as that face leans closer.

For a moment you are very much reminded of the first moments you spent on this odd planet, in which Molly nearly ate you off a sandwich, and probably would not even have known it. This guy is even bigger, and you can see what look like bones jammed between his jagged teeth. Still, Molly meets his gaze with the fire you've come to expect of her.

"What do you want, Dork?" she tells him, staring up at him. You realize that their heights are probably close to a foot from each other in their measurements, but to your diminutive gaze it looks like he stands miles above her, and you feel proud to call her your friend, though still more than a little weird about calling her your owner.

"That's DARK Wolfesbourg, and I wanted to see this new pet of your's everyone's talking about" he tells her in an irate tone of voice. You realize in that moment that these two probably have some kind of history with each other, and that at this moment you have become a plaything in their struggle, because Dark seems very interested in you, leaning closer to Molly's shoulder to geta good look at you before she pushes him away.

"Well you've seen him, no go away," she tells him, taking her books and spinning away from him, nearly tossing you off her shoulder in the motion. With a will you are able to grab her fur and stay put, but behind you Dark is growling and baring his teeth. Obviously Molly just insulted him by turning her back to him, and with a speed that is astonishing to you considering his size he runs in front of her and slams his fist into a locker, denting it.

"Come on Molly. Haven't you ever heard of sharing? I just want to play with your little snack before you gobble him up," he tells her, his fingers making a kind of crawling motion through the air towards you. Molly, the instant he touches her, responds in the way you expect, she smacks him in his snout with her paw, and pushes him back.

When he gets on his haunches and growls deeply at her, and she responds likewise, you realize their about to go at it, one of the big clues being the gathering crowd which is growling likewise, almost in the same way people gather in a human school chanting, fight. It doesn't take a leap of genius to realize that them fighting while your on Molly's shoulder is a bad thing, but what can you do?
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Are you afraid of the Dark?

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Looking at the titanic black wolf boy before you, you cannot think of a single thing you could do that might hurt him besides giving him indigestion, and you don't plan on doing that for anybody. Still you have to help, if not for yourself then for Molly. She's been really nice to you, in her own way, and she listens...to...you!

With a stroke of inspiration you think of one thing that might help get you both out of this, but you have to get Molly to do something before you can do it, otherwise you're going to hurt her worse than you're going to hurt this jerk. For a moment you consider just going through with your idea, but then decide to at least try and warn her.

"Cover your ears Molly!" you shout at her, and you see her eyes, which had become little dots, grow a bit and focus on you, she leans her head a little closer and whispers at you so no one else can hear, not that any of the others are listening anyway, intent as they are on Molly and Dark who continue to circle each other.

"Kinda busy here Keane, can we talk about this later?" she asks sarcastically, snapping at Dark and nearly tossing you off her shoulder. When things settle again, and you get back up to you perch on her shoulder you decide to try and tell her one final time before you use your idea and see if you're as smart as you think you are.

"No it can't, cover your ears, NOW!!!" you shout at her, and watch as her ears, which are bigger than you, flatten against the sides of her head and then she puts her hands on them. With a quick in take of breath you prepare, and for a single instant everything is quiet, as the crowd and Dark try to figure out what you an Molly are doing. Then, raising your fingers to your mouth you whistle as high loud as you can.

For a second you think you might be wrong, as nothing seems to happen, but then you watch as the other wolves in the hall grip their ears, falling over as the high pitched squeal of your whistle does to them what it does to dogs at home, causes the bones in their ears to vibrate so fast it causes extreme pain. Dark, being the closest is howling with fury, but he is on the floor like the others, gripping his ears down.

After a few minutes you stop, and you look at Molly. She seems to be okay for the most part, but as she uncovers her ears she winces in pain. Even with her hands blocking most of the sound, there was still some leakage, and your little whistle was right next to her ears. She staggers a bit, but she smiles at Dark on the floor, and then walks up and kicks him while he's down before walking off, leaving him and a crowd of wolves to recover.

"What did you do Keane?" she asks, a little louder than she's ever said anything to you before. You realize that her ears must be ringing, and that it proves you were correct. The giant wolves, and probably the other two dominant races of this world as well, are based off small prey predators, and their ears are ultrasensitive to high pitched noises. Obviously your diminutive size raised your whistle by an octave or two as well, and looking back at the pile of fur, you feel proud of yourself.

"I didn't think you guys would have heard of whistling. It's something humans of my world do to control animals. I didn't think it would work so well though," you tell her, wondering why it did work so well. You know high pitched noises cause certain animals pain, and whistling can either drive away, or attract certain predators, but those wolves seemed to have been in a lot of pain from you little blow. And if it was that painful why didn't the humans of this world use it against them? Molly eyes you for a moment and continues on her way. After a moment...
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Keane finds a new way to fight

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Unfortunately at that instant a very big wolf staggers out of what you can only guess to be an office. Obviously a big wig at the school you realize that you probably just knocked out half the student body, and your just a pet. Something like this would get you put down on Earth, and here it probably gets you put down someone's throat.

"Miss Wolfesbourg, what is the meaning of this?!" he demands, waving his hand at the pile of students, some of whom are finally struggling to their feet and walking off. Their staggering gait tells you that their ears are still ringing, and you turn to face the teacher, who's odd green suit and red fur clash awfully in your opinion.

"I did it, not her," you shout at him before she can say anything, and the large wolf eyes you suspiciously.

"You did this? How, you're a human, an appetizer. So how is it injured over a dozen of this schools student body?" he asks, accentuating his speech on the word appetizer, and baring his teeth at you. You are getting so tired of being reminded that on this world your considered a food stuff, and you prepare to whistle right in his face when you look to see a pleading expression in Molly's eyes. You realize she's probably in a lot of trouble for this already, and attacking a teacher will only make it worse.

"I did it because Earth has learned some tricks since your furry butt was there," you tell him, sitting down on Molly's shoulder, eyeing the old wolf defiantly. Molly, bravely mimics your look and stares the teacher in the face.

"Dark was threatening me, and Keane tried to protect me, he was just a little overzealous," she tells him, and the teacher looks over her shoulder to see the black wolf boy still laying down in the center of the crowd, which is now reduced to five members as the rest slink off towards their classrooms.

"Dark?! You mean a human took out our star player? How are we going to live this down, Molly? Tell me how?!" he demands of her, looking at her and then at you, before going back to staring at Dark. Obviously you just took out what amounted to the schools quarterback, and that is probably gonna cost you, cause this seems to be a school that values its sports stars.

"Mr. Romelles, Dark was threatening Keane, and then me and Dark were about to fight, and probably end up killing him, so he protected himself," she explained, but you notice, and she does to a second later, that Mr. Romelles isn't paying attention. Obviously something big just happened, and you two decide its best to leave before he figures out what to do with you. If he wants to punish you he can find you later.

Running from the teacher Molly, with you perched on her shoulder, soon enters her class room. At the front of the class a female wolf is writing on the chalkboard. All eyes turn towards you and Molly, and you hear a nervous laugh from somewhere as most of the eyes turn towards you. For a moment you can't place it, and then you realize with a start that its you whose laughing, and Molly turns towards you.

"Keane, is something wrong?" she asks in a whisper, and you shake your head, gaining control of yourself and your composer. None of the students in the class are from the hall, luckily, and that makes you feel a little better. You realize that at least half of them are gonna want to kill you now, a lowly pet who knocked them down with a simple whistle.

"Miss Wolfesbourg, may I ask why you are late for class, and what that awful racket in the halls was a moment ago?" says the teacher. You realize that if you were her size, she might have been hot, but being small changes things a bit, and those teeth flashing in the light from the windows are seriously turning you off.

"Nothing Mrs. Orland, just a bit of roughhousing before class with Dork," she tells her, and the teacher smiles. For a moment that face makes you more nervous than the serious expression she had on a moment ago, but some of the class is laughing now, and so is she and Molly, so you decide it might be best if you laugh with them.

"Now then, I'll ignore your tardiness if you'll kindly take your seat. We were just about to open our textbooks on...
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Meeting the Faculty

choices: ...what is the meaning of this?" points at you angrily
...where did you find this interesting human?" points at you calmly
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
The lesson that follows is difficult to understand, but after a moment you realize that some of the terms are similar to science fiction. Obviously these people have made a few of the theories on the workings of the universe reality, yet you see nothing involving atomic energy, and when Molly accidentally flips to the periodic table of elements you realize that they only have 92 compared to the 100+ you remember from your science class.

Obviously something weird is going on. Then again you're a tiny, mouse sized human in a school of giant anthromorphic wolves on a planet where your considered either a pet or snack food. A lot of this is weird, but their science, while containing dozen of bits of information you don't understand, is obviously not that much farther ahead of Earth's. So how did they build those boxes, like the one you found in your closet? Or did they build them at all? Obviously you are lacking a bit of information, something important.

"Keane can you please move?" says Molly quietly, pushing at you with her paw gently. Well gently to her anyway, to you it feels like being hit by a car, but its over quickly and you find yourself at the edge of a piece of paper. She then proceeds to open a black bottle and dip the tip of her right claw in it. You notice the texture of the liquid and are surprised to see that it is ink. With a delicate hand she begins writing stuff down from the board on the sheet. Surprisingly, though the language is still not something you can understand, the numbers are the arabic numerals you remember from home. That is odd too. Why is it you speak their language, yet they write differently? And why do they use the same numbers?

Looking at the page as she's writing you begin to see what you think are errors in her math. Looking up on the board you realize they have switched to doing formulas on their own, and the teacher is sitting in her chair watching. Obviously either they are either using a completely different math from what you remember, or Molly stinks at it. Either way you begin to do some of the formulas in your head, and finding that you can causes you to start. You were never what one would call an A student, but you weren't that bad either. Still most of this stuff didn't make sense to you before, but now it does. You can feel your brain working out the problems, almost like you had a second mind.

"Molly, you forgot to take the square root of the coefficient," you whisper to her, pointing at the place where her originally balanced formula begins to get off. For a moment she stares at you, and then moves her paw over it mumbling the numbers under her breath as she moves her claw over the point you specified. You feel slightly embarrassed when she turns back to you with a wondering gaze in her eye, and then proceeds to correct the problem.

‘Thanks," she whispers back to you, and then moves on in her work. For a time the two of you work together, focusing on getting her assignment right, and you can ignore the fact of where you are, or with who. All that matters are the numbers, which are flowing through your head. The two of you continue to whisper to each other, which, though the students can't hear the teacher can. She was interested in you since the moment you walked in, more because she'd never had a pet in her class before and wondered how it might effect things.

It hadn't done much to a large degree, but now that she hears you correct Molly's math she begins to get interested. None of the races allow lowly humans to learn math, reading, or writing, because it might give them ideas. At first she was going to warn Molly and let it go at that, but then she realized you were smarter than Molly. Obviously something was going on with you, and she was going to find out what.

At last you and Molly finish the work, well over three minutes before any of the others and you sit back, feeling good about yourself, and slightly disturbed as well. You had never been this good at math science or anything like that before. You hadn't been bad, but then again you watched Star Trek with your parents sometimes, and that show, while very scifi, still contained some real science in it. What's more some of the stuff in the physics book looked like something off Star Trek.

At that instant the bell rings, and for the first time you listen to it. Oddly enough you can compare it to the one in your school back home, but higher in pitch, lower in tempo, and with a bass beat added in. The bell is still basically three electronic pings, just like at home, but the odd nature of the sounds make it harder for you to hear them. Obviously the wolves have no problem though, and most shoot out of their seats running for the door. Molly shoves her books, papers, and the ink bottle back into her pack and puts you on her shoulder, then makes a beeline for the door herself but a voice makes her stop.

"Miss Wolfesbourg, may I see you for a moment?" asks the teacher, her tone making it obvious that it is not a request. One of the other wolf girls looks over at Molly, and you realize they must be friends. The look in her eyes asks if Molly wants her to stay, but Molly shakes her head, nearly knocking you off in the motion. After a moment the class room clears out and you and Molly are alone with the teacher.

"What is it you want to talk about Mrs. Orland?" she asks the teacher, and you realize she's nervous. Considering the way she stood up to Dark out in the hall, and even her mother and brother, you are surprised to see her like this. You didn't think Molly got nervous. Still you are drawn to the teacher's face as she's not looking at Molly at all, instead her eyes are focused on you.

"Miss Wolfesbourg...
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Information Required

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
"Well I found him in my, well he claims I almost ate him and then I discovered him later on my person. Keane says he's from Earth originally," she says to the teacher, some of her nervousness fading. You find your's is only increasing though as Mrs. Orland eyes you critically.

"Earth? Really? How did he get here from there?" she asks Molly, and you find that your hurt. Obviously this woman doesn't consider you much more than an animal, and so asks your owner questions about your past rather than you yourself. Feeling that anger in you, you decide to speak up for yourself.

"I got here because I found a box with a glowing crystal in it in my closet. A flash of light and then I was in the grass near a picnicking family of giant wolf people. I went up to Molly and after almost getting eaten as part of her lunch I got her to notice me, and then I found out that I was on another planet, with no way back," you tell her forcefully. You don't know why you did it, but it made you feel better to do it, but you wish you hadn't a moment later when Mrs. Orland leans closer to you.

"Interesting. so you found a crystal box? Well at least that means no one will have to be punished," she comments to herself, leaning back. For a moment you are surprised by this comment, why would anyone have to punished, and what for, but a second later Mrs. Orland explains.

"Now Molly, you know its illegal to teach humans math or science. After all if we taught them such things they might begin to feel that they are worth something," she says in an offhand kind of way. You feel insulted, but this time you keep your tongue. This woman's prejudices are firmly in place, and you doubt you're going to break them today.

"I know that, but I didn't teach Keane anything. He already knew this stuff on his own," she explains. Obviously she had been aware of this little law too, but hadn't bothered to mention it to you, probably to spare your feelings.

"Be that as it may, I suggest that you make your human keep his mathematics to himself. If he doesn't and the wrong people overhear then you're going to be in a lot of trouble," she tells Molly, and you realize that if it gets Molly in trouble, then it might get you dead, and that's not something you want.

"I know Mrs. Orland, and don't worry. Keane can behave himself when we're in the wrong company," she says, and you hear anger in her voice. Obviously she's as upset by Mrs. Orand's attitude towards you as you are, for a moment you are afraid she might try and fight her, but you quickly see that it won't come to that. Mrs. Orland is nodding her head towards the two of you, and absently waves you out of her class.

Once outside you can feel ad hear Molly growling, and you can also feel that if you don't do something sh might very well go back into the class and make trouble. Looking around you see other wolves staring at both you and her, whispering things. Obviously high school here is no different then on Earth, and you're fairly confident that by the end of the hour no one will be unaware that Molly had to stay after class, or that it had something to do with you.

"Molly?" you ask nervously as she opens her locker. She doesn't answer you for a moment, shoving some books from her pack into the metal box with enough force to dent it, and then puts you back on the shelf over her books much more roughly than she did before. For a moment you are afraid she might try and take her anger out on you, but she takes a moment to draw in a deep breath, bang a nearby locker with her fist, and then exhale before looking at you again.

"Yes Keane?" she asks, her voice still full of anger.

"Are you okay?" you ask her.

"No, and you shouldn't be either. You heard the way she treated you, like you weren't even there. People like her just make me so angry. I mean they think their so much better than humans just because their bigger, well I can tell you..." what follows that statement your not sure as it mostly comes out as an angry, frustrated growl. She takes a moment to compose herself again and then reaches into her locker again to place her on your shoulder.

"Keane, I'm sorry. I'm not angry at you, its just I don't like people like her. In a lot of ways they're worse than the ones like Dark. At least dad and I get it. That just because you aren't as big as us, doesn't mean you're not sentient," she tells you softly, placing you on her shoulder again. You realize in that moment how lucky you were to have appeared near a someone like her in this world, where such thinking is a rarity.

Then you begin to consider the odds of that. Heck the odds of everything that happened to you since you got to this planet. Again you have the nagging suspicion that somewhere, someone is laughing at this entire thing, like some cheap dime store novel. Obviously though you can't do anything about your current standing for the moment and so you just sigh as Molly walks through the next door that's marked with a picture of...
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: Consider the odds

choices: A female wolf, and she looks like she's smiling
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Well food might have been a little bit of a stretch, but considering what the school is you assume the picture of a deer is reference to eating for giant wolves. Unfortunately you are right, and the instant Molly steps through those double doors you can't help but wish you were wrong. For a moment you wonder if Molly had been dragging you along this whole way, always intending on downing you as a snack, but considering everything she'd done so far you doubt it. After all she and her dad both treated you like you mattered, like you were sentient, and besides, sights like this probably didn't bother them.

The ‘inside' of the cafeteria at the wolf school was actually outside, though in most other respects it resembled a high school cafeteria. There were metal stands on wheels in front of which the young wolves lined up to get food dumped onto their plates, though for you the food looks highly unappetizing. Its not that its human, after all if it were human you would have just started screaming and probably not stopped. The food is just not what you're used to.

One line, the one Molly first gets into, serves mice, live mice. You watch as one of the wolves sets his serving on the ground after getting out of the line and then starts chasing after it. The sight of him catching the thing and ripping into it is a little to graphic for you, and luckily Molly notices your discomfort, and so gets out of that line into one that serves food more to your pallette.

Of course you have to wonder why a world of giant carnivores, at least as far as you know, developed hamburgers, but when you at last get to a table you find your hunger overriding your questions as she sets you down on her tray. For a moment Molly's eyes glaze over like the other wolves do when their eating, or fighting, and you are afraid that she might just eat you too. Her head lowers towards the burger and you can feel her hot breath roll over you, and you find yourself staring into the back of her mouth.

"Molly!" you shout at her, and then she starts. For a second or two she looks around and stares at the people around her, almost all of whom are to engrossed in their own food to notice her. After a moment she leans down towards you.

"What is it Keane?" she whispers at you.

"Molly, what was that? You just sort of went nuts and I was afraid you were going to eat me," you tell her, and then her head backs up. You can see her looking around, and start. For probably the first time she is gazing at the eating habits of her people from an outsiders perspective, and from the expression on her face it doesn't thrill her.

"Sorry Keane, its just, we're carnivores. Meat sort of sets off old instincts, and we go a little out of control. I never thought about how it would look to someone like you. I'll try and control it. For you," she says, and then picks up the burger. After taking a huge bite out of it, one bigger than three of you, she holds it down to you so you can rip off a few crumbs. Still a little wary you take the offered sustenance and then retreat back. Molly's face takes on a hurt expression, but she resumes her meal.

For a time everything is silent between the two of you as you eat and watch her. You're beginning to see the differences in this world as compared to Earth, and you realize that some of hem have to do with tech. The school, and her house for instance. They have lighting, but its all bulb, not fluorescent rods like home. And the cars don't sputter like internal combustion cars do, instead they hum like the new electric ones back home.

In other places too. The fridge back at Molly's house is walk in, but as far as you have been able to tell there is no air conditioning anywhere. The school, her house, and even the mall you were at yesterday were all the same temperature as the outside world. How is it that they have refrigerators, but not air conditioners? And why do they have bulb lights, which need replacing very often and are expensive to make, yet they also have electric cars, something that requires the same chemicals as those long lasting bulbs that your high school uses?

Something about this planet is off. The tech of the wolves is inconsistent. They seem to have taken big leaps forward in some areas, but never applied that knowledge to other areas. And then there's the boxes. Everyone seems to know about them, so why is Earth free? After all if these people wanted to, you have no doubt they could take over your home in a second. So why don't they? And what about the stuff in your own head. You speak their language, but don't read their writing, and they seem to be hurt by high pitched noise if its not accompanied by a bass counter point like the school bell. With that in mind shouldn't the humans have been able to fight these guys just by whistling.

And another thing, were are the other humans. You keep hearing from Molly and everyone else that humans are pets, or food, yet you haven't seen another one since you got here. The way Molly talks they're supposed to be common, yet as far as you can tell the wolves far exceed them in population size. The math doesn't make sense, nothing adds up.

You finish your last few crumbs on that happy thought, intending to ask Molly about the other humans when the scene goes dark. For a moment you are afraid for yourself, but looking around you realize your just in someone's shadow, turning away from Molly, who is looking at whoever is casting the shadow you stare into the face of...
1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.title: School Lunches

1342111112221121221122111121112112221121.content:
Of course, smiling to her, is a very threatening gesture to you considering her teeth are more than capable of ripping you into little tiny Keane bits. Still you try and smile back at her as she sits down across from Molly. The wolf girl either didn't notice you or is trying to ignore you as she sits down and continues to stare at Molly with an odd look in her eye. Still smiling she turn from Molly to stare at you and you find yourself wishing you could get smaller just to get out of her gaze.

"So that's the human I keep hearing about?" she asks, Molly nodding in a way that tells you the two are friends, close ones at that. Still you would seriously feel better if she would stop smiling and staring at you.

"You know, word around school is this little guy punched Dark's lights out with his mighty fists of fury. Seeing him I have serious doubts about that, no offense" she said, looking down at you. Obviously this newcomer fit into the same category as Molly and Mark, they all saw humans as more than objects, but probably still less than people, after all you were little more than a pet.

"So is he the one you wanted me to...?" she leaves the rest of the question unasked, and looking into her face you wonder what it is that fills in that blank. Obviously it wasn't something they were supposed to be talking about as both she and Molly glanced around nervously. Nodding again was Molly's only response, and then with a small gesture she pointed to a stand of trees near the edge of the school grounds. Looking back the other wolf girl studied the stand for a moment before nodding her ascent.

Without a word to you Molly picked you up off her tray, deposited it in a trash can, and then walked towards the trees with you on her shoulder. By this point you've already figured out that Molly, at some point, found time to make contact with this other wolf girl. Why was still an unknown, but you trusted Molly, well as much as a bite-sized human could trust a colossal wolf. Molly didn't mean to hurt you, and seemed to have your best interests at heart.

Walking towards the clearing you wanted to scream at her to stop slinking. She was dragging her feet, looking around nervously like she was some kind of spy. While you knew little about this world, or the wolves in particular, you were still of the opinion that she would have been less obvious if she had just walked normally. It was people who snuck around who drew attention, not those who looked like they belonged.

Soon the two of you were safely among the trees, and the sounds of the school were so faded you couldn't hear anything clearly anymore. Still you weren't sure about what was about to happen. Molly was still in ‘spy' mode so you doubted that she would spill the beans for the moment, but that left your mind to wander. Just as you were almost sure that both you and she were in some kind of trap the other wolf girl walked into the trees, and Molly breathed a heavy sigh of relief, nearly knocking you from her shoulder.

"Aura, I'm so glad I got in touch with you last night," she tells the other wolf girl, finally along you to put a name to the face. Looking up and down the other wolf girl you realize that this was probably not her first time doing something like this. Her mannerisms and stride were to calm and confident. Whatever was about to happen, she'd done it before, and often, Molly obviously hadn't.

"I'm glad too. I was surprised to hear from our mall contact that another human had been found, but even more so that he was with you. You guys don't exactly live in an area that would be rife with humans," she tells Molly, both of them ignoring you. For a moment you consider speaking up and asking what is going on, but you dismiss that idea. You trust Molly, and you kind of liked that old guy at the mall the other day when he was making your clothes. You had no doubt that he was the contact she had just mentioned. For a moment the trees were dead still, and then both wolf girls turned to you.

"So is it true you knocked out Dark with some kind of weapon?" asks Aura. You are stunned silent for a moment by the fact that she asked you directly, not Molly. Obviously you would have to revise your opinion of Aura. She didn't think of you as a pet, she really did see you as a person. Well that or she wanted to hear it straight from you.

"Him, and a couple of others. I guessed that your physiology was close to dogs from Earth, and that your ears work along the same lines. With my smaller stature I believe my voice raised an octave or two, too you anyway, and that means a whistle is probably even higher in pitch, and high pitched sounds hurt dogs. Your kind seem to be even worse about it though," you tell her, replaying the incident in your mind.

"Hmm. Cathy will want to hear about that. You better tell her it when you see her," she comments to you, and this time you can't help it, you leap to your feet, as well as you can, and point a finger at her.

"First you better tell me what the hell is going on here," you say, not loudly of course for fear of being overheard, but firmly enough to cause both to look at you.

"Well I guess I didn't tell you anything about this did I. You were so keen on going home that I took you to the mall the other day to get in touch with a group that could send you to a free human settlement. It may not be home, but without a crystal box it's the best I can do," Molly tells you, and you begin to feel tears in your eyes. You realize now, for the first time, that Molly really is your friend, of course now the question remains, where is this free human colony, and why is it free.

Scenario 1: The colony is in the mountains, in a cavern to small for the carnivores to enter, and thanks to the efforts of people like Aura and Molly it has remained hidden.

Scenario 2: The colony is on an island to the south of the mainland, a place the carnivores don't go because they don't like the water. Some can swim well enough, but the deep water of the ocean just sets off their primal fears.

But it's too late. You feel the giant wolf's foot push you to the ground, and pain shoots through your body. You think it's the end, but suddenly you rise into the air. When you feel like you can't take any more, the little boy wolf slows down. He raises his foot into the air and peels you off it. You lay in his paw as he raises you to his face.

"Huh? What are you?..." the giant wolf asks, peering at you.

"I'm a human!" you shout at him.

The boy wolf blinks, then his eyes widen. A huge toothy grin comes across his face.

"Wow! A live human! Really? This is awesome!"

You don't like his choice of words. "'Live' human?" you ask.

"Yeah! All the humans I've seen were either dead or cooked!"

You gulp. These wolves eat humans! You feel the wolf's breath wash over you, and it smells horrible. Like rotting meat.

"You're... not going to eat me, are you?" you ask nervously.

"Of course not! I like humans!"

You breathe a sigh of relief. "Thank God."

"I'm the only one in my family who likes humans. If my mom and dad found you, you'd be eaten before you know it! And my sister hates humans! Hmmm... I better not show you to my family."

"Yeah. You have to help me kid!"

"Well, I suppose I could bring you back to where you came from. Where did you come from?"

"I came from my world. I found an amulet that transported me here. The amulet's gone though."

"Well, you could stay with me if you want! I'd take care of you!"

141.content:
You decide to trust this kid.

"Sure, I'll go with you!" you tell the giant wolf.

"Great!" the kid beams down at you. "My name's Billy, what's yours?"

"My name's Keane!"

"Nice to meet you Keane! Don't worry, you'll be safe with me!"

You feel a splash of water on your head. You look up and see that the sky has turned gray. Large, fat raindrops were starting to fall. Billy looked up too, and sighed.

"It's raining..." he said sadly. "That means we'll have to leave. I better stay dry."

Billy set you on the ground and walked away from you, the ground shaking with his every step. You turn and see a very large plastic bag a few feet from you. Billy starts rummaging through the bag and pulls out a yellow slicker and yellow rubber boots. He pulls on the boots over his feet and puts on the raincoat. He buttons up the slicker then reaches for you. He raises you to his smiling face.

"You'll have to stay in my pocket until we get home, okay?"

You nod. Billy opens the pocket in his raincoat and drops you in. You lay down and hold on as Billy bends to pick up the bag, then begins walking back to his family.

You pull yourself to the opening of the pocket and look out. You can see Billy's family getting ready to leave. They pack up their food and other things and stuff them in the bag, then begin walking away. As you watch, the park suddenly opens up onto a road. Large houses line the road, and there are sidewalks, just like a human road. You lay down again and wait out the trip. Occasionally Billy slipped his paw into the pocket and petted you a bit. You patted his paw to let him know you're alright. For a giant wolf, Billy was a good kid.

After a while, Billy's paw emerges in the pocket and takes you out. You look around and are amazed to see your surroundings. It looks like a child's room, complete with toys, bed, drawers, closet and everything else. Billy places you on his bed and hangs up his raincoat. He’s holding a toothbrush in his other paw, but the toothbrush is larger even for his size than a human’s would be... after all, wolves do have larger and sharper teeth than humans, and it wouldn’t do for the toothbrush to break.

Billy’s mouth is covered in pink froth. “I’ll just set you down on the sink. Don’t fall in, ok?” As you nod, you are enveloped by an oddly scented breeze. It isn’t minty, as most toothpastes are, but it is oddly refreshing. Considering the nature of its makers, you decide not to ask what the scent is exactly.

Billy sets you down on the back of the sink, behind and to the side of the faucet. Billy goes back to brushing his teeth, giving you quite a view of them. You devoutly hope never to experience the power of teeth like those firsthand.

Billy reached down and turns on the faucet. Hundreds of gallons of water churn out of the pipe, and into a sizeable hole on the bottom of the sink. You realize that Billy wasn’t joking about not falling in; even if you land unhurt, you may well fit through that drain!

Billy stoops down to the height of the faucet. You notice that he has to lean quite far; the sink is set a lot lower than a human sink would be. Billy stops his head in front of the stream, and laps water into his mouth. He swishes it around, and spits out enough froth to fill a small pool on Earth. Billy grabs a large soap on the other side of the faucet from you, and washes his hands, paying particular attention to his claws. Then he does something unexpected; he leans on the mirror above you for support, and raises a foot into the sink! That’s why the sink was set so low; since these wolves didn’t wear shoes, they would have to wash their feet at least as often as their hands.

Billy isn’t as tall as an adult, so he still struggles to balance himself in the sink that is set slightly too heigh for him. You hope he doesn’t fall on you, but he seems to have practice with this sort of thing. Billy lowers the foot he had been working on, and raises the other into the sink. You feel somewhat intimidated by this whole display; even though Billy is acting entirely innocently, he seems to be displaying every possible thing that you fear you might get killed with soon.

Billy puts his other foot down, and looks at you. “Well, Keane...”
1411111.title: Reflections

choices: Billy decides that they're done here...
Billy wants to play with/explore his new friend more.
14111112.content:
“Now it’s your turn.” Billy smiles slightly mischievously, and picks you up. “I don’t want you to fall down the drain or hurt yourself though, so I’ll have to help.” Billy holds you at arms length and looks at you thoughtfully. “Well, you’re too small for me to brush your hair or teeth. I guess we just have to skip to the washing.”

You consider protesting, but you decide that even if you win, Billy would probably just complain about you smelling bad. You hope he doesn’t mean washing your entire body; you can’t very well get clean with your clothes on, and you don’t want the young wolf to see you naked.

Billy cuts off a small (for him) sliver of soap with a claw. “Ok, Keane, hold out your hands.” Billy holds you in front of the stream of water.

You hold your hands out into the water. The pressure of the water pulls your arms back down, but Billy only wanted your hands to get wet anyway. He takes the soap between his thumb and forefinger, and starts to rub your hands. Billy is certainly going out of the way to be gentle, and it actually feels pretty good. Your eyes close halfway as Billy massages your hands.

Billy stops, and looks carefully at you. He remembers the trouble you had keeping your arms raised under the faucet, so he grabs your forearms and holds them in place. The rushing water rinses off the soap, and also feels fairly good. You start to think that maybe this whole situation isn’t quite as bad as you thought.

Billy takes your hands out of the water, and holds them to his face. Satisfied with the results, Billy turns you sideways, and briefly holds your feet under the water before cutting off another slice of soap and raising it toward you.

You protest, startled, “Hey! ...what are you doing?”

“Well, I’ve got to wash your feet too. Do you want your feet to get all dirty?”

You laugh softly to yourself. That’s right, these wolves don’t seem to wear anything on their feet if it isn’t absolutely necessary; he probably hasn’t seen normal shoes before! “Those aren’t my feet, Billy. I’m wearing shoes. Like those boots you wore in the mud? Humans wear shoes a lot more than you guys seem to.”

“Oh, ok. Sorry... mind if I take them off then?”

You nod, and Billy gently pulls your soggy shoes off with slight popping sounds. “Yeah, I was wondering why you didn’t have any toes. I was pretty sure humans had them... ummm... Keane?”

You roll your eyes. “They’re socks Billy. They come off too.”

Billy awkwardly tries to fit his claw between your skin and socks. “Like this?”

“Ummm...” You consider what course of action gives you the least chance of getting hurt. “Try just pulling them off. Gently...”

Billy carefully grasps your feet between two fingers, and pulls. Your sock slides partway off, but since it’s wet, slippes out of Billy’s fingers. Billy’s tongue pokes out of the side of his mouth slightly as he concentrates. He grabs the limp end of your sock, and pulls it off with a smile. You chuckle slightly at the absurdity of the situation, of all the things to give him trouble...

Billy pulls your other sock off, and looks at the new objects in his hand. He sniffs at them, and noses the four items around for a bit, before slipping them into his pocket. “Why do humans like to wear those things, Keane?” Billy asks as he raises you up to his face, still held horizontally.

“Well, humans don’t have pads like wolves do. We can hurt our feet much easier. And besides... um...” You start to giggle as Billy sniffs your feet. “H-hey, stop th... that!”

Billy seems very interested in your feet right now. “I haven’t really looked a human’s feet before. Why is your heel all short like that? Do you walk on it? What about those darker parts, aren’t they pads?”

You struggle to control your laughter. “Well, yes pretty much. Humans walk on their heels, like raccoons, and... um... well... that’s pretty much all I can think of right now. The darker parts are callouses, they work sorta like pads, but sharp stuff can still poke the lighter parts, and it really hurts. That’s why humans wear shoes.” You valiantly marshall your thoughts against what looks to be quite an onslaught of questions.
14111112.title: A simple prosses...

141111121.content:
Billy looks like he is just bursting with questions, but for some reason, he decides to cut them short. Billy holds your feet under the faucet, quickly rubs soap on them, and rinses them off. “Well, Keane, I don’t want anyone else to see you, so I guess you’ll just have to go back into my shirt until I have another place to put you or we’re alone.” Billy rubs your head with his finger, and slips you gently into his shirt again. “Now, be quiet until I think it’s safe to take you out.”

Billy buttons his shirt back up, and you are again covered by darkness. You feel a large object gently press you against Billy’s chest, then you hear the sounds of doors opening and footsteps. Suddenly, you can see again, and Billy pulls you from his shirt. Billy looks at you from arm’s length, and then gently sets you down on his bed. “Ok Keane, I’ve got to get ready for school now. No peaking!” Billy pulls the covers over you with a giggle.

You hear many different noises for a while, and finally, Billy pulls the covers off you. Billy is wearing his day clothes, a red shirt and jeans. Billy wags his tail and pets you. “I’m so happy I found you, Keane,” Billy says with a big smile. Billy picks you up, and hugs you. You lay there, flattened vertically against Billy’s chest, and think about what would likely have happened if any other wolf found you. “I’m happy you found me too, Billy,” you say, and push against Billy’s chest, the closest you can come to hugging him back.

Billy whines involuntarily, and squeezes you harder against his chest. You can hear Billy’s tail swishing audibly behind him. After a while, Billy holds you in front of his face. He watches you, and you feel warm air blow gently over you. Billy nuzzles your head, then opens his hand, and rubs the side of his muzzle against you. You pat Billy’s muzzle, just below his eye, and then hug it, finally finding a part of him that you can wrap your arms at least partly around other than his fingers. Billy closes his eyes, and you can feel him relax under you.

Suddenly, Billy’s eyes snap open with a start. “Oh, no, I’m late!” Billy rubs his muzzle against you quickly once more, and then slips you into his shirt. “Sorry Keane, but I’ve got to hurry, I don’t want to be late to school.” You hear Billy pick up something heavy, and swing it around onto his back.

Billy runs down the stairs, and swings around in another direction. You are thankful for being in such a secure place; as it is, you still feel pulled around with ever motion Billy takes. You hear Billy shout, “I’m sorry I’m late!” You hear loud sounds of hurried and quite probably messy eating: crunches, slurps, even the occasional growl from one of the wolves there. Billy’s mother admonishes him to “Stop wasting so much food!”, and Billy’s father asks him if he needs a ride to school.

As the two of you walk home in silence—he's really the only one walking at the point—,you begin to suspect your furry friend, which you've acqiured a very minor crush on, has something on his mind.
“Please,” you beg him as he sets you on his black-cased pillow and shakes his head, his eyes cold and distant . You visibly cringe when he snaps, “I'm going to take a shower,” and exits the room in a huff.
Bam! His bathroom door shuts and you sigh, allowing yourself to sprawl out on the nice, comfy pillow. “He's been acting really weird lately, he won't meet my eyes and he keeps on looking away when I catch him staring at me with this weird, dreamy look on his face. To top things off, I have a minor, very very minor crush on him!” You say a bit too loudly because, on the other side of the bathroom door, Billy hears you. A tear slips down his cheek and a tear slides down your opposite cheek.
“I consume you,
I consume you,
I lock door-to-door
So now you're breakin' in,
Well, if you think I'm takin' it,
You're just fakin' it,” The sound of Rediscover's lead singer vibrates through the walls, causing your body to shift a few inches on the pillow you've been laying on for a few hours.
A naked form appears, wearing merely a towel to cover his crotch and it takes you a minute to realize it's Billy.
You smile up at him and he smiles back.
His smile doesn't reach his eyes though, which are clouded with uncertainty and fear.
“Is there something you'd like to talk about?” you ask him innocently, batting your long, thick black eyelashes shyly, your head tiled to one side and slightly downward, far enough for your chin to be hovering over you collarbone.
Billy turns around and blinks those eyes at you. Your heart speeds up and your stomach feels as though you're growing a butterfly farm in your stomach. “No,” he blurts out and you blink, watching as the towel drops, allowing you a perfect view of his tail. You wonder how does he wear pants with that tail.
He's forgotten all about you and starts humming along with Dead in the water by Hawthorne Heights and you jump up and pretend to strum a guitar.
Billy's eyes widen and he whips around, his boxers forgotten in his paw, the shirt swishing up and revealing his lower regions. You shriek and cover your eyes.
“I-I'm sorry, Keane,” he apologizes as he shimmies into his pale blue boxers. You nod absently and watch, mesmerized, as his tail twitches behind him and brushes his kneecap.
Without thinking, you blurt out, “How do you wear pants? Doesn't your tail get in the way?” He shrugs and buttons up his night-shirt, concentrating especially hard on not fumbling with buttons clutched in his claws, his eyebrows knitted together as his pink tongue sticks out of the corner of his mouth.
You double over, laughing hard, clutching desperately at your sides, tears rolling down your flushed cheeks. Billy pouts and gives up, sitting down the beg with his legs crossed. “Here,” you say as you climb up to his thigh.“Let me help,” you offer and begin to button the buttonless holes.
You notice as you grow close to his crotch, he grows more tense. You smile up at him and finish the last button, but not before noticing a strangely familiar odor: mint. It sting your eyes for a moment and you let the tears roll down your face, tainting the flesh an agitated pink as if your have a fever, which you don't. “Something… your crotch smells like mint,”
Billy laughs and admits to spilling two tubs of mint toothpaste of his boxers a few months ago. “Oh,” you murmur, blushing with embarrassment. “Er, um… good-night,” you say and curl up next to his head.
“Night,” he mumbles and almost instantly falls asleep.

1411111211211111.content:
You jolt from your almost comfortable sleep and shiver, your heart pounding.
The only thing you can hear is the sound of blood rushing in your eardrums and the soft snores coming from Billy.
Get a hold of yourself, Keane! you tell yourself and shake off the panic. The nightmare comes back in bright flashes, like a broken film, repeating and then going black.
A bell off in the distance rung hollowly; almost sensing as if you were alone. The fog rolls in like a blanket, heavy and thick until you can't see your own hand in front of your eyes.
Something runs across your path and you trip over it. A yelp followed by a thud. Your cheeks burn with embarrassment as you realize it seems to be a man, in his twenty odd years or so, dressed his black boots, jeans and a plaid shirt.
“I'm so sorry!” you apologize, scrambling off him. His brown eyes blink as a bright red curl slips across his nose, which has a scar across it. “What are you doing!?” the man whispered loudly, grabbing your arm in his rough grasp. A low rumbling growl erupted from behind you and he pulled you into the alley he'd come from. He buried your face in his chest and you balled your hands into fists.
You realize that you're wearing a blue shirt, jeans and brown cowboy boots. A tear rolled down your cheek as the man cooed gently things, stroking your dark hair. “Ssh, Keane,” the man hummed softly and you breathed in his scent: wood + burning leaves. A thud followed by a sharp shrill shriek of something not human.
You held your breath as something foul passed. It smelled of rotting carcasses, and spoiled eggs. You clung to the man's thigh as he peeked out.
He sighed and wiped sweat from his brow with his sleeve and began to scold you. Suddenly, blood spattered the ground and stained his shirt. His eyes grew hollow and glazed over and you began to cry.
The creature's gold eyes met yours and you felt excitement bristle through you. A voice, male obviously but young and wise beyond its age, appeared in your head. I'm terribly sorry! I thought he was prey! You held your breath as the wolf's haunches bristled. Forgive me! the creature begged.
You could barely see past your tears but you heard him whine and felt something warm and wet wash over your face. “Yuck! Wolf slobber!” you cried and wiped off the wolf's drool. Suddenly, you held your wrist out to his mouth. The wolf looked at you before taking it into his mouth and applying only a small amount of pressure.
There was no blood, nor extreme agony. Only a small burning pain that vanished as soon as the creature removed his mouth. I have marked you, no other wolf may harm you, you are mine and mine only, understand, Keane? You absently nodded as the great timer wolf turned and trotted into the fog. The man's body was no only a simple dot, no blood or sour stench.
Your stomach churned as you rolled up your sleeve, softly gasping when you saw teeth marks. Billy yawned and turned over.
You immediately got over your crush. He was too young and innocent to have a girlfriend like you. “I'm… marked,” you whispered, your voice filled with awe and wonder. You strained hard to remember the wolf's voice but, it wouldn't come.
I am always watching, in my human-like wolf form, so needn't worry, Keane, I will find you… An alluring voice whispered as you curled up and tried to sleep.
At around three AM you fell asleep, dreaming of that wolf.
You leaned against a tree, his head rested on your lap as you stroked his flank, rising and falling while he caught his breath.
Gold eyes closed as he seemed to sigh and shift to get comfortable against your thighs. You were wearing a black corest and old fashioned white dress with lace around the hem, much like little riding hood—without the hood. Your dark tresses were curled softly and your brown eyes were closed as you hummed a gentle tune.
The wolf sighed with content and drifted off to sleep.“ You're are beautiful when you sleep,” you told him and closed your eyes as well. The sun kept both of you warm and the shade of the great big tree kept you from getting over heated.
A breeze ruffled the meadow's flowered and stalks and sent a leaf on the wolf's snout. He sneezed twice and you mumbled, “Bless you,” twice.
The wolf rumbled something that sounded suspiciously like laughter and you fell asleep again. Nothing disturbed you…

14222.content:
"You stink way to much to be chewed up, so I won't go easy on you!" He opens up his serrated wolven maw, and his hot breath rolls over you like an ocean breeze (only far smellier).


He drops you in with a *plump* and for a while you sit there on his tongue getting savored and tasted, until with a huge shift, he tilts his head back and you fall backwards down his slimy throat, making *glurshlik**worlsh* noises as you go. You make your descent down the wet oozing tube and the esophagus rubs you in such a way that you would find this arousing (albeit terrifying). Outside, Billy is enjoying this immensely, as you make a visible bulge gliding down his gullet.

Covered in spit you see the sphincter open and close in front of you, gushing out stale stomach air as it does. It opens, and you squeeze through without much difficulty. With a sick *squelch*, you *plop*SPLOOSH* into the stomach acids.

Lying there, your life flashes before your eyes as the stomach gurgle around you, and you realize that there are certainly worse ways of dying, but you'd rather not die at all. The acid begins to have an effect on your skin, as you slowly burn away into the acid, still wriggling a bit. Looking around you, you see skeletons and lumps of all varieties, most of them were alive bfore this point, all with different stories to tell... if they weren't getting their mouths and neck burned from the inside out. The veins and other organs are actually quite visible from your POV, and they pump and puss as they go about their jobs.

"Mmmmm, yes, struggle all you want, all your doing is making this better for me!"Billy says quietly to himself, or at least quietly to him, but to you it's a thundering boom vibrating the churning stomach walls. The acid doesn't hurt anymore, likely because of your nerves having been rendered numb seconds ago,and all fades to black slowly.

"Ohhh, that was wonderful! You were quite delicious Keane, thank you!

Billy lies back on the the grass, releasing a pent up *UUUUURRRRRRAOOORRP* and the remaining air is blown out of Billy. He pats his stomach as it digests its workload, turning its contents into a disgusting bubbling goo, to have the nutrients sucked out of later.

The paste (and you) travel down the stomach exit, and down the tube, which leads down to the small intestine, and the small intestine sucks and absorbs your nutrients, th deeper you go, the browner, and more solid you get. That's right, your going down...

The next morning, Billy feels far less full, and with small effort, lets slip a tiny *poot*

"Pew, guess your ready to come out, huh Keane?" he says, grabbing his nose. He gets up and trods over to the bathroom and pulls down his pajama bottoms, and sits down on the toilet.

"HUUURGH,un, I guess I should get more fiber in my diet, UUURGH. *PPPFFRRT**SPloosh*" Whew!I guess I was right when I said you stink! Uh-oh...*gurglerumble* *PLLLOOOOIIRRTTTTT* *Splash*PLooMPH*"Urg, man you sure went in easy, but MAN did you come out hard!" He reaches for the toilet paper and wipes his bottom, and gets up. Peering into the bowl, he sees his immense turds, and spots your tiny skeleton in one of them. "I guess this is goodbye Keane." With that he flushes, and washes his hands.

"It's all yours, sis." he proudly states, exiting the bathroom.

"Thanks Billy, it's about ti- WHOAH,geez!" Sh walks in and is immediately greeted with the horrible stench. She sprays the bathroom with air freshener. "Billy, what did you have for the picnic?"

He chuckles, "Sorry sis, must've been the potato salad."

15.content:
You decide to study these giant wolves before interacting with them. You walk towards them, being careful not to be seen. You go to the large space between the boy wolf and the mother wolf, and look at what they're eating.

It looks normal enough. Salad, chips, dip, mac and cheese, juice, and... Oh my God.

In a large bowl in the middle of the picnic blanket is a pile of cooked and burned humans. They're red and black and scaly, all dead thankfully. Some of their limbs have fallen off. There are some large animals in there as well. You stare at the bowl in horror, unable to avert your eyes.

The father wolf reaches for the bowl and takes out a cooked human body. Bits of skin fall off as the giant wolf raises the body to his chompers. His mouth opens and he pops the cooked person into his mouth. Some blood dribbles down his face, and you resist the urge to vomit. The father wolf licks the blood away and reaches for another one.

If you stay here any longer you'll barf up everything you've eaten today. What should you do?
15.title: Squeamish studying

choices: It's a human at the same size as you.
151.content:
You have no idea where you are. You have no idea who or even what these giant wolves are. But you definitely understand the concept of Predator and Prey around here. Clearly, there are little humans out there just like you, or at least there were, if they hadn't all been rendered as Kentucky Fried People by now.

Your stomach threatens to disgorge its contents, forcing you to look away. You realize that if you're going to get help on this strange new world, it's probably not going to come from them.

Of course, alone and at this size you probably won't last long anyway, but you think that you'll last even less long over there in the bowl, turning your attention back to it you watch in horror as some unlucky human turns out to still be alive---or did the wolves leave him that way intentionally?

He squeals and struggles, trying to get out of the bowl, but the teenage wolf's paw swoops down on him in an instant, snatching him between two fingers she raises her meal up to her face, licking her lips hungrily.

You don't want to watch, but you can't avert your gaze. The small man doesn't seem to be saying anything understandable, though, perhaps there's a different language here.

The young she-wolf grins before opening her muzzle and tossing the hapless human into her mouth. Her jaws snap shut and he disappears. You expect her to start chewing, but she doesn't, she seems to savor the struggles of her snack before leisurly tilting her head back.

The ruff on her throat gives a slight bob as she swallows, delicately tracing a finger down her throat and between her breasts, stopping at her belly. She pats it lightly, then grins and makes some remark that causes her family to crack up in laughter.

NOW you start to throw up. You double over and vomit until it's extremely painful. For a while all you see is the ground, that is until you look up, and realize there's something between the blades WATCHING you.

The teen wolf grips you tight in her silver hairy hand and brings you over to her family, you're thinking to yourself if that you play your cards right you can get some information about where you are, these rules that they are talking about, and if worst comes to worst you could surrender to them or end there k9 lives with your militery training that your father forcefully gave you.

The teen wolf walked happy over to her family with her prize in hand she peers over at her prize in astonishment that you weren't in her hand she sped up to her family, "so where is he honey" mother wolf said, "i know i had him...." the teen wolf suddenly stopped as her little brother is pointing at her neck. 15111221222.content:
You just hold your knife in position and look at her. Maybe she saved you from being eaten by Molly. You're just sitting there, when something grabs you fast. To your misfortune, it was Molly who grabbed you.

"You better put that knife down, you..."

"Molly! Nothing strange that none person wants to live with us!"

What have you just heard? A person living with humans? But something other draws your attention: The view of really guilty Molly. She's really mortified. She don't look to be a bad per... Ahem, wolf. She wanted to eat you just because you could kill her. She opens her paw, so you can actually sit down. You hide your knife, knowing that you couldn't do anything to these wolves, since you've dropped your explosives (Anyway, how could Keane get explosives to school? Please, read the story more carefully before adding new chapters. Thanks - Author of this chapter) when Molly grabbed you. You are just sitting there, in her paw, somehow being sorry for trying to kill her. You just bow your head down and say:

"Sorry."

You didn't say that very loudly, because you were embarrassed. But she heard that. You know because you heard her gasping. You are getting used to thoughts that you will soon die, probably in belly of some wolf, maybe even Molly. You doubt you will be considered as this "Person". But then...

"Apology accepted."

... Now you really don't know what to think. She forgave you. You could KILL HER, and she forgave you. Now you feel worse. She's nice, at least how nice to you can be a giant wolf.

"Let's just go check me. If I'm going to die (which you are pretty sure of), i want to have it done fast." They don't respond for that, which you are glad of.

You all don't move for some time, when finally Molly's father calls "Come on", and they go to some sort of car, with you still in Molly's paw. You look ahead of yourself, since you are afraid you could offend her by looking at her breasts. Molly gets in the backseat, alone, because Molly's mother takes the boy with her. It's not a surprise for you, you wouldn't trust yourself neither in a situation like that. After some time, you get to something looking like a police station. You go in, being greeted by a female wolf.

"Hello, what can i do for you?" She asks with a kind voice.

Molly walks with you to her. "We found him in a forest and don't know if he is a snack or person. And he seems to know wolfish, though he said something about egnilsh or something like that."

"That's weird. We'll see his memories quickly." Memories? How is that possible? "Put him here." She points out to a space close to some kind of door. "You want to wait?"

"Yes, I think we'll wait."

"Sit there please." Then the "secretary" (you are not sure who is she) presses some button and calls. "We've got some unknown." It's all.

The doors in front opens and you see a doctor, accompanied by two soldier-like men. You know why. The doctor comes to you and speak in a similar dialect that Molly tried at first.

"Sorry, don't understand."

With that, the two soldiers starts aiming at you, so you impulsively lift your hands up.

"You talk wolfish? It's forbidden for most humans."

"I'm not from here. See my memories and you'll know." You think that asking soldiers for putting their weapons down will be too much.

"If you insist. Follow me." He turns around and walk back trough the door, you after him, and the soldiers after you. You see some futuristic-looking chair. It's probably that memories-reader.

"Sit here." You do as he says. He ties you to the chair and puts something on your head. You can't see anything, and after a while you fall asleep. Then you start a journey trough your memories, seeing the same things as doctor. It ends on your memory of getting here. You're back into consciousness, and feel doctor untying you, then he takes that "helmet" out of your head.

"OK, we're done here. You can go back to waiting room." You wonder why they don't say now who you are. "You're really a special case. We didn't think that there are some other humans out there, but now you came. Though i don't know any way of sending you back." He ends that with a warm smile. You try to smile too, but you can't get off a feeling, that you will be soon dead in "some" wolf, and you think that even know which one. You go through the door, to see Molly's family talking with secretary.

"... done anything before. But this... incident with your neck? This is really serious." You know where this conversation is going, so you just stand there and look down. You're not brave enough to look at the wolves. "Though you are the one to decide if he will be considered as a...
15111221222.title: You don't believe her.

choices: Rest of family is nice too.
151112212221.content:
"Though you are the one to decide if he will be considered as a person or snack."

"Molly, i think this is your decision. You were the most endangered by him." Her father called. Now you are sure of your fate. There's no way Molly's going to...

"Person."

........ You drop to your knees, because you can't believe in what you just heard. She actually really saved your life. And now when you think you could kill someone that nice, you are starting to feel really bad.

"Could you leave us alone, please?"

"Yes. Please, come here with me, we'll do some formalities."

You wait until Molly's family and secretary go to another room. You just listen, because you can't find strength to lift your head up. When you are sure you're alone expect Molly, you call:

"But... Why?" It's all you manage to get out.

"I don't think you are a bad person. Officer told me you haven't done anything serious before, this was your first time. And i feel like it was mostly our, especially mine fault." You hear that she is close to you, but... She thinks that it was their fault? You manage to look at her, just to see her... worried? That is really confusing.

"Your fault?"

"You don't believe me, do you? You came from some other world, it was the first time you saw someone like us. No doubt you were scared. We could be more gentle to you. You were just defending yourself. Will you forgive me."

And it goes again. Will she never stop confusing you? Why she wants YOU to forgive HER?

"Umm.... But... Err..." You almost can't talk.

"Something happened?" She looks really worried as she leans closer to you. She probably didn't understand you.

"No no no." You reassure her hastily. "It's just... I don't know why you want me to forgive you."

"Sorry, you're probably still a little scared of me." That's true. "I don't doubt that, It's not your world. I'm sorry for nearly eating you."

You start to relax a little. She won't do anything serious to you, at least if you won't offend her.

"I don't think I'm worthy of something like this." You bow your head down again. "I've tried to kill you first, It was just your way of defending yourself."

"Maybe, but you've stopped yourself alone. If not my mother, i would eat you. Please, forgive me."

"You don't need to be sorry for that. You've done a lot for me by considering me as a person. That saved my life." You see her expression, you think you need to say something. "If you really want to know, i forgave you, when you accepted my apologies."

That really made her happy. You find yourself being "hugged" right under her breasts, which is embarrassing a little.

"Thank you, umm..." She pulled you away from her breasts, which you were somehow pleasant of.

"Name's Keane. Could you put me down, please."

"Sorry, I forgot myself. Here you are." She puts you gently on where you were standing before.

"Thanks for everything." You just stare at each other, when you turn around and start going to the door.

"And where do you think you're going, Keane?"

"Err... To see the doctor? So I will wait here for, I don't know, until someone pick me up."

"I thought you will come with us." She looks really sad, but you think this is too much of kindness you are worthy of.

"Sorry, but i think you are too"

"Please." She interrupted you. She sounds very pleading. You struggle under her look, but decide to give up.

"Fine, if you really want that." After that you find yourself being cuddled again into her t-shirt.

"Sorry, forgot myself again. Anyway, i haven't introduced myself. Molly Sixclaw. Call me Molly." She is really happy that you agreed to stay with her. You remember how her mother told something about no "person" living with them.

"No problem Molly. After all you've saved my life. I just fell bad for trying to kill someone so nice."

"Don't worry. You haven't killed me, so let's just forget about it, OK?"

You are happy of that. "All right. Thanks for everything."

"No problem Keane. By the way." She silences her voice. But why? "I see you like them." She have some weird grin on her face.

"Who?" You've got no clue what she is talking about.

"My breasts, you silly." Now you get really embarrassed and "red". She just laughs at that, making you even more embarrassed. "Don't worry, I won't tell anyone."

"I hope so." You fell a little angry at her, but it passes quickly. She is too nice (and big) to be angry at her.

She just winks at you. You feel like you will have some occasions to play with her (or maybe her play with you?). "Anyway, we need to go finish some last formalities, then we will go home."

You nod and Molly takes you to the rest of her family.
151112212221.title: What?! You're a person.

1511122122211.content:
You walk in the waiting room. You're sitting on Molly's left paw. But almost immediately the police officer comes to her.

"I just need your signature here and you're free to go" She pointed to some documents she held.

"Of course." Molly put something on one of her right paw claw, probably some pen, and signed these papers.

"That's all. Goodbye." And she left the room. Then Molly gets to her family.

"I see you're settled." Father speaks up. "I should introduce ourselves. I'm Mark Sixclaws, this is my wife Catherine and son Billy. I think you know Molly already?"

"I'm Keane, n-nice to meet you." But he heard doubt in your voice.

"It's nice that you want to be polite, but we won't hurt you. You don't need to be scared. I know we've made bad first impression but we didn't know you're not from here."

"I understand. I didn't make good impression too."

"Good that we understand each other." Then Mark looked at his watch. "I think we should get going, it's getting late."

You walked out of the police station and got in the car. You could see that the sun is already hiding behind the horizon. That test must have took longer than you thought. It takes 15 minutes to get to Molly's house. When you walk out of car, still in Molly's paw but now in her right, you look at her house. For you it's enormous, like some skyscraper. For her it's normal sized house. You walk in.

"Maybe I'll show you the house later, I bet you're hungry. It was 6 hours after all."

"6 hours?! That's longer that I thought. So I was there for at least 4 hours? Don't tell me you were waiting for me for so long." You could feel the effects of going for so long without food.

"Well, others couldn't wait. They went for some shopping."

"Others? You mean..."

"Yes, I stayed. I thought that's something i must do."

"So you decided to keep me even before knowing my life?"

"Yes, Is it that surprising?" During your talk you already got to the kitchen. Molly left you (still stunned( on counter next to the fridge and opened it to look inside.

"You like cheese?" She looked at you.

"Y-Yeah" It's all you can say.

She takes out cheese and some bread. She makes sandwich for her and cuts some piece of cheese for you. You get to eat it without hesitation, you're really hungry. You finish before Molly and wait for her to finish.

"Thanks for waiting for me. I know you didn't need to do it."

"No problem. But I think I'll show you home tomorrow, it's too late today. Where do you want to sleep?"

"Maybe there?" You point to some cupboard close to the window. It looked like Molly wanted to object for a moment, but stopped herself. She moved you there.

"Wait here, I'll prepare something." She goes somewhere, but is back in few minutes with something like match box filled with cotton. She put it next to you.

"Goodnight. Sleep well." And she leaves with a smile. You go and lay in your bed.
1511122122211.title: Rest of family is nice too.

15111221222111.content:
You lay in bed, waiting. You planned it for some time already. You can't stay here, you must get back to your world. you wait for half hour, just to be sure that everyone are asleep. Then you go out of your bed and use the curtain to get to the ground. Then you go to the front door, but when you are moving from kitchen to corridor... you see Molly. And she notices you. She comes to you and crouches.

"Where are you going?" You just look at side. You can't find courage to tell her truth. You stay like this for a minute, until Molly makes her move.

"I-I understand." And much to your surprise, she stands up and opens front door slightly, so you could just slip by. Then she walks past you to the kitchen.

On an impulse, you go to the door, but something stops you just before walking trough it. You still want to go, but one thing troubles you.

She was crying.

She was really crying. It wasn't joke or something like this. Even now, if you concentrated, you could hear her cries. But what's surprising in it? She tried... no, she was good for you. She trusted you, gave you home. And what you do in return? You are trying to escape. Only thing that Molly did wrong was her attempt to eat you... but now when you think of it, she probably just wanted to scare you. Maybe it was just coincidence, but she didn't eat any of those cooked humans.

You even didn't give her any real chance. But she already showed you that she cares for you.

You stayed there, couldn't decide what to do. But finally you managed to make decision you were later proud of.
