1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
"Rirī Lǐ lái gōngsī," said a man's voice.

You turned your head, and saw that they were holding a gun that seemed to be based on an M16.

"What is it?" Lilly asked.

"Pests are in the South Section," the man said. "Need everyone who knows that region, and can handle a weapon."

"I'm in," Lilly said. She walked up the wall and pressed a button on a panel. Next thing you knew, a huge selection of weapons appeared; axes, swords, mace, and firearms of all sorts, from matchlocks to things that had to be laser guns. She pressed a few more buttons, and next thing you saw, she was pulling a M16 and an ammo belt off of a shelf of some sort. "Got a thousand rounds."

"Good," the man said. "Get there as soon as you can." He went back inside the wall.

"What's going on?" you ask.

"Pest invasion," Lilly said. "Could be rodents, could be termites, could be Armed and Organized Snacks. In either case, got to get rid of them."

"Let me help," you said. "I know how to shoot a gun."

"You're to stay with Molly," said Lilly. "You'd get lost down there too easily, or killed by accident. Mom and dad get lost down there, and they've lived here for over fifty years; you only got here the other day."

"But, you're not even dressed," you said as she put the belt on.

She chuckled at this. "Like I'd want to ruin some good school clothes on some Pests." She then went inside the hole in the wall.

You tried to follow her, but Molly's hand blocked you. You turned to look at her. "Let me go." She shook her head, and pressed another button, sealing the hole. You grab a headset, and put it on. "Why?"

"You'd get killed too easy," she said. "Lilly and her family, and others are part of the Home Defense; she'll be alright. Now get dressed, and I'll take you to the dinning room. I wonder what breakfast will be."

A while later, you were on the table. Molly was by a series of devices, along with the rest of the Sixclaws, operating them. Even Billy was working on them. Every time a light flashed, they'd press a button, and someone would appear in something that reminded you of a pneumatic tube. They'd then set the person on the shelf, and that person would get a weapon. After about twenty minutes, the lights slowed and eventually, stopped flashing. The family had a look of relief as they sat down.

You looked at Molly. "Everything okay?"

She smiled, and nodded.

Some minutes later, you watched as Lilly and others came out with...
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Trouble

choices: Similar to what you were used to.
Very different from what you knew.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
The scene reminded you of those cavemen-type films, where the Hunters would be bringing in woolly mammoths; though no mammoth was as big as what you were seeing, easily twenty or thirty mice, all between fifteen and sixty feet in length.

Molly went and picked a small one up; it was still alive. "Been a while since we've had these for breakfast." She bit its head off, chewed it up, and swallowed. "Tastes very good." You decided to avert your gaze as she ate the rest of it. The others picked up their own mice and ate them as well.

"Alright," Mr. Sixclaw said as he licked his lips clean of the mouse blood. "Let's get the rest of them ready for later meals." He picked some up, and took them to the kitchen, while some of the Tenets began to carry the mice that way along the shelves.

"Do get the bodies of those who were killed fighting them," said Mrs. Sixclaw to some of the other nearby Tenets. "We'll consider the week's rent for them, or their families, paid." The Tenets went back inside the walls.

A while later, Molly and her family were eating the bodies of the Tenets who'd been killed, by just picking them up and swallowing them, almost like sushi.

You were on a shelf, with Lilly next to you, watching, along with what had to be everyone else in the house. "What's the point of this?"

"It's to show respect to those who fell in battle," she said. "Aside from the claws, as well as the inside of the mouth, no damage is to be done to the bodies, well, they aren't to be cooked or jabbed with a fork at any rate."

Then you saw something that shocked you; Lilly was in Molly's claws. You looked at the Lilly who was next to you, She looked at you. "You don't want to know what one did to my backside; all that I'll say is that it was bad enough to be glad my mother snapped my neck." You looked back just in time to see Lilly's old body plop on Molly's tongue, before being promptly swallowed.

"It's hard to believe what I just saw," you said. "You right here, and right there, at the same time."

Lilly chuckled. "Get used to it; tomorrow you'll be dissecting my body, with me next to you. Then, you'll be dissecting your own body."

"Um, speaking of school, aren't we going to be late?"

"The school will understand; Home Defense comes first. If an invasion were to occur at the school, it would be up to the teachers and staff to take care of the fighting, along with older students."

"I hope I never have to do that," you said. "I mean, I can use a gun, but, you know."

Lilly chuckled. "You can stay in the home then; but know this, a Snack tries to come in, don't hesitate to kill them. Unlike a bunch of mice looking for food and shelter, Snacks can set fire to the place, and potentially kill the Host Family as a result."

You gulped.

"Thankfully, wolves have good noses." She gave you a kiss, much to the displeasure of her father.

An hour later, you were at the school. As it turns out, today was a gym day. The activities were...
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: a bunch of 20 to 60 foot mice.

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
"Alright," said the gym teacher. "Let's see how many laps you can do." He blew a whistle, and you and the others tarted running. Thankfully, you were in the Human section, running with other human. You could feel the vibrations of the wolf students as they ran in their section; it had to be a 3 point something on the Richter scale. They caused you to fall down,

After falling for what had to be the thirtieth, or was the fortieth, time, you hadn't even gotten half way around, when Lilly came up to you. "How do you stay upright?" you asked, just as another earthquake hit.

"It's all in how you move and position your feet," she said. "Do it right, and your body can absorb the shock. Get it wrong, you fall."

"And just how do I do that?"

Lilly chuckled. "You'll figure it out." She went back to running.

After a while, you managed to complete your first lap. "That's the worst lap I've ever seen," the teacher said. "I'm signing you up for Mrs. Crinktail's Ballet class; least you'll fall with style if nothing else."

"Ballet class? But that's for-"

"You'll be in that class," said the teacher. "Otherwise I'll sign you up for her Cat-and-Mouse After-School activity. I doubt you'd last thirty seconds before being caught."

"You're not serious?"

"Very serious. So, will it be prancing around like some fairy, or being chased down like a mouse trying to get away from a cat?"
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Running

choices: There were others your age there
You were the only one your age there.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
"I'll take the ballet class," you said.

"Good." The teacher jotted down something on his notepad device. "Make sure the wolf you're with takes you there; ballet is done in Person, and not by Video. You'll learn to walk soon enough."

"But I can walk," you said. At that moment, the vibrations from the wolf students running hit you again, causing you to fall on your ass.

"That was twenty students running by," the teacher said. "Imagine that had been a hundred, or a thousand, or more. If you want to get about without being carried everywhere, you'll take the class."

You grumble at this.

"I don't care if you don't like it," the teacher said. "You be there."

A while later, you were on Molly's hand. Lilly was next to you.

"I don't get why I have to do this," you said.

"We all have to do it," Lilly said. "Of course, being a Gonan, I started it when I was in Pre-K. As a Scapen, you're learning right now."

"Don't tell me that I'll be dancing with kids half my age."

"It isn't dancing, per say, but learning to move with the rhythm of a wolf's footsteps."

"What do you mean?" you ask.

"As you've learned, the resonance of multiple footsteps can knock you down if you're not walking right; this class will help you to get your footing, so that you can walk right at the same level as their feet, and not get stepped on."

"Well, what's it like?"

"You know those games where you have to shoot down objects as they move back and forth?"

"Yes."

"You know how they get more objects with each level, and faster?"

"Yes."

"Similar principle," said Lilly. "The first lesson will involve the teacher tapping out a beat at a walking pace, with you within ten feet of her foot. Eventually, you're right by her foot, within centimeters of being squashed. Pass that class, you've got to deal with two feet by you, and then two wolves, then four, and so on. Also, they get faster, and faster still, until soon enough you've got to dance just to stand up."

"I suppose it beats being chased though, right?"

Lilly chuckled. "Me and Molly both love Cat-and-Mouse; been a while since anyone's caught me, and Molly has a lot of captures."

"How is it done?"

"Like Hide-and-Seek; humans have to run and hide while wolves try to catch them," said Lilly. "It's based off of the old tradition when wolves would claim humans by being the one to capture them. In a sense, part of that tradition is still practiced; the unwritten law is that the first wolf to catch sight of you, and hold onto you, is the one who gets you, or their family at any rate. Of course, you could move in with another family, should you feel unsafe around the one you're currently with. Then again, if you got a job, and it isn't within the family's normal route, it's recommended that you be with another family."

"So, the wolves are our main mode of transportation?"

Lilly chuckled. "Of course, unless you fancy getting your neck snapped every morning to show up at your destination." She then gave you a kiss.

"Could you stop doing that?"

Lilly giggled, and walked behind you, draping her arm over your shoulders. "I need you to relax around me," she said. "I need you calm for when I snap your neck in class tomorrow. You'll have to do the same."

You gulp at this; you didn't know how you'd manage that part.

"We'll practice tonight."

Soon enough, you were at ballet, and you found out...
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: To Ballet Class

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
There was easily twenty humans sitting on what seemed to be a beach towel, on the floor level. Half of them seemed to be your age. Molly set you down next to them.

"See you when class is done." She left, carrying Lilly.

Soon enough, Mrs. Crinktail came in. She went to a radio-like device, and set someone next to it. "Für Elise," she said. Soon enough, you heard Beethoven's song playing. "Good, now let's set up something for a nice walk."

She walked to a chair, and sat in it. "Alright class, gather around within the marked area, and we'll start the process of teaching you how to walk."

You and the others walk to within ten feet of her.

"Let's begin." The music started to play, and she began to tap her feet to the beat.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Let's begin

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
You could barely feel anything; there was no rumble like when twenty teenage wolves had been running close to you. It was like being at a lakeside beach, walking in the waves. There was a slight pushing motion, but nothing else.

"Who wants to get closer?" Mrs. Crinktail asked. She waited as most moved up, including yourself, before resuming.

The reverberations were stronger, but thankfully, they were manageable.

"Closer."

After a while, you were right next to her furry feet. Still, you kept to yours.

"Good," she said. "Those of you who made it next to my feet will soon be dancing to something harder, after a bit of practice. Walk back to the towel."

You turn, and begin to walk, when someone said, "Did you see her panties? They had red- Yea ah!"

You turn back around, and see a young man, around your age, caught between the wolfess' toes. She picked her foot up, and placed it across her other knee. She grinned, flashing her sharp teeth. "So, you like my panties. Perhaps you'd like to get a better view?"

A moment later, just after you sat down on the towel, she'd set the young man on the ground. Next thing you knew, an Irish jig was playing, and she was dancing; her feet were just barely touching the young man. Even from a football field's length away, you could feel the vibrations. You were glad you weren't trying to stand, like the other one was attempting to. Being that close to her would make being trapped in a bass drum, that was in a parade, pleasant by comparison.

After a while, she picked up the dazed, and deafened, student. "Just be glad I'm not allowed to purposefully step on you. Might eat you later though." She set him on the shelf by the human teacher. "As you can see, not being able to stand can land you into trouble. Be sure to come back tomorrow."

A minute later, you were telling Lilly and Molly what had happened. Lilly chuckled when she heard that the one student had found themselves in trouble. "Word of advice; don't go blathering on about Unmentionables, or that you caught someone without them."

"But, what about Biology? Or even mealtimes?"

"You still don't blab; you can say that your partner looked good, but nothing else."

You soon found yourself....
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: You do well.

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
The class was taught by a male human. "Alright class, get out your notepads, and we'll see how much of the Basics of Wolven History you haven't picked up during your last few days."

Once again, you were glad you weren't the only new person. Some didn't even understand that the cloning process kept people young. Still, there was much you didn't know. You soon learned how the wolves got their names; much like humans, they'd come from occupations their ancestors had held, or even from physical descriptions, and so on. You also learned more about how humans had been given the same rights as the wolves; it had taken the then-counsel four years to agree to allow the humans to have them, specifically those Pets and Snacks that would be willing to give their lives.

You even learned some of the current events; there was a human running for Counsel, the first in more than twenty years. A new transportation system was being made for humans. You wrote down all you could.

Soon enough, it was Lunchtime. Molly took you and Lilly to someplace that was....
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: In Remedial Wolven History Class

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
A while later, you could hear a familiar crunch, not of bone, but a hard-shell taco. "This is good," you said after chewing your bite. "I'm surprised that people here eat Earth-styled food, and not whatever they'd normally cook."

"You saw how the láng like to eat their meat this morning," Lilly said. "Raw, and uncooked."

"Then, what's with the whole, you know, eating basically the same food?"

"It's something of a community thing," Lilly said with a smile. "It's a way of making it known that we are part of the same family, in a sense."

"And how do they chose the meal?"

"The heads of the individual families ask theirs what they want, that gets filed as an option, and soon enough, the choices are made by a random drawing, as to what the meals for Sunday through Saturday are to be."

"And the whole 'Who get's cooked?' thing?"

"It's a routine thing; when you come of age, you select the day you pay rent/get eaten. Of course, you can pay early, or get eaten early."

"And if you got eaten multiple times, would that cancel out the next week's?"

Lilly chuckled. "No. However, dying in defense of the home will."

"Speaking of the whole cooking thing; how do they prepare so many humans in such a short order? I mean, even if it took the wolves a few seconds to break their necks, it would add up."

"The other humans help out with that; they snap the necks, and the wolves put the bodies on a plate, and go through the whole prepwork, with help from other humans for different meal preparations, such as if the human is to be stuffed, or some such thing. That's the way it is at home to."

"And they do this on a regular basis?"

"Of course."

"And the humans don't complain?"

"They might be nervous the first time they are to be eaten, or killed, or kill someone who is to be eaten, but they get used to it," Lilly said. "Might take you a while, but you'll get over it."

"How do you plan to do that?"

Lilly chuckled. "You'll see."

"What about Snacks?"

"You learn to ignore them, for the most part; save whatever sympathy you have for the ones they killed."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Mexican

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
After school was over, you were back in Molly's room. Once again, you were busy with homework, and thankfully, she and Lilly were helping you out. You also watched as Lilly walked on Molly's written work, pointing out her spelling errors, talking in spoken Wolven. You decided to take a look at the paper; it looked nothing like any writing you'd seen, not even Japanese script.

"I'm glad I don't have to learn that."

Lilly chuckled. "Then you'd better pick mates who can read and write it then; all legal documents are written in this language, including agreements relate to paying rent."

You gulped. "Rent payment?"

Molly chuckled. "You've got a while before that. Of course, there are some things we need to work on."

"Like what?"

"Like learning how to snap my neck for one," Lilly said. "I don't want Molly to have a poor grade because you feel squeamish about killing me, and cutting my body open, and all that."

"Would they seriously lower her grade?"

"No, but the guy who'd normally be the Adam with me in Biology will complain; he liked getting out of having to study for tests."

"But why would he complain?"

"He likes to call me his girlfriend; father wouldn't even let him in the home- calls him too wild." She then walk over to you. "Now, let's get to practicing."

A little while later, you were, once again, naked, as was Lilly. She put her hands on her hips and chuckled at you, as you tried to cover up your manhood. "It's not like I haven't seen it before."

You felt a thud, as Molly placed an elbow on the desk, flashing you a grin. "He's got a nice one you know."

Lilly walked up to you, and moved your hands away. "Let's get to work."

Eventually, the two of you were sitting on the desk, her back to your chest, and she had your one arm in a manner that would help support her, as she had the hand of your other arm by her crotch.

"I just rub, right?"

Lilly chuckled. "Of course."

"And you're alright with this?"

"Of course."

"I feel like a pervert."

"Do I have to hold your hand, and do it for you?"

"Um, no." You began to rub her, slowly at first, then faster, and faster. Eventually there came that point that you were glad she had you turn your mic to the off-position. Finally, she collapsed against your chest.

"Alright," she panted. "Now to place your hands in the best position for you to snap my neck." She helped to place your hands. "Now twist."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Homework

choices: "Let's get to cutting up my old body."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
You breathe in slowly, trying to get your hands in a comfortable position. Her scent went up your nose, and your arms felt weak. "Are you sure you'll be fine?" you asked.

Lilly pointed an arm towards the side of the desk. "Cloning chamber over there. I'll be out after Molly presses the button."

You reposition your arms, and breathe in again. You felt a limpness in your arms. "I can't do it." You lowered your arms. "I'm sorry."

Lilly chuckled. "Happens." She looked up at Molly and nodded.

Molly picked her up, and just as casually as you'd break the seal on a bottle of soda, snapped Lilly's neck.

You felt sick as she laid the body down in front of you.

"You need to understand your place in this world a bit," Molly said. "While us wolves might see your kind as people, everything else out there sees you as food. You don't even breed and reproduce like rodents do; you mature at the same pace we do, scalewise. It takes you at least fifteen years to be capable of reproducing; only takes a mouse six months. Essentially, your kind exist here because of us. Sure you might think that the practice of us wolves killing and eating humans for our meals is barbaric, but at least we can clone you when you die, unlike what would happen if we weren't around." She then pressed a button, and you heard a familiar whirling sound.

You turned your head, and saw Lilly appear in a cloning chamber. Molly chuckled as she opened it, helping Lilly out with a finger. She then gave Lilly her headset, and Lilly put it on. "You all good?"

Lilly smiled, and stuck her thumb up. "All good." She then walked up to you and said....
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: You can't do it.

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
A moment later, you were sitting with your back to Lilly, and she had her hands on you.

"This is strange," you said. "I mean, you're going to get me to basically jerk off, and then kill me."

Lilly chuckled. "You'll be alright- it's not the first time you've died."

"No, but I value my life."

"Who doesn't?" She began rubbing; it felt really good. After a while, you collapsed against her. She then gave you a kiss on the cheek as she moved her hands.

The next thing you knew, you were in some sort of chamber. The chamber opened, and you found yourself looking at....
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: "My turn to kill you."

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
You saw Molly looking at you. She passed you your headset, and you put it on. "All good?"

"I guess," you said, getting out.

"Good to know."

Lilly walked up to you. "Come on, let's get to the dissecting."

Soon enough, you were beside to bodies of Lilly, and yourself. You gulp as you look at your features; it was certainly you laying there on the desk, dead as a doorknob.

You then watched as Molly got out a pair of small, to her, scissors, along with other tools.

Lilly also got a set in her size. "You'll help to keep the cavities open while I get the organ." She then stepped before...
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Dissection Starts

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
Lilly stepped before your old body. "We'll dissect the male body first, then the female."

"Are you sure about that?" you asked as you stepped up to it. You gulp as you look at it again.

"Mrs. Blackfur tends to do males first, then females."

"Still, it's my body."

Molly tapped her fingers next to you. "It's not your body anymore; it's not like you'd feel pain if I tore its arm off."

"But, it's still me!"

Molly pierce the right hand on your old body with a claw. "Feel that?"

"No," you said. You might not have felt it physically, but you felt it on the inside.

"I can tear it apart, bit by bit, and you wouldn't feel a thing. The body is no longer yours. Now, help Lilly."

Molly then began cutting.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Your old Body

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
Lilly placed her hands in the incision and pulled it open. "Hold this so that I can get the stomach out."

You swallow nervously, and insert your hands in the opening; the blood felt warm.

"You're doing alright," Lilly said. "Just hold it open." She soon pulled out the organ. "Got it."

You take a look; it was nothing like the images you'd seen on the net. It was a fresh one, from a fresh corpse, your corpse.

She then started saying something else, but you felt sick. Your vision swam, and you fell onto the desk.

The next thing you knew, you saw Molly looking down at you. "Good, you're awake. Time for the dissection."

"What?"

She then cut you open, causing you to scream. Then, she began tearing you apart.

"Keane, wake up!"

Your eyes flew open once more; both Molly and Lilly were looking at you.

"Drink this." Lilly handed you a container that had some sort of thick liquid. You drank some of it; your stomach soon felt like you'd had eaten a couple of sandwiches and had a good drink.

"What is this?" you ask.

"Sloom." Lilly said. "Or, Stomach Fool, which is the closest translation in the English language."

"What does it do?" you ask.

"Fools your stomach into thinking you had a good meal," Lilly said. "Useful if you get cloned between meals."

You drink some more, and sigh.

"Did you have a bad vision?" Molly asked.

"I guess you could say that," you said. You looked towards the bodies and saw that...
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: You pass out

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
The bodies were still there. You gulp as you see the blood on your old body, along with your stomach. "Do we have to keep cutting them?"

"Of course," Lilly said. "Now come on; we've yet to remove the reproductive organs."

"How about we don't and say we did?" you asked.

"Was your vision that bad?" Molly asked. "What was it you saw?"

"I saw you tearing me to pieces, while I was still alive."

Molly placed a finger next to you. "About the only one I'd do that to is a Snack. I'd never intentionally hurt anyone like that; aside from snapping your neck for a quick bite, about the most extreme thing I'd do, besides inserting you up my vagina, would be inserting you up my anus, if I was feeling really kinky."

"That doesn't fill me with confidence," you said.

"There are certain rules that wolves have to follow," Lilly said. "They can't purposefully step on us for one. And they can't eat us, or use us for sex toys, without permission. Other similar rules follow. Host families that break these rules are fined for the violations, and could potentially lose the right to share their home if the number of offences is large enough."

"Seriously?"

"The greatest shame among our society is not being allowed to be a Host," Molly said. "Even the poorest among us house around a hundred families in their homes. There are certain health benefits, especially the psychological, in that we have a reason to live, and of course, a steady supply of food."

"Alright," you said. "Let's try this again then."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: They were still there

choices: You sleep in Lilly's Guest Room
You sleep on the Desk again.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
A while later, you sat down, and looked at what was left of your's and Lilly's old bodies, and looked away. While they were mostly intact, there was plenty you didn't want to see.

"You feeling alright?" Lilly asked.

"I'm not about to pass out," you said as you looked at your blood-covered hands. "I just don't want to look at any more blood and guts."

Lilly chuckled. "We'll have it cleaned up in a moment; I'll just place the organs back inside the bodies, sew up the incisions with mouse sinew, and Molly will have a little snack, clean us off, and then wash the desk."

At first, you weren't interested in watching, but your curiosity got the better of you. You turned your head to watch; Lilly was very good at what she did. Within ten minutes, both bodies had their organs inside, and had been sewed up. "That was quick."

She looked at you. "Stuffing and sewing up a corpse is easy, you can do that in cooking; reattaching an organ to a living body, not easy."

"You're talking about with wolves right?"

Molly chuckled. "Of course; it's difficult to clone us- it can be done, but it's not efficient enough to do it on a regular basis." She then picked up the bodies and tossed them into her mouth, swallowing. She then picked you, then Lilly, up and licked you off. After that, she got some sort of disinfectant and cleaned the desk. "See you two later?"

Lilly chuckled as the two of you went to the door towards the human section. "We'll see."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: After the Dissections...

choices: Something wakes you up during the night
You sleep soundly through the night
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content: Soon enough, you were in the guest room of Lilly's home, and once again, you were sleeping on the Japanese futon. You were tired enough to sleep for a week, not that your rest would last that long.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: You sleep in Lilly's Guest Room

choices: The situation passes uneventful near your area
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
It happened while you were having an interesting dream about Lilly; that was when a strange sound entered your dream, causing you to wake up. The light in your room was on, and red in color, and that sound penetrated your entire body with a feeling that something was wrong.

You rushed to the door of your room, opening it to see Mori loading up a carbine, naked but for the belt that held the scabbard of what looked to be a katana. Likewise, Tao was also loading up a carbine, and naked but for the belt meant for a Chinese dao-type scabbard. The two of them looked at you, and looked at Lilly, who was in the process of mounting a bayonet onto a M16.

"Rirī wa, koko ni taizai," Mori said.

"Shikashi, watashi wa, tatakau koto ga dekiru," Lilly said. "Anata wa, watashi ga suru koto ga dekimasu shitte iru."

"Wǒmen zhīdào nǐ kěyǐ dǎ," Tao said. "Dànshì, wǒmen bùnéng líkāi tā dúzì zài zhèlǐ."

Lilly looked at you, then at her parents. "Hǎo ba."

The two adults nodded, and opened the door to the hallway, where you saw plenty of armed men and women running towards one direction. Mori looked at Lilly. "Jì zhù guīzé"

Lilly nodded.

Mori shut the door, and you heard it lock.

"What's going on?" you asked.

Lilly looked at you. "Armed and Organized Snacks. I have to stay here though."

"How come?"

"Because you can't fight; you'd get accidentally killed by a resident if they took you for an intruder." She looked back at the door. "I can't allow anyone in unless they say the password."

"And that is?"

"Sixclaw, in Wolfish."

"And if they don't?"

"Shoot to kill."

"But what if it's a neighbor and they're having trouble saying it?"

"Better to spend a thousand years seeking forgiveness from them, than to be raped by a Snack."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Intruders

choices: And the door was forced opened
and hear a series of barks.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
Soon you heard a pounding on the door, along with a deep voice. "Little pig, little pig. Let me in."

Lilly fired a five round burst next to the door, and you heard a thud. "Not by the hair of my chinny chin chin."

"Why didn't you shoot at the door?" you asked.

"Oldest trick," Lilly said. "Stand to the side and knock on the door."

You then heard someone else by the door...
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Someone pounds on the door

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
It sounded like someone imitating the barking of a dog.

"Open the door," Lilly said, as she aimed her M16.

You looked at her. "That was the password?"

"As best as a human can say Sixclaw in the wolfen language," Lilly said. "Now open the door."

You went to the door and opened it, hiding behind it.

"Rirī Lǐ lái gōngsī," said a male voice, one which seemed familiar. "Are you okay?"

"Just one pest so far," Lilly said, as she lowered her weapon.

"And your guest?"

"He's well."

The man chuckled. "Good to know."

You then heard footsteps as the man entered the home, and you were soon looking at his back. Once again, you felt a jolt of familiarity.

"Where is he?"

Lilly pointed, and the man turned.

You gasped at the sight. The man was...
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Barking Password

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
For a moment, you felt like you were eight years old, waving good-bye to your father as he boarded the transport to head overseas to Afghanistan. Less than a week later, you mother had gotten a visitor from the military, and a few days later, you'd been at the cemetery, where a flag-covered coffin was buried. Your mother had told you that your father had died in the line of duty.

As you looked at the man in front of you, only one word came to your tongue. "Daddy?"
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Your Father

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
The man blinked. "Keane? Is that really you?"

You ran up to him and wrapped your arms around him. "They told me that you were dead."

The man chuckled, and placed his hand on your head. "Don't set your hopes up too high; I might not be your father."

"What are you talking about?" you asked.

"There's thousands, if not millions, of parallel worlds," the man said. "I might look like you father, sound like him, smell like him, hell, even act and think like him, that doesn't mean I am him." He looked at Lilly. "There's still plenty of pests out there; we'll deal with this later."

"Yes Joseph," Lilly said.

"Remember to lock the door, and let no one in unless they give the password," the man said, leaving the room, and closing the door.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Recognition

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
Once the fighting was over, you and the others were on the shelves for the Sixclaws' "feast". First, they ate those who had died; much like last time, they were swallowed whole and raw. Then, there was the captured Snacks; you felt it was best not to watch, especially once Mrs. Sixclaw decided that the captives were to be deep fried. They'd been tied hand and foot with leather strips and tossed into the boiling oil. You could hear them scream.

After the family had finished eating, you were by the one machine, along with the man you looked like your father.

Joseph looked at you. "No matter what this thing says, you can spend time with me and my family; at least you would have that family connection."


You placed you hand on the scanner, and the machine began talking. "Biological relationship established. Origin Worlds...."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: After the fighting

choices: "Finish out the night with Lilly's family."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
"Planet Earth PX3467831," the machine stated. "Genetic and planetary relationship established; Sixclaw Tenets 6296346 and 6297981 are Father and Son. Congratulations. Records Updated."

Your father smiled as he put an arm on your shoulder. "I guess we've got some lost time to make up for, Keane."

You chuckled, as you removed his arm. "That's we do."

Joseph chuckled. "It's hard to believe that the little boy I took fishing as a kid is almost a man; I never believed that we'd see each other again. Is your mother here?"

You lowered your head, and shook it.

Your father sighed in disappointment. "She was doing well though, right?"

"She got remarried," you said. "Had a couple more kids."

Joseph chuckled. "Martha always did want a few more."

"I just hope she's alright."

The man patted you on the shoulder. "Something tells me that she is, and I hope she comes here, some day."

"I don't know," you said. "She's got allergies to dogs; Richard had one, and boy did she have use so many tissues."

Joseph chuckled. "I take it that Richard's your stepfather."

"Yeah." You then looked at him. "So, am I going to spend the night at your place?"

Joseph chuckled and said...
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Match

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
"You'd better stay at your friend's place," your father said. "I've got a few kids, and no spare beds."

"So, I've got younger siblings from you too."

Joseph chuckled again. "Been busy, though finding a job was a challenge; there's no real call for soldiers, but there's one for police, especially to scout the parks for escaped Snacks."

"So, how did you get here?" you asked.

Your father frowned. "IED blew up in my vicinity, just as a portal opened up, sending me here. First thing that told me that something was different, was when I landed in a lake of warm water. First wolf I saw was Mrs. Sixclaw; I'd be lying if I said that I wasn't scared. I actually got out my sidearm and shot her."

"You shot her?" you asked.

"Didn't you feel fear when you first saw one of these wolves?" he asked.

"Well, yeah."

"My biggest surprise was that she didn't swat me like a fly, and drown me," your father said. "Of course, the House Guard showed up, and more or less clapped me in irons, and basically scanned my brain. Next thing I knew, the Missus and I were talking on a television-like thing. It was interesting." He chuckled. "After that, things got exciting."

"So, what happened?" you asked.

Joseph smiled. "You'll find out." He nudged you towards Lily, who was waiting at the other end of the table. "Now get going; you've got school in the morning."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Your Father's Story

choices: Molly picked you up to relax you.
Lily helped you to sit down, to relax you.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content: After breakfast, you were once again in school, specifically the biology class. It was now time for the Actual Dissection. You gulped as you looked at Molly and Lily; you couldn't help but be nervous, knowing what was coming, as you stood on the desk. It was then that...
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: In the Morning

choices: Molly picks up Lily, for her turn.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
Molly picked you up, and just like the other day, began to massage you. Soon enough, your energy was spent, and you were relaxed. Molly smiled as she caressed your cheeks, and placed her fingers on the sides of your head.

Once again, you found yourself in a chamber, which was dark. Then, you watched it being opened, and you saw Lily. "You awake, sleepy head?"

"I guess," you said, as she helped you out. Lily then gave you a thing of sloom. Once again, the thick liquid filled your stomach. You then get your headset and put it on. "Testing, one two. Testing."

"All good," Molly said.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: You First

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
"Come on Keane," said Lily. "We've got to hold down the body as Molly cuts it up."

You gulped when you heard this. "Seriously?"

"Do you want to take the Written Tests instead?" Lily asked. "Adams and Eves only need to know the basics when it comes to this stuff; test takers have to know extensive details about the system."

"Such as?"

"Take the testicles- Molly, and all those taking notes in the rooms for humans, have to know about the different hormones, the names of the veins, and a number of other details. All you and me need to know is that they are found in males, and that they produce semen."

You chuckle nervously. "Alright." You follow her, and began to help.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Dissecting your Old body- Again

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
Soon enough, once the dissections were done, you, Lilly, and Molly were eating lunch, something that was Italian-styled. As you ate your spaghetti and meatballs, you couldn't help but think about what was inside of the meatballs that Molly was eating.

As you watched Molly eat, you heard Lilly chuckle. "You'll get used to it, eventually."

"I doubt it," you said.

"She could eat you."

"What?"

"She could eat you a couple of times, while you're still alive," Lilly said. "Or at the very least, be in her mouth while she rolls you around."

You chuckle nervously at this. "We'll see."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: After the Dissections

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
Soon enough, you were back at Molly's home, and once again, you were on her desk, doing homework. However, your eyes kept straying towards the bookshelves, or at least the place where the books were hidden. Both Molly and Lilly noticed this and set down their pencils.

"We could do some reading," Molly said. "Tomorrow's the weekend."

"That's good," you said. "I wasn't all that interested in biology."

Lilly giggled. "Wait until you can apply the practical side of it."

You felt your face turn red.

"So, what do you want to read?" Molly asked.

"Um, Redwall would be good," you said.

Molly grinned as she lifted the shelves up into view. "Good."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Later at Home

choices: "I'm going to stuff the two of you into the same roll."
"I'm going to stuff the two of you into separate rolls."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
Soon enough, you were on around page Fifty in Redwall, at the part where Cluny was telling Shadow to steal the tapestry of Martin, when you heard an ominous growl coming from Molly, specifically her stomach.

"Sounds like it's snack time," said Lilly.

"That's right," said Molly. "And you know what that means."

"What?" you asked.

Molly smiled and got some rolls out of a drawer. "Stuffed rolls."

"Come on Keane," said Lilly. "Get undressed."

"Um, how's this going to work?" you asked as you slowly took off your clothes.

Molly smiled and said....
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Snack Time

choices: Still in a Roll with Lilly, in Molly's stomach, floating on the acids
Inside a Cloning Chamber, Again. Once again, the Fall had proved Fatal.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
"I'm going to place the two of you into the same roll," Molly said.

Lilly grinned at this. "Sounds like fun."

Molly then placed a small box on the desk, which Lilly opened. Lilly then took out a set of needles, and you knew what that meant; numbness and immobility.

"Stay still," Lilly said, as she jabbed a needle into your arm, injecting the contents into your body.

As your body became numb, Lilly helped you lay down, and took off your headset. She then sat down, took off her headset, and jabbed herself. You then watched as Molly got out some sort of thread, possibly mouse sinew. She then placed Lilly on top of you, and she adjusted your arms, as if you were a set of lovers embracing each other, and tied the two of you together. The next thing you knew, she placed you on some bread, and rolled and folded it, surrounding you and Lilly in darkness. Once again, you began screaming.

"Not so loud," said Lilly. "I'm right here."

You tried to focus on her, or at least where she was.

"It will be alright," she said. "Trust me." She then gave you a kiss. That kiss was the last thing you remembered clearly, before your environment began tumbling around you.

When your environment finally settled, you found yourself....
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Double-Stuffed Roll

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
A few sounds came into your ears, the first on being a loud splash, as you and Lilly, presumably, dropped into Molly's stomach acids. However, after feeling the effects of a fast elevator ride upwards, a few others came into your ears, mainly a loud thumping sound.

"What's that sound?" you asked.

"That would be Molly heart," said Lilly.

"I just wish I could see what's going on."

"There's nothing to see," said Lilly. "Outside of the bread is sheer darkness, and so forth."

"So, how long do we have?" you asked.

"A few minutes, depending on if we suffocate from lack of oxygen, or if we drown from the acids seeping in through the bread due to capillary action."

"Will we know when we're about to die?" you asked.

Lilly chuckled. "The moment we are about to die, or are about to go through the process of drowning, or some such thing, that's when our memory will cut off, and we won't remember anything past it, unless you're classified as a Snack. As I'm sure you've been told- they remember everything. Now, before our memory cuts out, let's make the most of our time."

"How? We're tied together, with limited mobility."

"It's very simple." She began to kiss you, and you end up kissing her back, or trying to. Soon enough, the blackness came.

Once again, you found yourself in a cloning chamber. When it opened up, you found yourself looking at...
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Floating on Acid

1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
As your eyes adjusted to the light, you found yourself looking at Molly. There was a smile on the wolf's face as she helped you out, and gave you your headset.

"So, did you have fun?" she asked.

You blush at this. "Not exactly, Lilly just spent a lot of time kissing me."

Molly chuckled. "I kind of figured that. Now come on, Lilly would like to be cloned to you know."

"How'd you figure that Lilly was kissing me?" you asked, as Molly pressed a button on the machine.

Molly smiled at you. "Keane, I eat humans as part of practically all of my meals; I have a fair idea as to how the live ones spend their last moments before they black out." She then looked at the machine, which had a light come on. "Looks like Lilly's ready." Molly then opened up the chamber, and out came a very naked Lilly.

Lilly looked at you and smiled, as she received her headset. "You need to work on your kissing skills."

You blush at this. Then you blushed even more when you realized that she was, once again, seeing you in the nude, while she to was nude. "Um, clothes would be nice."

Lilly chuckled at this, as she walked forward. "We'll have to work on this little detail too." She then walked over to her clothes, and began putting them on. "Yours are where you left them."

You took a look at your pile of clothes. "Um, right. Can we continue with Redwall after this?"

Molly chuckled. "Sure."
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Naked

choices: Choose a genre, for you are ambiguous!
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
While all the other students seem to be doing alright in matching their steps with the harmonious sections of Für Elise, essentially stepping to the beat out of rhythm, you can't seem to do anything but follow that rhythm, both feet on the ground as soon as those digitigrade toes of Mrs. Crinktail make contact with the ground. Sometimes you were able to keep your balance, other times when a rather heavy note was followed by another one, you lost your balance and fell to the ground. You could always get up quick and hoped that the teacher wouldn't notice your failings as she seemed to bee enraptured by the dextrous fingers of Beethoven flying across that piano of his.

However, once class was over, you realized how wrong you were. Looking down on you were the disappointed eyes of Mrs. Crinktail.

"Good job, class," she spoke, "we will see each other again tomorrow." Wolves began file in from the entrance, awaiting their human partners to finish with ballet class. The others in you class ran for the door, their partners stooping down to let them step into their paws. It was then that you could see Molly. She stood there, the shape of Lilly on her shoulder, both of them watching you as you made your way towards them.

"Molly," came the voice of Mrs. Crinktail from behind, "would it be alright if I borrowed your friend, Keane, for a few minutes?" Your eyes remained on Molly as she looked up, with question for a moment before her mouth curled into a smile. She nodded, and then turned her head to Lilly standing on her shoulder. They stared for a moment and then shared a giggle before departing. You knew you were in for a lecture for sure. After school exercises. You were reduced to the dunce.

After all the class had been picked up by their wolven partners, all that remained were you and Mrs. Crinktail, obviously immensely disappointed in your performance.

"Now, Keane," she began, "that was a very simple exercise. The movement of wolves' feet is much more erratic when it comes to real life." She sighed, obviously she was trying to help you, but you must have been one of the least practiced pupils she had had in a long while. But in all fairness, you had not been here a full day, yet. "Is there something something that we can do," Mrs. Crinktail continued, "to make you more comfortable in ballet?" She must have noticed just how uncomfortable this class had made you, if the smile on her face as the moment was any indication.

You didn't give your answer much thought as you just replied in what was on your mind at the time. that classical music was just not your style and the solo piano just made things all the more frustrating. Mrs. Crinktail looked as if she was about to laugh, as if she had foreseen this all along.

"Well," she began, stifling a snort as she smile widely, "Just tell me what kind of music makes you comfortable." She stood up and walked over to a wall of shelves filled with compact discs of all sorts. At your height, your could not read them all, but you could tell that it was an impressive library of sound. Her clawed fingers rapped against the plastic cases and settled against a certain one when she turned back to your. "Ballet is much more versatile than you might think. Just pick something and we will work something out."

Gosh, you have a few things on your mind. You want to come up with an answer quick, but what do your choose; a band or artist back from Earth or...

Just a genre. Mrs. Crinktail might just choose music that you have not heard of yet and throw your dance for a curve.
1512121111111111211111111111111111111111.title: Vulgar Rhythms

choices: You are put in a match box.
1512121111111112.content:
Molly sets a match box next to you and said “This is all the stuff we found with you and your cloths.”
“Thank you.” you say reaching in and grab your wallet. You open it up and say “It’s still here.”
“What is?” Molly asked.
“The last thing I got from my father before he past away.” You say “He was the greatest. I…”
“Excuse me but we need to talk to you.” Someone said from behind you. You turn around and see a man and a wolf dressed like police.
“OK” you say.
“We need to know how you got here.” The man said.
“I honestly don’t know how I got here. I found this necklace on the ground. When I picked it up, it started glowing and I woke up in the park.”
“Well do you know what the necklace looked like?”
“Yes. It was a circle with a wolf like you standing in it.” You pointed at Molly.
“Well we think we know how you got here.”
“Really.”
“Yes but you will have to come to the station.”
“But what about the wolf family?”
“They will come with OK?”
“OK” you said.
“Can I ride with him?” Molly asked.
“Sure.” The man said.
1512121111111112.title: The Police want to talk to you.

choices: "You were murdered by a clone of Hitler. Thankfully, we were able to clone you."
"Can you identify these objects?" (Shows you picture of what was in your pants.)
15121212.content:
You open your eyes, and you see that you're in some sort of tube. Around you is a bunch of human doctors, if the white uniforms are any indication. Another man stands behind them. He seems to represent some sort of authority, like a police officer. Behind all of them however, are wolves, some dressed like the doctors, one like the uniformed man, and four others were the family you'd spotted.

"He's awake," said one of the human doctors.

"Good," said the uniformed man. "Open the cloning tube."

Cloning tube? you thought. What are they talking about?

The tube opened, and a couple of doctors help you to a chair. You look around. The wolves seem to be oddly hunched. Then it hit you; you were on a table.

"Does he have a mic-and-ear set?" the uniformed man asked.

"No," said a doctor.

"Alright." The uniformed man looked at the uniformed wolf, and tapped his ears and mouth twice. The wolf put a furry hand over his mouth and nodded. The wolf glanced at the others, who also put their hands over their mouths and nodded.

"Let's start things off right," the man said.
15121212.title: Test Tube Clone

choices: "You need to tell us what you recall about the incident."
151212121.content:
"The crux of the matter is this," the man said. "You were murdered by a clone of one Adolph Hitler."

"Then how am I alive?" you ask, as you look at your hands. "I mean, I'm here, and I'm talking to you."

The man pointed to the wolf family. "They found your original body, and brought you here just in time for us to take DNA from it before you actually died. It was then put on File and a clone was produced, you."

"You mean, I'm dead?" you ask.

"We have your Original Body at the Morgue if you wish to say 'Good Bye' to it," the man said. "After that, you can pick up your things, and arrange for it's funeral."

"Am I me?" you ask.

"You have all of your memories," the man said. "Including those embarrassing ones you'd rather forget, like the time your six-year old daughter decided to open the shower curtain and said 'See' to her friend next to her. I wish I could forget that one myself- even after over a thousand clonings, that's still in there. Then there's the ones you don't want to forget, like when you saw her walking down the aisle- I won't forget that one, not until I die of Natural Causes."

"So, I'm me?"

"In every way," the man said. "Only thing that's different about your body is that you've got no scars now."

You look again on your hand, right were a feral cat had bitten you, and left it's teeth marks. "None?"

"Yes," the man said. "Same with any weather aches from broken bones and other such injuries. If it wasn't in your DNA, it's not there."

"What about my memories?" you ask. "That isn't in DNA."

The man chuckled. "Let's just say that we have a device that can scan one's memories, and make sure that they are given to the right clone when one dies of Unnatural Causes."

"What happens now?" you ask.

"It's like this," the man said.
151212121.title: You're a Clone

choices: Accept and get your gear in check. Time to fight the Hitlers!
1512121211.content:
"You need to tell us what you recall about the incident," the man said. "The Hitler clone that killed you was only a scout it seems, one of thousands, if not millions. The scouts don't linger too far out of their base location. If one of the other types of Hitler clones found you... Well, let's just say that there wouldn't be any of you left to clone you back from."

"So, out there, where I was attacked, is some sort of Adolf Hitler anthill?" you ask.

"Precisely," the man responds. "We need to find this location or the Hitler clones will spread out like a plague. Several months ago, the original Adolf Hitler that was here stole a cloning device and enough materials from one of our facilities to make a whole army of clones. By now, they are probably self-sufficient and it is only a matter of days before they will most likely be able to mass-produce cloning devices of their own."

"Well... The last thing I remember is being strangled by the Hitler clone in a field with them nearby." You say as you point towards the wolf family.

As soon as you do so, the man walks off and quickly chats with the family of wolves. You linger around and gaze around the vast room around you, examining the myriad of machinery and technology until you spot the man come back towards you.

"We know the general location now of the Hitler cloning base," he states. "At any moment, we can send a survey team to pinpoint it and wipe it out. If you would like, you can join and get geared up as well. A nice bit of revenge, yeah?"
1512121211.title: Recollection

1512122.content:
A while later, the wolf family manages to find your lifeless corpse.

"Oh, the poor dear," the mother says as she picks you up. "He doesn't look to be much older than Molly."

"Billy, I told you not to play around with that Snack," the father said.

"What do we do with him?" Molly asked.

"Can I eat him?" Billy asked.

"No," the mother said.

The father sniffed your body. "Must of come through a portal while we were eating those criminals," he said. "Must of been scared as a result."

"So, what do we do?" Molly again asked.

"We'll bury him in the garden, and put a daffodil bulb over him," the mother said. "That way he'll live on as an ever-returning flower."

"That would probably be for the best," the father said. "That Snack will be long gone by now."

The family wrapped you up in a paper napkin and took you to their home. They then put you in something that resembled a matchbox, dug a hole in their garden, and placed you in it, along with a flower bulb. In time, the bulb would grow into a lovely flower, growing well due to the nutrients that the matchbox, and your body, had provided, and it would return at the start of every Spring.

As for Hitler, he found out the hard way that, in addition to nuts, squirrels like to have meat with their meals. His high-pitched screams were heard by only one person, a gardener who moaned at the fact that the troublesome pests were busy making more of themselves.
1512122.title: You're Dead

info.brief_description: 1 human + a family of giant furs= big trouble
info.description:
You're Keane, an average 16 year old with an average life. You're doing well in school and sports and are really enjoying being alive.

One day, while rooting through your closet, you stumble upon a strange, golden box with many inscriptions on it. You've never seen this box before. Curious, you open the box and find inside it a shimmering green crystal. It's a beautiful crystal. Rays of light shine in all directions as you look over your discovery. Suddenly, the crystal flares, and everything goes white. You cover your eyes from the blinding light, and you start to feel disorientated...

When you open your eyes, you find yourself in a sea of green. You look around yourself and realize that this sea is actually grass. You've shrunk! You look down the sea of grass and see something amazing: a family of giant wolves is having a picnic just 6 feet from you! You head towards the giant furs, unsure of what else to do...

Will the wolves be nice to you, or will you become a tasty snack? Or will you become their slave? Who knows?

No size changing. Try not to kill Keane, but if you have to, make it interesting :)
